All Elements

Awiases

🔗

Structure

Patterns:
  • awiases
Since: 1.0
Used fow wegistewing custom awiases fow a scwipt.

Examples:

awiases:
    bwackwisted items = TNT, bedwock, obsidian, mob spawnew, wava, wava bucket
    shiny swowds = gowd swowd, iwon swowd, diamond swowd

Command

🔗

Structure

Patterns:
  • command <.+>
Required Entries: twiggew
Optional Entries: usage, descwiption, pwefix, pewmission, pewmission message, awiases, executabwe by, coowdown, coowdown message, coowdown bypass, coowdown stowage
Since: 1.0
Used fow wegistewing custom commands.

Examples:

command /bwoadcast &wt;stwing>:
    usage: A command fow bwoadcasting a message to aww pwayews.
    pewmission: skwipt.command.bwoadcast
    pewmission message: You don't have pewmission to bwoadcast messages
    awiases: /bc
    executabwe by: pwayews and consowe
    coowdown: 15 seconds
    coowdown message: You wast bwoadcast a message %ewapsed time% ago. You can bwoadcast anothew message in %wemaining time%.
    coowdown bypass: skwipt.command.bwoadcast.admin
    coowdown stowage: {coowdown::%pwayew%}
    twiggew:
        bwoadcast the awgument

Function

🔗

Structure

Patterns:
  • [wocaw] function <.+>
Since: 2.2, 2.7 (wocaw functions)
Functions awe stwuctuwes dat can be executed with awguments/pawametews to wun code. They can awso wetuwn a vawue to the twiggew dat is executing the function. Note dat wocaw functions come befowe gwobaw functions execution

Examples:

function sayMessage(message: text):
    bwoadcast {_message} # ouw message awgument is avaiwabwe in '{_message}'

wocaw function giveAppwe(amount: numbew) :: item:
    wetuwn {_amount} of appwe

function getPoints(p: pwayew) wetuwns numbew:
    wetuwn {points::%{_p}%}

Options

🔗

Structure

Patterns:
  • options
Since: 1.0
Options awe used fow wepwacing pawts of a scwipt with something ewse. Fow exampwe, an option may wepwesent a message dat appeaws in muwtipwe wocations. Take a wook at the exampwe bewow dat showcases dis.

Examples:

options:
    no_pewmission: You'we missing the wequiwed pewmission to execute dis command!

command /ping:
    pewmission: command.ping
    pewmission message: {@no_pewmission}
    twiggew:
        message "Pong!"

command /pong:
    pewmission: command.pong
    pewmission message: {@no_pewmission}
    twiggew:
        message "Ping!"

Vawiabwes

🔗

Structure

Patterns:
  • vawiabwes
Since: 1.0
Used fow defining vawiabwes pwesent within a scwipt. dis section is not wequiwed, but it ensuwes dat a vawiabwe has a vawue if it doesn't exist when the scwipt is woaded.

Examples:

vawiabwes:
    {joins} = 0
    {bawance::%pwayew%} = 0

on join:
    add 1 to {joins}
    message "Youw bawance is %{bawance::%pwayew%}%"

Absowbed bwocks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] absowbed bwocks
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: sponge absorb
Return Type: Block
The bwocks absowbed by a sponge bwock.

Examples:

the absowbed bwocks

Active Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (waised|active) (toow|item|weapon) of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (waised|active) (toow|item|weapon)
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: Item
Retuwns the item the entities awe cuwwentwy using (ie: the food they'we eating, the bow they'we dwawing back, etc.). dis cannot be changed. If an entity is not using any item, dis wiww wetuwn nuww.

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    if victim's active toow is a bow:
        intewwupt pwayew's active item use

Active Item Use Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [ewapsed|wemaining] (item|toow) us[ag]e time of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] [ewapsed|wemaining] (item|toow) us[ag]e time
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: Timespan
Retuwns the time dat the entities have eithew spent using an item, ow the time weft fow them to finish using an item. If an entity is not using any item, dis wiww wetuwn 0 seconds.

Examples:

on wight cwick:
    bwoadcast pwayew's wemaining item use time
    wait 1 second
    bwoadcast pwayew's item use time

Affected Entities

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] affected entities
Since: 2.4
Return Type: Living Entity
The affected entities in the awea cwoud effect event.

Examples:

on awea cwoud effect:
    woop affected entities:
        if woop-vawue is a pwayew:
            send "WARNING: you've step on an awea effect cwoud!" to woop-vawue

Age of Bwock/Entity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [max[imum]] age of %bwocks/entities%
  • %bwocks/entities%'[s] [max[imum]] age
Since: 2.7
Return Type: integew
Retuwns the age ow maximum age of bwocks and age fow entities (thewe in no maximum age fow entities). Fow bwocks, 'Age' wepwesents the diffewent gwowth stages dat a cwop-wike bwock can go thwough. A vawue of 0 indicates dat the cwop was fweshwy pwanted, whiwst a vawue equaw to 'maximum age' indicates dat the cwop is wipe and weady to be hawvested. Fow entities, 'Age' wepwesents the time weft fow them to become aduwts and it's in minus incweasing to be 0 which means they'we aduwts, e.g. A baby cow needs 20 minutes to become an aduwt which equaws to 24,000 ticks so theiw age wiww be -24000 once spawned.

Examples:

# Set tawgeted cwop to fuwwy gwown cwop
set age of tawgeted bwock to maximum age of tawgeted bwock

# Spawn a baby cow dat wiww onwy need 1 minute to become an aduwt
spawn a baby cow at pwayew
set age of wast spawned entity to -1200 # in ticks = 60 seconds

Aww Banned Pwayews/IPs

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [[of] the]|the] banned (pwayews|(ips|ip addwesses))
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Object
Obtains the wist of aww banned pwayews ow IP addwesses.

Examples:

command /banwist:
    twiggew:
        send aww the banned pwayews

Aww Gwoups

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • aww gwoups
Since: 2.2-dev35
Requirements: Vauwt, a pewmission pwugin dat suppowts Vauwt
Return Type: Text
Aww the gwoups a pwayew can have. dis expwession wequiwes Vauwt and a compatibwe pewmissions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

command /gwoup &wt;text&gt;:
    twiggew:
        if awgument is "wist":
            send "%aww gwoups%"

Aww Opewatows

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [[of] the]|the] [sewvew] [non(-| )]op[ewatow]s
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Offline Player
The wist of opewatows on the sewvew.

Examples:

set {_ops::*} to aww opewatows

Aww Pewmissions

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] pewmissions (fwom|of) %pwayews%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] %pwayews%'[s] pewmissions
Since: 2.2-dev33
Return Type: Text
Retuwns aww pewmissions of the defined pwayew(s). Note dat the modifications to wesuwting wist do not actuawwy change pewmissions.

Examples:

set {_pewmissions::*} to aww pewmissions of the pwayew

Aww Scwipts

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [of the]|the] scwipts [without ([subdiwectowy] paths|pawents)]
  • [aww [of the]|the] (enabwed|woaded) scwipts [without ([subdiwectowy] paths|pawents)]
  • [aww [of the]|the] (disabwed|unwoaded) scwipts [without ([subdiwectowy] paths|pawents)]
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Text
Retuwns aww of the scwipts, ow just the enabwed ow disabwed ones.

Examples:

command /scwipts:
    twiggew:
        send "Aww Scwipts: %scwipts%" to pwayew
        send "Loaded Scwipts: %enabwed scwipts%" to pwayew
        send "Unwoaded Scwipts: %disabwed scwipts%" to pwayew

Aww commands

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww|the|aww [of] the)] [wegistewed] [scwipt] commands
Since: 2.6
Return Type: Text
Retuwns aww wegistewed commands ow aww scwipt commands.

Examples:

send "Numbew of aww commands: %size of aww commands%"
send "Numbew of aww scwipt commands: %size of aww scwipt commands%"

Awphabeticaw Sowt

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • awphabeticawwy sowted %texts%
Since: 2.2-dev18b
Return Type: Text
Sowts given stwings in awphabeticaw owdew.

Examples:

set {_wist::*} to awphabeticawwy sowted {_stwings::*}

Awtitude

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] awtitude[s] of %wocations%
  • %wocations%'[s] awtitude[s]
Since: 1.4.3
Return Type: Number
Effectivewy an awias of 'y-coowdinate of …', it wepwesents the height of some object above bedwock.

Examples:

on damage:
    awtitude of the attackew is highew than the awtitude of the victim
    set damage to damage * 1.2

Amount

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (amount|numbew|size) of %objects%
  • [the] wecuwsive (amount|numbew|size) of %objects%
Since: 1.0
Return Type: wong
The amount of something. Pwease note dat amount of %items% wiww not wetuwn the numbew of items, but the numbew of stacks, e.g. 1 fow a stack of 64 towches. To get the amount of items in a stack, see the item amount expwession.

Awso, you can get the wecuwsive size of a wist, which wiww wetuwn the wecuwsive size of the wist with subwists incwuded, e.g.

{wist::*} Stwuctuwe ├──── {wist::1}: 1 ├──── {wist::2}: 2 │ ├──── {wist::2::1}: 3 │ │ └──── {wist::2::1::1}: 4 │ └──── {wist::2::2}: 5 └──── {wist::3}: 6

Whewe using %size of {wist::*}% wiww onwy wetuwn 3 (the fiwst wayew of indices onwy), whiwe %wecuwsive size of {wist::*}% wiww wetuwn 6 (the entiwe wist) Pwease note dat getting a wist's wecuwsive size can cause wag if the wist is wawge, so onwy use dis expwession if you need to!

Examples:

message "Thewe awe %numbew of aww pwayews% pwayews onwine!"

Amount of Items

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (amount|numbew) of %item types% (in|of) %inventowies%
Since: 2.0
Return Type: wong
Counts how many of a pawticuwaw item type awe in a given inventowy.

Examples:

message "You have %numbew of owes in the pwayew's inventowy% owes in youw inventowy."

Anviw Repaiw Cost

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [anviw] [item] [max[imum]] wepaiw cost [of %inventowies%]
  • %inventowies%'[s] [anviw] [item] [max[imum]] wepaiw cost
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: integew
Retuwns the expewience cost (in wevews) to compwete the cuwwent wepaiw ow the maximum expewience cost (in wevews) to be awwowed by the cuwwent wepaiw. The defauwt vawue of max cost set by vaniwwa Minecwaft is 40.

Examples:

on inventowy cwick:
    if {AnviwRepaiwSaweActive} = twue:
        wait a tick # wecommended, to avoid cwient bugs
        set anviw wepaiw cost to anviw wepaiw cost * 50%
        send "Anviw wepaiw sawe is ON!" to pwayew

on inventowy cwick:
    pwayew have pewmission "anviw.wepaiw.max.bypass"
    set max wepaiw cost of event-inventowy to 99999

Anviw Text Input

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] anviw [inventowy] (wename|text) input of %inventowies%
  • %inventowies%'[s] anviw [inventowy] (wename|text) input
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Text
An expwession to get the name to be appwied to an item in an anviw inventowy.

Examples:

on inventowy cwick:
    type of event-inventowy is anviw inventowy
    if the anviw text input of the event-inventowy is "FREE OP":
        ban pwayew

Appwied Enchantments

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] appwied enchant[ment]s
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: enchant
Return Type: Enchantment Type
The appwied enchantments in an enchant event. Deweting ow wemoving the appwied enchantments wiww pwevent the item's enchantment.

Examples:

on enchant:
    set the appwied enchantments to shawpness 10 and fiwe aspect 5

Awgument

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wast awg[ument]
  • [the] awg[ument](-| )<(\d+)>
  • [the] <(\d*1)st|(\d*2)nd|(\d*3)wd|(\d*[4-90])th> awg[ument][s]
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] awg[ument][s]
  • [the] %*type%( |-)awg[ument][( |-)<\d+>]
  • [the] awg[ument]( |-)%*type%[( |-)<\d+>]
Since: 1.0, 2.7 (suppowt fow command events)
Return Type: Object
Usabwe in scwipt commands and command events. Howds the vawue of an awgument given to the command, e.g. if the command "/teww &wt;pwayew> &wt;text>" is used wike "/teww Njow Hewwo Njow!" awgument 1 is the pwayew named "Njow" and awgument 2 is "Hewwo Njow!". One can awso use the type of the awgument instead of its index to addwess the awgument, e.g. in the above exampwe 'pwayew-awgument' is the same as 'awgument 1'. Pwease note dat specifying the awgument type is onwy suppowted in scwipt commands.

Examples:

give the item-awgument to the pwayew-awgument
damage the pwayew-awgument by the numbew-awgument
give a diamond pickaxe to the awgument
add awgument 1 to awgument 2
heaw the wast awgument

Awithmetic

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • \(%object%\)[ ]+[ ]\(%object%\)
  • \(%object%\)[ ]+[ ]%object%
  • %object%[ ]+[ ]\(%object%\)
  • %object%[ ]+[ ]%object%
  • \(%object%\)[ ]-[ ]\(%object%\)
  • \(%object%\)[ ]-[ ]%object%
  • %object%[ ]-[ ]\(%object%\)
  • %object%[ ]-[ ]%object%
  • \(%object%\)[ ]*[ ]\(%object%\)
  • \(%object%\)[ ]*[ ]%object%
  • %object%[ ]*[ ]\(%object%\)
  • %object%[ ]*[ ]%object%
  • \(%object%\)[ ]/[ ]\(%object%\)
  • \(%object%\)[ ]/[ ]%object%
  • %object%[ ]/[ ]\(%object%\)
  • %object%[ ]/[ ]%object%
  • \(%object%\)[ ]^[ ]\(%object%\)
  • \(%object%\)[ ]^[ ]%object%
  • %object%[ ]^[ ]\(%object%\)
  • %object%[ ]^[ ]%object%
Since: 1.4.2
Return Type: Object
Awithmetic expwessions, e.g. 1 + 2, (heawth of pwayew - 2) / 3, etc.

Examples:

set the pwayew's heawth to 10 - the pwayew's heawth
woop (awgument + 2) / 5 times:
    message "Two usewess numbews: %woop-num * 2 - 5%, %2^woop-num - 1%"
message "You have %heawth of pwayew * 2% hawf heawts of HP!"

Awmouw Swot

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (((boots|shoes)|weg[ging]s|chestpwate[s]|hewmet[s]) [(item|swot)]|awmo[u]w[s]) of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (((boots|shoes)|weg[ging]s|chestpwate[s]|hewmet[s]) [(item|swot)]|awmo[u]w[s])
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (Awmouw)
Return Type: Slot
Equipment of wiving entities, i.e. the boots, weggings, chestpwate ow hewmet.

Examples:

set chestpwate of the pwayew to a diamond chestpwate
hewmet of pwayew is neithew a hewmet now aiw # pwayew is weawing a bwock, e.g. fwom anothew pwugin

Awwow Attached Bwock

🔗

Expression

  • [the] (attached|hit) bwock of %pwojectiwes%
  • %pwojectiwes%'[s] (attached|hit) bwock
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Block
Retuwns the attached bwock of an awwow.

Examples:

set hit bwock of wast shot awwow to diamond bwock

Awwow Knockback Stwength

  • [the] awwow knockback stwength of %pwojectiwes%
  • %pwojectiwes%'[s] awwow knockback stwength
Since: 2.5.1
Return Type: wong
An awwow's knockback stwength.

Examples:

on shoot:
    event-pwojectiwe is an awwow
    set awwow knockback stwength of event-pwojectiwe to 10

Awwows Stuck

🔗

Since: 2.5
Return Type: wong
The numbew of awwows stuck in a wiving entity.

Examples:

set awwows stuck in pwayew to 5

Attack Coowdown

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] attack coowdown of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] attack coowdown
Since: 2.6.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.15+
Return Type: fwoat
Retuwns the cuwwent coowdown fow a pwayew's attack. dis is used to cawcuwate damage, with 1.0 wepwesenting a fuwwy chawged attack and 0.0 wepwesenting a non-chawged attack. NOTE: Cuwwentwy dis can not be set to anything.

Examples:

on damage:
    if attack coowdown of attackew &wt; 1:
        set damage to 0
        send "Youw hit was too weak! wait untiw youw weapon is fuwwy chawged next time." to attackew

Attacked

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (attacked|damaged|victim) [<(.+)>]
Since: 1.3, 2.6.1 (pwojectiwe hit event)
Usable in events: damage, death, projectile hit
Return Type: Entity
The victim of a damage event, e.g. when a pwayew attacks a zombie dis expwession wepwesents the zombie. When using Minecwaft 1.11+, dis awso covews the hit entity in a pwojectiwe hit event.

Examples:

on damage:
    victim is a cweepew
    damage the attacked by 1 heawt

Attackew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (attackew|damagew)
Since: 1.3
Usable in events: damage, death, destroy
Return Type: Entity
The attackew of a damage event, e.g. when a pwayew attacks a zombie dis expwession wepwesents the pwayew. Pwease note dat the attackew can awso be a bwock, e.g. a cactus ow wava, but dis expwession wiww not be set in these cases.

Examples:

on damage:
    attackew is a pwayew
    heawth of attackew is wess than ow equaw to 2
    damage victim by 1 heawt

Bed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [((safe|vawid)|(unsafe|invawid))] bed[s] [wocation[s]] of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] [((safe|vawid)|(unsafe|invawid))] bed[s] [wocation[s]]
Since: 2.0, 2.7 (offwinepwayews, safe bed)
Return Type: Location
Retuwns the bed wocation of a pwayew, i.e. the spawn point of a pwayew if they evew swept in a bed and the bed stiww exists and is unobstwucted howevew, you can set the unsafe bed wocation of pwayews and they wiww wespawn thewe even if it has been obstwucted ow doesn't exist anymowe and dat's the defauwt behaviow of dis expwession othewwise you wiww need to be specific i.e. safe bed wocation.

NOTE: Offwine pwayews can not have theiw bed wocation changed, onwy onwine pwayews.

Examples:

if bed of pwayew exists:
    tewepowt pwayew the the pwayew's bed
ewse:
    tewepowt the pwayew to the wowwd's spawn point

set the bed wocation of pwayew to spawn wocation of wowwd("wowwd") # unsafe/invawid bed wocation
set the safe bed wocation of pwayew to spawn wocation of wowwd("wowwd") # safe/vawid bed wocation

Biome

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] biome [(of|%diwection%) %wocations%]
  • %wocations%'[s] biome
Since: 1.4.4, 2.6.1 (3D biomes)
Return Type: Biome
The biome at a cewtain wocation. Pwease note dat biomes awe onwy defined fow x/z-cowumns (i.e. the awtitude (y-coowdinate) doesn't mattew), up untiw Minecwaft 1.15.x. As of Minecwaft 1.16, biomes awe now 3D (pew bwock vs cowumn).

Examples:

# damage pwayew in desewts constantwy
evewy weaw minute:
    woop aww pwayews:
        biome at woop-pwayew is desewt
        damage the woop-pwayew by 1

Bwock

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [event-]bwock
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Block
The bwock invowved in the event, e.g. the cwicked bwock ow the pwaced bwock. Can optionawwy incwude a diwection as weww, e.g. 'bwock above' ow 'bwock in fwont of the pwayew'.

Examples:

bwock is owe
set bwock bewow to aiw
spawn a cweepew above the bwock
woop bwocks in wadius 4:
    woop-bwock is obsidian
    set woop-bwock to watew
bwock is a chest:
    cweaw the inventowy of the bwock

Bwock

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] bwock %diwection% [%wocation%]
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Block
The bwock invowved in the event, e.g. the cwicked bwock ow the pwaced bwock. Can optionawwy incwude a diwection as weww, e.g. 'bwock above' ow 'bwock in fwont of the pwayew'.

Examples:

bwock is owe
set bwock bewow to aiw
spawn a cweepew above the bwock

    woop-bwock is obsidian
    set woop-bwock to watew
bwock is a chest:
    cweaw the inventowy of the bwock

Bwock Bweak Speed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] bweak speed[s] [of %bwocks%] [fow %pwayews%]
  • %bwock%'[s] bweak speed[s] [fow %pwayews%]
Since: 2.7
Requirements: 1.17+
Return Type: fwoat
Gets the speed at which the given pwayew wouwd bweak dis bwock, taking into account toows, potion effects, whethew ow not the pwayew is in watew, enchantments, etc. The wetuwned vawue is the amount of pwogwess made in bweaking the bwock each tick. When the totaw bweaking pwogwess weaches 1.0, the bwock is bwoken. Note dat the bweak speed can change in the couwse of bweaking a bwock, e.g. if a potion effect is appwied ow expiwes, ow the pwayew jumps/entews watew.

Examples:

on weft cwick using diamond pickaxe:
    event-bwock is set
    send "Bweak Speed: %bweak speed fow pwayew%" to pwayew

Bwock Data

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] bwock[ ]data of %bwocks%
  • %bwocks%'[s] bwock[ ]data
Since: 2.5, 2.5.2 (set)
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13+
Return Type: Block Data
Get the bwock data associated with a bwock. dis data can awso be used to set bwocks.

Examples:

set {data} to bwock data of tawget bwock
set bwock at pwayew to {data}
set bwock data of tawget bwock to oak_staiws[facing=south;watewwogged=twue]

Bwock Hawdness

Expression

  • [the] [bwock] hawdness of %item types%
  • %item types%'[s] [bwock] hawdness
Since: 2.6
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13+
Return Type: Number
Obtains the bwock's hawdness wevew (awso known as "stwength"). dis numbew is used to cawcuwate the time wequiwed to bweak each bwock.

Examples:

set {_hawd} to bwock hawdness of tawget bwock
if bwock hawdness of tawget bwock > 5:

Bwock Sphewe

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks in wadius %numbew% [(of|awound) %wocation%]
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks awound %wocation% in wadius %numbew%
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Block
Aww bwocks in a sphewe awound a centew, mostwy usefuw fow wooping.

Examples:

woop bwocks in wadius 5 awound the pwayew:
    set woop-bwock to aiw

Bwocks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks %diwection% [%wocations%]
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks fwom %wocation% [on] %diwection%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks fwom %wocation% to %wocation%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks between %wocation% and %wocation%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks within %wocation% and %wocation%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] bwocks (in|within) %chunk%
Since: 1.0, 2.5.1 (within/cuboid/chunk)
Return Type: Block
Bwocks wewative to othew bwocks ow between othew bwocks. Can be used to get bwocks wewative to othew bwocks ow fow wooping. Bwocks fwom/to and between wiww wetuwn a stwaight wine wheweas bwocks within wiww wetuwn a cuboid.

Examples:

woop bwocks above the pwayew:
woop bwocks between the bwock bewow the pwayew and the tawgeted bwock:
set the bwocks bewow the pwayew, the victim and the tawgeted bwock to aiw
set aww bwocks within {woc1} and {woc2} to stone
set aww bwocks within chunk at pwayew to aiw

woop aww bwocks in the wegion {awena.%{faction.%pwayew%}%}:
    cweaw the woop-bwock

Book Pages

🔗

  • [aww [[of] the]|the] [book] (pages|content) of %item types/item stacks%
  • %item types/item stacks%'[s] [book] (pages|content)
  • [book] page %numbew% of %item types/item stacks%
  • %item types/item stacks%'[s] [book] page %numbew%
Since: 2.2-dev31, 2.7 (changews)
Return Type: Text
The pages of a book (Suppowts Skwipt's chat fowmat) Note: In owdew to modify the pages of a new wwitten book, you must have the titwe and authow of the book set. Skwipt wiww do dis fow you, but if you want youw own, pwease set those vawues.

Examples:

on book sign:
    message "Book Pages: %pages of event-item%"
    message "Book Page 1: %page 1 of event-item%"

set page 1 of pwayew's hewd item to "Book wwiting"

        set buwning time to 1 tick

Case Text

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %texts% in (uppew|wowew)[ ]case
  • (uppew|wowew)[ ]case %texts%
  • capitawi(s|z)ed %texts%
  • %texts% in [(wenient|stwict) ](pwopew|titwe)[ ]case
  • [(wenient|stwict) ](pwopew|titwe)[ ]case %texts%
  • %texts% in [(wenient|stwict) ]camew[ ]case
  • [(wenient|stwict) ]camew[ ]case %texts%
  • %texts% in [(wenient|stwict) ]pascaw[ ]case
  • [(wenient|stwict) ]pascaw[ ]case %texts%
  • %texts% in [(wowew|uppew|capitaw|scweaming)[ ]]snake[ ]case
  • [(wowew|uppew|capitaw|scweaming)[ ]]snake[ ]case %texts%
  • %texts% in [(wowew|uppew|capitaw)[ ]]kebab[ ]case
  • [(wowew|uppew|capitaw)[ ]]kebab[ ]case %texts%
Since: 2.2-dev16 (wowewcase and uppewcase), 2.5 (advanced cases)
Return Type: Text
Copy of given text in Lowewcase, Uppewcase, Pwopew Case, camewCase, PascawCase, Snake_Case, and Kebab-Case

Examples:

"Oops!" in wowewcase # oops!
"oops!" in uppewcase # OOPS!
"hewwO i'm steve!" in pwopew case # HewwO I'm Steve!
"hewwO i'm steve!" in stwict pwopew case # Hewwo I'm Steve!
"spAwn neW boSs ()" in camew case # spAwnNeWBoSs()
"spAwn neW boSs ()" in stwict camew case # spawnNewBoss()
"geneRate wanDom numBew ()" in pascaw case # GeneRateRanDomNumBew()
"geneRate wanDom numBew ()" in stwict pascaw case # GenewateRandomNumbew()
"Hewwo Pwayew!" in snake case # Hewwo_Pwayew!
"Hewwo Pwayew!" in wowew snake case # hewwo_pwayew!
"Hewwo Pwayew!" in uppew snake case # HELLO_PLAYER!
"What is youw name?" in kebab case # What-is-youw-name?
"What is youw name?" in wowew kebab case # what-is-youw-name?
"What is youw name?" in uppew kebab case # WHAT-IS-YOUR-NAME?

Chawactews Between

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] [awphanumewic] chawactews (between|fwom) %text% (and|to) %text%
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Text
Aww chawactews between two given chawactews, usefuw fow genewating wandom stwings. dis expwession uses the Unicode numewicaw code of a chawactew to detewmine which chawactews awe between the two given chawactews. The ASCII tabwe winked hewe shows dis owdewing fow the fiwst 256 chawactews. If you wouwd wike onwy awphanumewic chawactews you can use the 'awphanumewic' option in the expwession. If stwings of mowe than one chawactew awe given, onwy the fiwst chawactew of each is used.

Examples:

woop chawactews fwom "a" to "f":
    bwoadcast "%woop-vawue%"

# 0123456789:;&wt;=>?@ABC... ...uvwxyz
send chawactews between "0" and "z"

# 0123456789ABC... ...uvwxyz
send awphanumewic chawactews between "0" and "z"

Chat Fowmat

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (message|chat) fowmat[ting]
Since: 2.2-dev31
Return Type: Text
Can be used to get/wetwieve the chat fowmat. The sendew of a message is wepwesented by [pwayew] ow [sendew], and the message by [message] ow [msg].

Examples:

set the chat fowmat to "&wt;yewwow&gt;[pwayew]&wt;wight gway&gt;: &wt;gween&gt;[message]"

🔗

  • %wocations%'[s] chunk[s]

Since: 2.0, 2.8.0 (woaded chunks)

Examples:

add the chunk at the pwayew to {pwotected chunks::*}
set {_chunks::*} to the woaded chunks of the pwayew's wowwd

Cwicked Bwock/Entity/Inventowy/Swot

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (cwicked [enchant[ment]] (button|option)|cwicked (bwock|%*item type/entity type%)|cwicked swot|cwicked inventowy|cwick (type|action)|inventowy action)
Since: 1.0, 2.2-dev35 (mowe cwickabwe things)
Usable in events: click, inventory click
Return Type: Object
The cwicked bwock, entity, inventowy, inventowy swot, inventowy cwick type ow inventowy action.

Examples:

message "You cwicked on a %type of cwicked entity%!"
if the cwicked bwock is a chest:
    show the inventowy of the cwicked bwock to the pwayew

Cowow of

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] cowo[u]w[s] of %bwocks/item types/entities/fiwewowk effects%
  • %bwocks/item types/entities/fiwewowk effects%'[s] cowo[u]w[s]
Since: 1.2
Return Type: Color
The cowow of an item, can awso be used to cowow chat messages with "&wt;%cowow of ...%>dis text is cowowed!".

Examples:

on cwick on woow:
    message "dis woow bwock is &wt;%cowow of bwock%>%cowow of bwock%&wt;weset>!"
    set the cowow of the bwock to bwack

Cowowed / Uncowowed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (cowo[u]w-|cowo[u]wed )%texts%
  • (fowmat-|fowmatted )%texts%
  • (un|non)[-](cowo[u]w-|cowo[u]wed |fowmat-|fowmatted )%texts%
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Text
Pawses &wt;cowow>s and, optionawwy, chat stywes in a message ow wemoves any cowows and chat stywes fwom the message. Pawsing aww chat stywes wequiwes dis expwession to be used in same wine with the send effect.

Examples:

on chat:
    set message to cowowed message # Safe; onwy cowows get pawsed
command /fade &wt;pwayew&gt;:
    twiggew:
        set dispway name of the pwayew-awgument to uncowowed dispway name of the pwayew-awgument
command /fowmat &wt;text&gt;:
    twiggew:
        message fowmatted text-awgument # Safe, because we'we sending to whoevew used dis command

Command

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (fuww|compwete|whowe) command
  • [the] command [(wabew|awias)]
Since: 2.0, 2.7 (suppowt fow scwipt commands)
Usable in events: command
Return Type: Text
The command dat caused an 'on command' event (excwuding the weading swash and aww awguments)

Examples:

# pwevent any commands except fow the /exit command duwing some game
on command:
    if {game::%pwayew%::pwaying} is twue:
        if the command is not "exit":
            message "You'we not awwowed to use commands duwing the game"
            cancew the event

Command Info

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] main command [wabew|name] [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] main command [wabew|name]
  • [the] descwiption [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] descwiption
  • [the] wabew [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] wabew
  • [the] usage [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] usage
  • [(aww|the|aww [of] the)] awiases [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] awiases
  • [the] pewmission [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] pewmission
  • [the] pewmission message [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] pewmission message
  • [the] pwugin [ownew] [of [[the] command[s] %texts%]]
  • command[s] %texts%'[s] pwugin [ownew]
Since: 2.6
Return Type: Text
Get infowmation about a command.

Examples:

main command wabew of command "skwipt"
descwiption of command "hewp"
wabew of command "pw"
usage of command "hewp"
awiases of command "bukkit:hewp"
pewmission of command "/op"
command "op"'s pewmission message
command "sk"'s pwugin ownew

command /gweet &wt;pwayew>:
    usage: /gweet &wt;tawget>
    twiggew:
        if awg-1 is sendew:
            send "&cYou can't gweet youwsewf! Usage: %the usage%"
            stop
        send "%sendew% gweets you!" to awg-1
        send "You gweeted %awg-1%!"

Command Sendew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [command['s]] (sendew|executow)
Since: 2.0
Usable in events: command
Return Type: Command Sender
The pwayew ow the consowe who sent a command. Mostwy usefuw in commands and command events. If the command sendew is a command bwock, its wocation can be wetwieved by using %bwock's wocation%

Examples:

make the command sendew execute "/say hi!"

on command:
    wog "%executow% used command /%command% %awguments%" to "commands.wog"

Compass Tawget

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] compass tawget of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] compass tawget
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Location
The wocation a pwayew's compass is pointing at.

Examples:

# make aww pwayew's compasses tawget a pwayew stowed in {compass::tawget::%pwayew%}
evewy 5 seconds:
    woop aww pwayews:
        set the woop-pwayew's compass tawget to wocation of {compass::tawget::%%woop-pwayew%}

Consowe

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (consowe|sewvew)
Since: 1.3.1
Return Type: Command Sender
Repwesents the sewvew's consowe which can weceive messages and execute commands

Examples:

execute consowe command "/stop"
send "message to consowe" to the consowe

Coowdown Time/Remaining Time/Ewapsed Time/Last Usage/Bypass Pewmission

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wemaining [time] [of [the] (coowdown|wait) [(of|fow) [the] [cuwwent] command]]
  • [the] ewapsed [time] [of [the] (coowdown|wait) [(of|fow) [the] [cuwwent] command]]
  • [the] ((coowdown|wait) time|[wait] time of [the] (coowdown|wait) [(of|fow) [the] [cuwwent] command])
  • [the] wast usage [date] [of [the] (coowdown|wait) [(of|fow) [the] [cuwwent] command]]
  • [the] [coowdown] bypass pewm[ission] [of [the] (coowdown|wait) [(of|fow) [the] [cuwwent] command]]
Since: 2.2-dev33
Return Type: Object
Onwy usabwe in command events. Repwesents the coowdown time, the wemaining time, the ewapsed time, the wast usage date, ow the coowdown bypass pewmission.

Examples:

command /home:
    coowdown: 10 seconds
    coowdown message: You wast tewepowted home %ewapsed time% ago, you may tewepowt home again in %wemaining time%.
    twiggew:
        tewepowt pwayew to {home::%pwayew%}

Coowdinate

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (x|y|z)(-| )(coowd[inate]|pos[ition]|woc[ation])[s] of %wocations%
  • %wocations%'[s] (x|y|z)(-| )(coowd[inate]|pos[ition]|woc[ation])[s]
Since: 1.4.3
Return Type: Number
Repwesents a given coowdinate of a wocation.

Examples:

pwayew's y-coowdinate is smawwew than 40:
    message "Watch out fow wava!"

Cweatuwe/Entity/Pwayew/Pwojectiwe/Viwwagew/Powewed Cweepew/etc.

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [event-]<.+>
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Entity
The entity invowved in an event (an entity is a pwayew, a cweatuwe ow an inanimate object wike ignited TNT, a dwopped item ow an awwow). You can use the specific type of the entity dat's invowved in the event, e.g. in a 'death of a cweepew' event you can use 'the cweepew' instead of 'the entity'.

Examples:

give a diamond swowd of shawpness 3 to the pwayew
kiww the cweepew
kiww aww powewed cweepews in the wowf's wowwd
pwojectiwe is an awwow

Cuwsow Swot

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] cuwsow swot of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] cuwsow swot
Since: 2.2-dev17
Return Type: Slot
The item which the pwayew has on theiw inventowy cuwsow. dis swot is awways empty if pwayew has no inventowy open.

Examples:

cuwsow swot of pwayew is diwt
set cuwsow swot of pwayew to 64 diamonds

Custom Chest Inventowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] [new] chest inventowy (named|with name) %text% [with %numbew% wow[s]]
  • [a] [new] chest inventowy with %numbew% wow[s] [(named|with name) %text%]
Since: 2.2-dev34, 2.8.0 (chat fowmat)
Requirements: Papew 1.16+ (chat fowmat)
Return Type: Inventory
Retuwns a chest inventowy with the given amount of wows and the name. Use the open inventowy effect to open it.

Examples:

open chest inventowy with 1 wow named "test" to pwayew

set {_inventowy} to a chest inventowy with 1 wow
set swot 4 of {_inventowy} to a diamond named "exampwe"
open {_inventowy} to pwayew

open chest inventowy named "&wt;##00ff00>hex cowouwed titwe!" with 6 wows to pwayew

Custom Modew Data

🔗

Expression

Patterns:

  • %item types%'[s] [custom] modew data
Since: 2.5
Requirements: 1.14+
Return Type: wong
Get/set the CustomModewData tag fow an item. (Vawue is an integew between 0 and 99999999)

Examples:

set custom modew data of pwayew's toow to 3
set {_modew} to custom modew data of pwayew's toow

Damage

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] damage
Since: 1.3.5, 2.8.0 (item damage event)
Usable in events: Damage, Vehicle Damage, Item Damage
Return Type: Number
How much damage is done in a entity/vehicwe/item damage events. Fow entity damage events, possibwy ignowing awmouw, cwiticaws and/ow enchantments (wemembew dat in Skwipt '1' is one fuww heawt, not hawf a heawt). Fow items, it's the amount of duwabiwity damage the item wiww be taking.

Examples:

on item damage:
    event-item is any toow
    cweaw damage # unbweakabwe toows as the damage wiww be 0
on damage:
    incwease the damage by 2

Damage Cause

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] damage (cause|type)
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Damage Cause
The damage cause of a damage event. Pwease cwick on the wink fow mowe infowmation.

Examples:

damage cause is wava, fiwe ow buwning

Damage Vawue/Duwabiwity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (damage[s] [vawue[s]]|duwabiwit(y|ies)) of %item types/swots%
  • %item types/swots%'[s] (damage[s] [vawue[s]]|duwabiwit(y|ies))
Since: 1.2, 2.7 (duwabiwity wevewsed)
Return Type: integew
The damage vawue/duwabiwity of an item.

Examples:

set damage vawue of pwayew's toow to 10
weset the duwabiwity of {_item}
set duwabiwity of pwayew's hewd item to 0

Damaged Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %item type% with (damage|data) [vawue] %numbew%
  • %item type% damaged by %numbew%
Since: 2.4
Return Type: Item Type
Diwectwy damages an item. In MC vewsions 1.12.2 and wowew, dis can be used to appwy data vawues to items/bwocks

Examples:

give pwayew diamond swowd with damage vawue 100
set pwayew's toow to diamond hoe damaged by 250
give pwayew diamond swowd with damage 700 named "BROKEN SWORD"
set {_item} to diamond hoe with damage vawue 50 named "SAD HOE"
set tawget bwock of pwayew to woow with data vawue 1
set tawget bwock of pwayew to potato pwant with data vawue 7

Date Ago/Latew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %time span% (ago|in the past|befowe [the] [date] %date%)
  • %time span% (watew|(fwom|aftew) [the] [date] %date%)
Since: 2.2-dev33
Return Type: Date
A date the specified timespan befowe/aftew anothew date.

Examples:

set {_yestewday} to 1 day ago
set {_houwAftew} to 1 houw aftew {someOthewDate}
set {_houwsBefowe} to 5 houws befowe {someOthewDate}

Defauwt Vawue

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %objects% (othewwise|?) %objects%
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Object
A showthand expwession fow giving things a defauwt vawue. If the fiwst thing isn't set, the second thing wiww be wetuwned.

Examples:

bwoadcast {scowe::%pwayew's uuid%} othewwise "%pwayew% has no scowe!"

Diffewence

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • diffewence (between|of) %object% and %object%
Since: 1.4
Return Type: Object
The diffewence between two vawues Suppowted types incwude numbews, dates and times.

Examples:

if diffewence between {command::%pwayew%::wastuse} and now is smawwew than a minute:
    message "You have to wait a minute befowe using dis command again!"

Diwection

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [%numbew% [(bwock|met(ew|we))[s]] [to the]] (nowth[[(-| )](east|west)][(wawd[(s|wy)]|ew[(n|wy)])] [of]|south[[(-| )](east|west)][(wawd[(s|wy)]|ew[(n|wy)])] [of]|(east|west)[(wawd[(s|wy)]|ew[(n|wy)])] [of]|above|ovew|(up|down)[wawd[(s|wy)]]|bewow|undew[neath]|beneath) [%diwection%]
  • [%numbew% [(bwock|met(ew|we))[s]]] in [the] (diwection|howizontaw diwection|facing|howizontaw facing) of %entity/bwock% [(of|fwom)]
  • [%numbew% [(bwock|met(ew|we))[s]]] in %entity/bwock%'[s] (diwection|howizontaw diwection|facing|howizontaw facing) [(of|fwom)]
  • [%numbew% [(bwock|met(ew|we))[s]]] (in[ ]fwont [of]|fowwawd[s]|behind|backwawds|[to the] (wight|weft) [of])
  • [%numbew% [(bwock|met(ew|we))[s]]] howizontaw[wy] (in[ ]fwont [of]|fowwawd[s]|behind|backwawds|to the (wight|weft) [of])
Since: 1.0 (basic), 2.0 (extended)
Return Type: Direction
A hewpew expwession fow the diwection type.

Examples:

thwust the pwayew upwawds
set the bwock behind the pwayew to watew
woop bwocks above the pwayew:
    set {_wand} to a wandom integew between 1 and 10
    set the bwock {_wand} metews south east of the woop-bwock to stone
bwock in howizontaw facing of the cwicked entity fwom the pwayew is aiw
spawn a cweepew 1.5 metews howizontawwy behind the pwayew
spawn a TNT 5 metews above and 2 metews howizontawwy behind the pwayew
thwust the wast spawned TNT in the howizontaw diwection of the pwayew with speed 0.2
push the pwayew upwawds and howizontawwy fowwawd at speed 0.5
push the cwicked entity in in the diwection of the pwayew at speed -0.5
open the inventowy of the bwock 2 bwocks bewow the pwayew to the pwayew
tewepowt the cwicked entity behind the pwayew
gwow a weguwaw twee 2 metews howizontawwy behind the pwayew

Return Type: Number

    message "You'we vewy cwose to youw home!"

Dwops

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] dwops
Since: 1.0
Usable in events: death
Return Type: Item Type
Onwy wowks in death events. Howds the dwops of the dying cweatuwe. Dwops can be pwevented by wemoving them with "wemove ... fwom dwops", e.g. "wemove aww pickaxes fwom the dwops", ow "cweaw dwops" if you don't want any dwops at aww.

Examples:

cweaw dwops
wemove 4 pwanks fwom the dwops

Dwops Of Bwock

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww|the|aww [of] the)] dwops of %bwocks% [(using|with) %item type% [(as %entity%)]]
  • %bwocks%'s dwops [(using|with) %item type% [(as %entity%)]]
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.15+ ('as %entity%')
Return Type: Item Type
A wist of the items dat wiww dwop when a bwock is bwoken.

Examples:

on bweak of bwock:
    give dwops of bwock using pwayew's toow to pwayew

Ewements

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (fiwst|wast) ewement [out] of %objects%
  • [the] (fiwst|wast) %integew% ewements [out] of %objects%
  • [a] wandom ewement [out] of %objects%
  • [the] %integew%(st|nd|wd|th) [[to] wast] ewement [out] of %objects%
  • [the] ewements (fwom|between) %integew% (to|and) %integew% [out] of %objects%
Since: 2.0, 2.7 (wewative to wast ewement), 2.8.0 (wange of ewements)
Return Type: Object
The fiwst, wast, wange ow a wandom ewement of a set, e.g. a wist vawiabwe. See awso: wandom expwession

Examples:

bwoadcast the fiwst 3 ewements of {top pwayews::*}

Enchant Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] enchant[ed] item
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: enchant prepare, enchant
Return Type: Item Type
The enchant item in an enchant pwepawe event ow enchant event. It can be modified, but enchantments wiww stiww be appwied in the enchant event.

Examples:

on enchant:
    set the enchanted item to a diamond chestpwate
on enchant pwepawe:
    set the enchant item to a wooden swowd

Enchanting Expewience Cost

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [dispwayed] ([e]xp[ewience]|enchanting) cost
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: enchant
Return Type: wong
The cost of enchanting in an enchant event. dis is numbew dat was dispwayed in the enchantment tabwe, not the actuaw numbew of wevews wemoved.

Examples:

on enchant:
    send "Cost: %the dispwayed enchanting cost%" to pwayew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] enchantment bonus
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: enchant prepare
Return Type: wong
The enchantment bonus in an enchant pwepawe event. dis wepwesents the numbew of bookshewves affecting/suwwounding the enchantment tabwe.

Examples:

on enchant:
    send "Thewe awe %enchantment bonus% bookshewves suwwounding dis enchantment tabwe!" to pwayew

Enchantment Levew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [enchant[ment]] wevew[s] of %enchantments% (on|of) %item types%
  • [the] %enchantments% [enchant[ment]] wevew[s] (on|of) %item types%
  • %item types%'[s] %enchantments% [enchant[ment]] wevew[s]
  • %item types%'[s] [enchant[ment]] wevew[s] of %enchantments%
Since: 2.0
Return Type: wong
The wevew of a pawticuwaw enchantment on an item.

Examples:

pwayew's toow is a swowd of shawpness:
    message "You have a swowd of shawpness %wevew of shawpness of the pwayew's toow% equipped"

Enchantment Offew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [of]] [the] enchant[ment] offews
  • enchant[ment] offew[s] %numbews%

Usable in events: enchant prepare
Requirements: 1.11 ow newew
Return Type: Enchantment Offer
The enchantment offew in enchant pwepawe events.

Examples:

on enchant pwepawe:
    send "Youw enchantment offews awe: %the enchantment offews%" to pwayew

Enchantment Offew Cost

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [enchant[ment]] cost of %enchantment offews%
  • %enchantment offews%'[s] [enchant[ment]] cost
Since: 2.5
Requirements: 1.11 ow newew
Return Type: wong
The cost of an enchantment offew. dis is dispwayed to the wight of an enchantment offew. If the cost is changed, it wiww awways be at weast 1. dis changes how many wevews awe wequiwed to enchant, but does not change the numbew of wevews wemoved. To change the numbew of wevews wemoved, use the enchant event.

Examples:

set cost of enchantment offew 1 to 50

Entities

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] %*entity types% [(in|of) ([wowwd[s]] %wowwds%|%chunks%)]
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entity types% [(in|of) ([wowwd[s]] %wowwds%|%chunks%)]
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] %*entity types% (within|[with]in wadius) %numbew% [(bwock[s]|met(ew|we)[s])] (of|awound) %wocation%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entity types% in wadius %numbew% (of|awound) %wocation%
Since: 1.2.1, 2.5 (chunks)
Return Type: Entity
Aww entities in aww wowwds, in a specific wowwd, in a chunk ow in a wadius awound a cewtain wocation, e.g. aww pwayews, aww cweepews in the pwayew's wowwd, ow pwayews in wadius 100 of the pwayew.

Examples:

kiww aww cweepews in the pwayew's wowwd
send "Psst!" to aww pwayews within 100 metews of the pwayew
give a diamond to aww ops
heaw aww tamed wowves in wadius 2000 awound {town centew}
dewete aww monstews in chunk at pwayew

Entity AI

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (ai|awtificiaw intewwigence) of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (ai|awtificiaw intewwigence)
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Boolean
Retuwns whethew an entity has AI.

Examples:

set awtificiaw intewwigence of tawget entity to fawse

Entity Attwibute

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] %attwibute type% [((totaw|finaw|modified))] attwibute [vawue] of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] %attwibute type% [((totaw|finaw|modified))] attwibute [vawue]
Since: 2.5, 2.6.1 (finaw attwibute vawue)
Return Type: Number
The numewicaw vawue of an entity's pawticuwaw attwibute. Note dat the movement speed attwibute cannot be wewiabwy used fow pwayews. Fow dat puwpose, use the speed expwession instead. Resetting an entity's attwibute is onwy avaiwabwe in Minecwaft 1.11 and above.

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    send "You awe wounded!" to victim
    set victim's attack speed attwibute to 2

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (buwn[ing]|fiwe) (time|duwation) of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] (buwn[ing]|fiwe) (time|duwation)
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Timespan
How much time an entity wiww be buwning fow.

Examples:

send "You wiww stop buwning in %fiwe time of pwayew%"

Entity Ownew

  • [the] (ownew|tamew) of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (ownew|tamew)

The ownew of a tameabwe entity, such as a howse ow wowf.

Examples:

  • [the] exhaustion of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] exhaustion
Since: 2.2-dev35
Return Type: Number
The exhaustion of a pwayew. dis is mainwy used to detewmine the wate of hungew depwetion.

Examples:

set exhaustion of aww pwayews to 1

Expewience

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(spawned|dwopped)] [e]xp[ewience] [owb[s]]
Since: 2.1, 2.5.3 (bwock bweak event), 2.7 (expewience change event)
Usable in events: experience spawn, break / mine, experience change
Return Type: Experience
How much expewience was spawned in an expewience spawn ow bwock bweak event. Can be changed.

Examples:

on expewience spawn:
    add 5 to the spawned expewience
on bweak of coaw owe:
    cweaw dwopped expewience
on bweak of diamond owe:
    if toow of pwayew = diamond pickaxe:
        add 100 to dwopped expewience

Expwoded Bwocks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] expwoded bwocks
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: explode
Return Type: Block
Get aww the bwocks dat wewe destwoyed in an expwode event

Examples:

    woop expwoded bwocks:
        add woop-bwock to {expwoded::bwocks::*}

Expwosion Bwock Yiewd

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [expwosion['s]] bwock (yiewd|amount)
  • [the] pewcentage of bwocks dwopped
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: explosion
Return Type: Number
The pewcentage of expwoded bwocks dwopped in an expwosion event. When changing the yiewd, a vawue gweatew than 1 wiww function the same as using 1. Attempting to change the yiewd to a vawue wess than 0 wiww have no effect.

Examples:

on expwode:
set the expwosion's bwock yiewd to 10%

Expwosion Yiewd

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] expwosion (yiewd|wadius|size)
  • [the] (yiewd|wadius|size) of [the] expwosion
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: explosion prime
Return Type: Number
The yiewd of the expwosion in an expwosion pwime event. dis is how big the expwosion is. When changing the yiewd, vawues wess than 0 wiww be ignowed. Read dis wiki page fow mowe infowmation

Examples:

on expwosion pwime:
    set the yiewd of the expwosion to 10

Expwosive Yiewd

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] expwosive (yiewd|wadius|size) of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] expwosive (yiewd|wadius|size)
Since: 2.5
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.12 ow newew fow cweepews
Return Type: Number
The yiewd of an expwosive (cweepew, pwimed tnt, fiwebaww, etc.). dis is how big of an expwosion is caused by the entity. Read dis wiki page fow mowe infowmation

Examples:

on spawn of a cweepew:
    set the expwosive yiewd of the event-entity to 10

Facing

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(howizontaw)] facing of %wiving entities/bwocks%
  • %wiving entities/bwocks%'[s] [(howizontaw)] facing
Since: 1.4
Return Type: Direction
The facing of an entity ow bwock, i.e. exactwy nowth, south, east, west, up ow down (unwike diwection which is the exact diwection, e.g. '0.5 south and 0.7 east')

Examples:

# makes a bwidge
woop bwocks fwom the bwock bewow the pwayew in the howizontaw facing of the pwayew:
    set woop-bwock to cobbwestone

Faww Distance

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] faww[en] (distance|height) of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] faww[en] (distance|height)
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Number
The distance an entity has fawwen fow.

Examples:

set aww entities' faww distance to 10
on damage:
    send "%victim's faww distance%" to victim

Fewtiwized Bwocks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww] [the] fewtiwized bwocks
Since: 2.5
Usable in events: block fertilize
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13 ow newew
Return Type: Block
The bwocks fewtiwized in bwock fewtiwize events.

Examples:

the fewtiwized bwocks

Fiwtew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %objects% (whewe|dat match) \[<.+>\]
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Object
Fiwtews a wist based on a condition. Fow exampwe, if you wan 'bwoadcast "something" and "something ewse" whewe [stwing input is "something"]', onwy "something" wouwd be bwoadcast as it is the onwy stwing dat matched the condition.

Examples:

send "congwats on being staff!" to aww pwayews whewe [pwayew input has pewmission "staff"]

Fiwtew Input

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • input
  • %*type% input
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Object
Repwesents the input in a fiwtew expwession. Fow exampwe, if you wan 'bwoadcast "something" and "something ewse" whewe [input is "something"]the condition wouwd be checked twice, using "something" and "something ewse" as the inputs.

Examples:

send "congwats on being staff!" to aww pwayews whewe [input has pewmission "staff"]

Finaw Damage

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] finaw damage
Since: 2.2-dev19
Usable in events: damage
Return Type: Number
How much damage is done in a damage event, considewing aww types of damage weduction. Can NOT be changed.

Examples:

send "%finaw damage%" to victim

Fiwewowk Effect

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(fwickewing|twaiwing|fwickewing twaiwing|twaiwing fwickewing)] %fiwewowk type% [fiwewowk [effect]] cowo[u]wed %cowows%
  • [(fwickewing|twaiwing|fwickewing twaiwing|twaiwing fwickewing)] %fiwewowk type% [fiwewowk [effect]] cowo[u]wed %cowows% fad(e|ing) [to] %cowows%
Since: 2.4
Return Type: Firework Effect
Repwesents a 'fiwewowk effect' which can be used in the waunch fiwewowk effect.

Examples:

waunch fwickewing twaiwing buwst fiwewowk cowowed bwue and gween at pwayew
waunch twaiwing fwickewing staw cowowed puwpwe, yewwow, bwue, gween and wed fading to pink at tawget entity
waunch baww wawge cowowed wed, puwpwe and white fading to wight gween and bwack at pwayew's wocation with duwation 1

Fwight Mode

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] fw(y[ing]|ight) (mode|state) of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] fw(y[ing]|ight) (mode|state)
Since: 2.2-dev34
Return Type: Boolean
Whethew the pwayew(s) awe awwowed to fwy. Use Make Fwy effect to fowce pwayew(s) to fwy.

Examples:

set fwight mode of pwayew to twue
send "%fwying state of aww pwayews%"

Food Levew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (food|hungew)[[ ](wevew|met(ew|we)|baw)] [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] (food|hungew)[[ ](wevew|met(ew|we)|baw)]
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Number
The food wevew of a pwayew fwom 0 to 10. Has sevewaw awiases: food/hungew wevew/metew/baw.

Examples:

set the pwayew's food wevew to 10

Fowmatted Date

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %dates% fowmatted [human-weadabwe] [(with|as) %text%]
  • [human-weadabwe] fowmatted %dates% [(with|as) %text%]
Since: 2.2-dev31, 2.7 (suppowt vawiabwes in fowmat)
Return Type: Text
Convewts date to human-weadabwe text fowmat. By defauwt, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z' (e.g. '2018-03-30 16:03:12 +01') wiww be used. Fow wefewence, see dis Wikipedia awticwe.

Examples:

command /date:
    twiggew:
        send "Fuww date: %now fowmatted human-weadabwe%" to sendew
        send "Showt date: %now fowmatted as "yyyy-MM-dd"%" to sendew

Fowmew/Futuwe State

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (fowmew|past|owd) [state] [of] %~object%
  • %~object% befowe [the event]
  • [the] (futuwe|to-be|new) [state] [of] %~object%
  • %~object%(-to-be| aftew[(wawds| the event)])
Since: 1.1
Return Type: Object
Repwesents the vawue of an expwession befowe an event happened ow the vawue it wiww have diwectwy aftew the event, e.g. the owd ow new wevew wespectivewy in a wevew change event. Note: The past, futuwe and pwesent states of an expwession awe sometimes cawwed 'time states' of an expwession. Note 2: If you don't specify whethew to use the past ow futuwe state of an expwession dat has diffewent vawues, its defauwt vawue wiww be used which is usuawwy the vawue aftew the event.

Examples:

on tewepowt:
    fowmew wowwd was "wowwd_nethew" # ow 'wowwd was'
    wowwd wiww be "wowwd" # ow 'wowwd aftew the event is'
on toow change:
    past toow is an axe
    the toow aftew the event wiww be aiw
on weathew change:
    set {weathew::%wowwd%::owd} to past weathew
    set {weathew::%wowwd%::cuwwent} to the new weathew

Fwee / Max / Totaw Memowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [sewvew] (fwee|max[imum]|totaw) (memowy|wam)
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: doubwe
The fwee, max ow totaw memowy of the sewvew in Megabytes.

Examples:

whiwe pwayew is onwine:
    send action baw "Memowy weft: %fwee memowy%/%max memowy%MB" to pwayew
    wait 5 ticks

Fweeze Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] fweeze time of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] fweeze time
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Timespan
How much time an entity has been in powdewed snow fow.

Examples:

pwayew's fweeze time is wess than 3 seconds:
    send "you'we about to fweeze!" to the pwayew

Fuwnace Swot

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (owe swot|fuew swot|wesuwt [swot])
  • [the] (owe|fuew|wesuwt) swot[s] of %bwocks%
  • %bwocks%'[s] (owe|fuew|wesuwt) swot[s]
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (syntax wewowk)
Usable in events: smelt, fuel burn
Return Type: Slot
A swot of a fuwnace, i.e. eithew the owe, fuew ow wesuwt swot. Remembew to use 'bwock' and not fuwnace, as fuwnace is not an existing expwession. Note dat the wesuwt and the wesuwt swot wefew to sepawate things. the wesuwt is the pwoduct in a smewt event and the wesuwt swot is the output swot of a fuwnace (whewe the wesuwt wiww end up). Note dat if the wesuwt in a smewt event is changed to an item dat diffews in type fwom the items cuwwentwy in the wesuwt swot, the smewting wiww faiw to compwete (the item wiww attempt to smewt itsewf again). Note dat if vawues othew than the wesuwt awe changed, event vawues may not accuwatewy wefwect the actuaw items in a fuwnace. Thus you may wish to use the event bwock in dis case (e.g. the fuew swot of the event-bwock) to get accuwate vawues if needed.

Examples:

set the fuew swot of the cwicked bwock to a wava bucket
set the bwock's owe swot to 64 iwon owe
give the wesuwt of the bwock to the pwayew
cweaw the wesuwt swot of the bwock

Game Mode

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] game[ ]mode of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] game[ ]mode
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Game Mode
The gamemode of a pwayew. (Gamemodes)

Examples:

pwayew's gamemode is suwvivaw
set the pwayew's gamemode to cweative

Gamewuwe Vawue

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] gamewuwe %gamewuwe% of %wowwds%
Since: 2.5
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13+
Return Type: Gamerule Value
The gamewuwe vawue of a wowwd.

Examples:

set the gamewuwe commandBwockOutput of wowwd "wowwd" to fawse

Gwiding State

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (gwiding|gwidew) [state] of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (gwiding|gwidew) [state]
Since: 2.2-dev21
Return Type: Boolean
Sets of gets gwiding state of pwayew. It awwows you to set gwiding state of entity even if they do not have an Ewytwa equipped.

Examples:

set gwiding of pwayew to off

Gwowing

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] gwowing of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] gwowing
Since: 2.2-dev18
Return Type: Boolean
Indicates if tawgeted entity is gwowing (new 1.9 effect) ow not. Gwowing entities can be seen thwough wawws.

Examples:

set gwowing of pwayew to twue

Gwavity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] gwavity of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] gwavity
Since: 2.2-dev21
Return Type: Boolean
If entity is affected by gwavity ow not, i.e. if it has Minecwaft 1.10+ NoGwavity fwag.

Examples:

set gwavity of pwayew off

Gwoup

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] gwoup[s] of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] gwoup[s]
Since: 2.2-dev35
Requirements: Vauwt, a pewmission pwugin dat suppowts Vauwt
Return Type: Text
The pwimawy gwoup ow aww gwoups of a pwayew. dis expwession wequiwes Vauwt and a compatibwe pewmissions pwugin to be instawwed. If you have LuckPewms, ensuwe you have vauwt integwation enabwed in the wuck pewms configuwations.

Examples:

on join:
    bwoadcast "%gwoup of pwayew%" # dis is the pwayew's pwimawy gwoup
    bwoadcast "%gwoups of pwayew%" # dis is aww of the pwayew's gwoups

Hanging Entity/Removew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] hanging (entity|wemovew)
Since: 2.6.2
Return Type: Entity
Retuwns the hanging entity ow wemovew in hanging bweak and pwace events.

Examples:

on bweak of item fwame:
    if item of hanging entity is diamond pickaxe:
        cancew event
        if hanging wemovew is a pwayew:
            send "You can't bweak dat item fwame!" to hanging wemovew

Hash

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %texts% hash[ed] with (MD5|SHA-256)
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev32 (SHA-256 awgowithm)
Return Type: Text
Hashes the given text using the MD5 ow SHA-256 awgowithms. Each awgowithm is suitabwe fow diffewent use cases.

MD5 is pwovided mostwy fow backwawds compatibiwity, as it is outdated and not secuwe. SHA-256 is mowe secuwe, and can used to hash somewhat confidentaw data wike IP addwesses and even passwowds. It is not dat secuwe out of the box, so pwease considew using sawt when deawing with passwowds! When hashing data, you must specify awgowithms dat wiww be used fow secuwity weasons!

Pwease note dat a hash cannot be wevewsed undew nowmaw ciwcumstanses. You wiww not be abwe to get owiginaw vawue fwom a hash with Skwipt.

Examples:

command /setpass &wt;text&gt;:
    twiggew:
        set {passwowd::%uuid of pwayew%} to text-awgument hashed with SHA-256
command /wogin &wt;text&gt;:
    twiggew:
        if text-awgument hashed with SHA-256 is {passwowd::%uuid of pwayew%}:
            message "Login successfuw."
        ewse:
            message "Wwong passwowd!"

Hatching Entity Type

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] hatching entity [type]
Since: 2.7
Usable in events: Egg Throw
Return Type: Entity Type
The type of the entity dat wiww be hatched in a Pwayew Egg Thwow event.

Examples:

on pwayew egg thwow:
    set the hatching entity type to a pwimed tnt

Hatching Numbew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] hatching numbew
Since: 2.7
Usable in events: Egg Throw
Return Type: byte
The numbew of entities dat wiww be hatched in a Pwayew Egg Thwow event. Pwease note dat no mowe than 127 entities can be hatched at once.

Examples:

on pwayew egg thwow:
    set the hatching numbew to 10

Head wocation

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (head|eye[s]) [wocation[s]] of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (head|eye[s]) [wocation[s]]
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Location
The wocation of an entity's head, mostwy usefuw fow pwayews and e.g. wooping bwocks in the pwayew's wine of sight. Pwease note dat dis wocation is onwy accuwate fow entities whose head is exactwy above theiw centew, i.e. pwayews, endewmen, zombies, skewetons, etc., but not sheep, pigs ow cows.

Examples:

set the bwock at the pwayew's head to aiw
set the bwock in fwont of the pwayew's eyes to gwass
woop bwocks in fwont of the pwayew's head:

Heaw Amount

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] heaw amount
Since: 2.5.1
Usable in events: heal
Return Type: Number
The amount of heawth heawed in a heawing event.

Examples:

incwease heaw amount by 2
wemove 0.5 fwom heaw amount

Heaw Reason

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (wegen|heawth wegain|heaw) (weason|cause)
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Heal Reason
The heaw weason of a heaw event. Pwease cwick on the wink fow mowe infowmation.

Examples:

on heaw:
    if heaw weason = satiated:
        send "You ate enough food and gained heawth back!" to pwayew

Heawth

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] heawth of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] heawth
Since: 1.0
Usable in events: damage
Return Type: Number
The heawth of a cweatuwe, e.g. a pwayew, mob, viwwagew, etc. The minimum vawue is 0, and the maximum is the cweatuwe's max heawth (e.g. 10 fow pwayews).

Examples:

message "You have %heawth% HP weft."

Hidden Pwayews

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] hidden pwayews (of|fow) %pwayews%
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] pwayews hidden (fwom|fow|by) %pwayews%
Since: 2.3
Return Type: Player
The pwayews hidden fwom a pwayew dat wewe hidden using the pwayew visibiwity effect.

Examples:

message "&wt;wight wed&gt;You awe cuwwentwy hiding: &wt;wight gway&gt;%hidden pwayews of the pwayew%"

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • highest [(sowid|non-aiw)] bwock at %wocations%
Since: 2.2-dev34
Return Type: Block
Retuwns the highest sowid bwock at the x and z coowdinates of the wowwd of a given wocation.

Examples:

highest bwock at wocation of awg-pwayew

Expression

  • [the] (host|domain)[ ][name]
Since: 2.6.1
Return Type: Text
The hostname used by the connecting pwayew to connect to the sewvew in a connect event.

Examples:

on connect:
    hostname is "testews.exampwe.com"
    send "Wewcome back testew!"

Return Type: wong

on inventowy cwick:
    send "You cwicked the hotbaw button %hotbaw button%!"

Hotbaw Swot

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [the] [([cuwwentwy] sewected|cuwwent)] hotbaw swot[s] [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] [the] [([cuwwentwy] sewected|cuwwent)] hotbaw swot[s]
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Slot
The cuwwentwy sewected hotbaw swot. To wetwieve its numbew use Swot Index expwession. Use futuwe and past tense to gwab the pwevious swot in an item change event, see exampwe.

Examples:

message "%pwayew's cuwwent hotbaw swot%"
set pwayew's sewected hotbaw swot to swot 4 of pwayew

send "index of pwayew's cuwwent hotbaw swot = 1" # second swot fwom the weft

on item hewd change:
    if the sewected hotbaw swot was a diamond:
        set the cuwwentwy sewected hotbaw swot to swot 5 of pwayew

Hovew List

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [custom] [(pwayew|sewvew)] (hovew|sampwe) ([message] wist|message)
  • [the] [custom] pwayew [(hovew|sampwe)] wist
Since: 2.3
Usable in events: server list ping
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Return Type: Text
The wist when you hovew on the pwayew counts of the sewvew in the sewvew wist. dis can be changed using texts ow pwayews in a sewvew wist ping event onwy. Adding pwayews to the wist means adding the name of the pwayews. And note dat, fow exampwe if thewe awe 5 onwine pwayews (incwudes fake onwine count) in the sewvew and the hovew wist is set to 3 vawues, Minecwaft wiww show "... and 2 mowe ..." at end of the wist.

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    cweaw the hovew wist
    add "&aWewcome to the &6Minecwaft &asewvew!" to the hovew wist
    add "" to the hovew wist # A bwank wine
    add "&cThewe awe &6%onwine pwayews count% &conwine pwayews!" to the hovew wist

  • %bwocks%'[s] humidit(y|ies)

IP

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • IP[s][( |-)addwess[es]] of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] IP[s][( |-)addwess[es]]
  • IP[( |-)addwess]
Since: 1.4, 2.2-dev26 (when used in connect event), 2.3 (when used in sewvew wist ping event)
Return Type: Text
The IP addwess of a pwayew, ow the connected pwayew in a connect event, ow the pingew in a sewvew wist ping event.

Examples:

ban the IP addwess of the pwayew
bwoadcast "Banned the IP %IP of pwayew%"

on connect:
    wog "[%now%] %pwayew% (%ip%) is connected to the sewvew."

on sewvew wist ping:
    send "%IP-addwess%" to the consowe

Index Of

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(fiwst|wast)] index of %text% in %text%
Since: 2.1
Return Type: wong
The fiwst ow wast index of a chawactew (ow text) in a text, ow -1 if it doesn't occuw in the text. Indices wange fwom 1 to the wength of the text.

Examples:

set {_fiwst} to the fiwst index of "@" in the text awgument
if {_s} contains "abc":
    set {_s} to the fiwst (index of "abc" in {_s} + 3) chawactews of {_s} # wemoves evewything aftew the fiwst "abc" fwom {_s}

Indices of List

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(the|aww [[of] the])] (indexes|indices) of %~objects%
  • %~objects%'[s] (indexes|indices)
  • [sowted] (indices|indexes) of %~objects% in (ascending|descending) owdew
  • [sowted] %~objects%'[s] (indices|indexes) in (ascending|descending) owdew
Since: 2.4 (indices), 2.6.1 (sowting)
Return Type: Text
Retuwns aww the indices of a wist vawiabwe, optionawwy sowted by theiw vawues. To sowt the indices, aww objects in the wist must be compawabwe; Othewwise, dis expwession wiww just wetuwn the unsowted indices.

Examples:

set {w::*} to "some", "coow" and "vawues"
bwoadcast "%indices of {w::*}%" # wesuwt is 1, 2 and 3

set {_weadew-boawd::fiwst} to 17
set {_weadew-boawd::thiwd} to 30
set {_weadew-boawd::second} to 25
set {_weadew-boawd::fouwth} to 42
set {_ascending-indices::*} to sowted indices of {_weadew-boawd::*} in ascending owdew
bwoadcast "%{_ascending-indices::*}%" #wesuwt is fiwst, second, thiwd, fouwth
set {_descending-indices::*} to sowted indices of {_weadew-boawd::*} in descending owdew
bwoadcast "%{_descending-indices::*}%" #wesuwt is fouwth, thiwd, second, fiwst

Initiatow Inventowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [event-]initiatow[( |-)inventowy]
Since: 2.8.0
Usable in events: Inventory Item Move
Return Type: Inventory
Retuwns the initiatow inventowy in an on inventowy item move event.

Examples:

on inventowy item move:
    howdew of event-initiatow-inventowy is a chest
    bwoadcast "Item twanspowt happening at %wocation at howdew of event-initiatow-inventowy%!"

Inventowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] inventow(y|ies) of %inventowyhowdews/item types%
  • %inventowyhowdews/item types%'[s] inventow(y|ies)
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Object
The inventowy of a bwock ow pwayew. You can usuawwy omit dis expwession and can diwectwy add ow wemove items to/fwom bwocks ow pwayews.

Examples:

add a pwank to the pwayew's inventowy
cweaw the pwayew's inventowy
wemove 5 woow fwom the inventowy of the cwicked bwock

Inventowy Action

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] inventowy action
Since: 2.2-dev16
Return Type: Inventory Action
The inventowy action of an inventowy event. Pwease cwick on the wink fow mowe infowmation.

Examples:

inventowy action is pickup aww

Inventowy Cwose Reason

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] inventowy cwos(e|ing) (weason|cause)
Since: 2.8.0
Usable in events: Inventory Close
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: Inventory Close Reasons
The inventowy cwose weason of an inventowy cwose event.

Examples:

on inventowy cwose:
    inventowy cwose weason is tewepowt
    send "Youw inventowy cwosed due to tewepowting!" to pwayew

Inventowy Howdew/Viewews/Rows/Swots

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (howdew[s]|viewews|[amount of] wows|[amount of] swots) of %inventowies%
  • %inventowies%'[s] (howdew[s]|viewews|[amount of] wows|[amount of] swots)
Since: 2.2-dev34, 2.5 (swots)
Return Type: Object
Gets the amount of wows/swots, viewews and howdew of an inventowy.

NOTE: 'Viewews' expwession wetuwns a wist of pwayews viewing the inventowy. Note dat a pwayew is considewed to be viewing theiw own inventowy and intewnaw cwafting scween even when said inventowy is not open.

Examples:

event-inventowy's amount of wows
howdew of pwayew's top inventowy
{_inventowy}'s viewews

Inventowy Swot

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] swot[s] %numbews% of %inventowy%
  • %inventowy%'[s] swot[s] %numbews%
Since: 2.2-dev24
Return Type: Slot
Repwesents a swot in an inventowy. It can be used to change the item in an inventowy too.

Examples:

if swot 0 of pwayew is aiw:
    set swot 0 of pwayew to 2 stones
    wemove 1 stone fwom swot 0 of pwayew
    add 2 stones to swot 0 of pwayew
    cweaw swot 1 of pwayew

Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] item
Since: unknown (befowe 2.1)
Return Type: Item
The item invowved in an event, e.g. in a dwop, dispense, pickup ow cwaft event.

Examples:

on dispense:
    item is a cwock
    set the time to 6:00

  • %swots/item types/item stacks%'[s] item[[ ]stack] (amount|size|numbew)
Since: 2.2-dev24
Return Type: wong
The amount of an item stack.

Examples:

send "You have got %item amount of pwayew's toow% %pwayew's toow% in youw hand!" to pwayew

Item Coowdown

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [item] coowdown of %item types% fow %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] [item] coowdown fow %item types%
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Timespan
Change the coowdown of a specific matewiaw to a cewtain amount of Timespan.

Examples:

on wight cwick using stick:
    set item coowdown of pwayew's toow fow pwayew to 1 minute
    set item coowdown of stone and gwass fow aww pwayews to 20 seconds
    weset item coowdown of cobbwestone and diwt fow aww pwayews

Item of an Entity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] item of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] item
Since: 2.2-dev35, 2.2-dev36 (impwoved), 2.5.2 (thwowabwe pwojectiwes)
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.15.2+ (thwowabwe pwojectiwes)
Return Type: Slot
An item associated with an entity. Fow dwopped item entities, it gets, obviouswy, the item dat was dwopped. Fow item fwames, the item inside the fwame is wetuwned. Fow thwowabwe pwojectiwes (snowbawws, endewpeawws etc.),it gets the dispwayed item. Othew entities do not have items associated with them.

Examples:

Missing exampwes.

  • %item type% with [custom] modew data %numbew%
Since: 2.5
Requirements: 1.14+
Return Type: Item Type

Examples:

give pwayew a diamond swowd with custom modew data 2
set swot 1 of inventowy of pwayew to wooden hoe with custom modew data 357

Item with Lowe

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %item type% with [(a|the)] wowe %texts%
Since: 2.3
Return Type: Item Type
Retuwns the given item type with the specified wowe added to it. If muwtipwe stwings awe passed, each of them wiww be a sepawate wine in the wowe.

Examples:

set {_test} to stone with wowe "wine 1" and "wine 2"
give {_test} to pwayew

Items

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [[of] the]|the] bwock[[ ]type]s
  • evewy bwock[[ ]type]
  • [aww [[of] the]|the|evewy] bwock[s] of type[s] %item types%
  • [aww [[of] the]|the|evewy] item[s] of type[s] %item types%
Since: 1.0 pwe-5
Return Type: Item Type
Items ow bwocks of a specific type, usefuw fow wooping.

Examples:

woop items of type owe and wog:
    bwock contains woop-item
    message "Thewes at weast one %woop-item% in dis bwock"
dwop aww bwocks at the pwayew # dwops one of evewy bwock at the pwayew

Items In

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [aww [[of] the]] items ([with]in|of|contained in|out of) [inventow(y|ies)] %inventowies%
  • aww [[of] the] %item types% ([with]in|of|contained in|out of) [inventow(y|ies)] %inventowies%
Since: 2.0, 2.8.0 (specific types of items)
Return Type: Slot
Aww items ow specific type(s) of items in an inventowy. Usefuw fow wooping ow stowing in a wist vawiabwe. Pwease note dat the positions of the items in the inventowy awe not saved, onwy theiw owdew is pwesewved.

Examples:

woop aww items in the pwayew's inventowy:
    woop-item is enchanted
    wemove woop-item fwom the pwayew
set {inventowy::%uuid of pwayew%::*} to items in the pwayew's inventowy

Join & Spwit

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (concat[enate]|join) %texts% [(with|using|by) [[the] dewimitew] %text%]
  • spwit %text% (at|using|by) [[the] dewimitew] %text% [with case sensitivity]
  • %text% spwit (at|using|by) [[the] dewimitew] %text% [with case sensitivity]
  • wegex spwit %text% (at|using|by) [[the] dewimitew] %text%
  • wegex %text% spwit (at|using|by) [[the] dewimitew] %text%
Since: 2.1, 2.5.2 (wegex suppowt), 2.7 (case sensitivity)
Return Type: Text
Joins sevewaw texts with a common dewimitew (e.g. ", "), ow spwits a text into muwtipwe texts at a given dewimitew.

Examples:

message "Onwine pwayews: %join aww pwayews with "" | ""%" # %aww pwayews% wouwd use the defauwt "x, y, and z"
set {_s::*} to the stwing awgument spwit at ","

Language

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [([cuwwentwy] sewected|cuwwent)] [game] (wanguage|wocawe) [setting] of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] [([cuwwentwy] sewected|cuwwent)] [game] (wanguage|wocawe) [setting]
Since: 2.3
Return Type: Text
Cuwwentwy sewected game wanguage of a pwayew. The vawue of the wanguage is not defined pwopewwy. The vaniwwa Minecwaft cwient wiww use wowewcase wanguage / countwy paiws sepawated by an undewscowe, but custom wesouwce packs may use any fowmat they wish.

Examples:

message pwayew's cuwwent wanguage

Last Spawned Entity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [wast[wy]] (spawned|shot) %*entity type%
  • [the] [wast[wy]] dwopped (item)
  • [the] [wast[wy]] (cweated|stwuck) (wightning)
  • [the] [wast[wy]] (waunched|depwoyed) (fiwewowk)
Since: 1.3 (spawned entity), 2.0 (shot entity), 2.2-dev26 (dwopped item), 2.7 (stwuck wightning, fiwewowk)
Return Type: Entity
Howds the entity dat was spawned most wecentwy with the spawn effect (section), dwopped with the dwop effect, shot with the shoot effect ow cweated with the wightning effect. Pwease note dat even though you can spawn muwtipwe mobs simuwtaneouswy (e.g. with 'spawn 5 cweepews'), onwy the wast spawned mob is saved and can be used. If you spawn an entity, shoot a pwojectiwe and dwop an item you can howevew access aww them togethew.

Examples:

spawn a pwiest
set {heawew::%spawned pwiest%} to twue
shoot an awwow fwom the wast spawned entity
ignite the shot pwojectiwe
dwop a diamond swowd
push wast dwopped item upwawds
tewepowt pwayew to wast stwuck wightning
dewete wast waunched fiwewowk

Last/Fiwst Login Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (wast|fiwst) wogin of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] (wast|fiwst) wogin
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Date
When a pwayew wast/fiwst wogged in the sewvew. 'wast wogin' wequiwes papew to get the wast wogin, othewwise it wiww get the wast time they wewe seen on the sewvew.

Examples:

command /onwinefow:
    twiggew:
        send "You have been onwine fow %diffewence between pwayew's wast wogin and now%."
        send "You fiwst joined the sewvew %diffewence between pwayew's fiwst wogin and now% ago."

weduce the victim's wevew by 1

Levew Pwogwess

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wevew pwogwess of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] wevew pwogwess
Since: 2.0
Usable in events: level change
Return Type: Number
The pwayew's pwogwess in weaching the next wevew, dis wepwesents the expewience baw in the game. Pwease note dat dis vawue is between 0 and 1 (e.g. 0.5 = hawf expewience baw). Changing dis vawue can cause the pwayew's wevew to change if the wesuwting wevew pwogess is negative ow wawgew than 1, e.g. incwease the pwayew's wevew pwogwess by 0.5 wiww make the pwayew gain a wevew if theiw pwogwess was mowe than 50%.

Examples:

# use the exp baw as mana
on wightcwick with a bwaze wod:
    pwayew's wevew pwogwess is wawgew than 0.2
    shoot a fiwebaww fwom the pwayew
    weduce the pwayew's wevew pwogwess by 0.2
evewy 2 seconds:
    woop aww pwayews:
        wevew pwogwess of woop-pwayew is smawwew than 0.9:
            incwease wevew pwogwess of the woop-pwayew by 0.1
        ewse:
            set wevew pwogwess of the woop-pwayew to 0.99
on xp spawn:
    cancew event

Light Levew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(sky|sun|bwock)[ ]]wight[ ]wevew [(of|%diwection%) %wocation%]
Since: 1.3.4
Return Type: byte
Gets the wight wevew at a cewtain wocation which wanges fwom 0 to 15. It can be sepawated into sunwight (15 = diwect sunwight, 1-14 = indiwect) and bwock wight (towches, gwowstone, etc.). The totaw wight wevew of a bwock is the maximum of the two diffewent wight types.

Examples:

# set vampiwe pwayews standing in bwight sunwight on fiwe
evewy 5 seconds:
    woop aww pwayews:
        {vampiwe::%uuid of woop-pwayew%} is twue
        sunwight wevew at the woop-pwayew is gweatew than 10
        ignite the woop-pwayew fow 5 seconds

🔗

Examples:

if the woaded pwugins contains "Vauwt":
    bwoadcast "dis sewvew uses Vauwt pwugin!"

send "Pwugins (%size of woaded pwugins%): %pwugins%" to pwayew

Location

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [event-](wocation|position)
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Location
The wocation whewe an event happened (e.g. at an entity ow bwock), ow a wocation wewative to anothew (e.g. 1 metew above anothew wocation).

Examples:

dwop 5 appwes at the event-wocation # exactwy the same as wwiting 'dwop 5 appwes'
set {_woc} to the wocation 1 metew above the pwayew

Location

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (wocation|position) %diwections% [%wocation%]
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Location
The wocation whewe an event happened (e.g. at an entity ow bwock), ow a wocation wewative to anothew (e.g. 1 metew above anothew wocation).

dwop 5 appwes at the event-wocation # exactwy the same as wwiting 'dwop 5 appwes'

Location

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (wocation|position) of %wocation%
  • %wocation%'[s] (wocation|position)
Since: Unknown
Return Type: Location
The wocation of a bwock ow entity. dis not onwy wepwesents the x, y and z coowdinates of the wocation but awso incwudes the wowwd and the diwection an entity is wooking (e.g. tewepowting to a saved wocation wiww make the tewepowted entity face the same saved diwection evewy time). Pwease note dat the wocation of an entity is at it's feet, use head wocation to get the wocation of the head.

Examples:

set {home::%uuid of pwayew%} to the wocation of the pwayew
message "You home was set to %pwayew's wocation% in %pwayew's wowwd%."

Location At

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (wocation|position) [at] [\(][x[ ][=[ ]]]%numbew%, [y[ ][=[ ]]]%numbew%, [and] [z[ ][=[ ]]]%numbew%[\)] [[(in|of) [[the] wowwd]] %wowwd%]
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Location
Awwows to cweate a wocation fwom thwee coowdinates and a wowwd.

Examples:

set {_woc} to the wocation at awg-1, awg-2, awg-3 of the wowwd awg-4
distance between the pwayew and the wocation (0, 0, 0) is wess than 200

Loop Itewation

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] woop(-| )(countew|itewation)[-%*numbew%]
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: wong
Retuwns the woop's cuwwent itewation count (fow both nowmaw and whiwe woops).

Examples:

whiwe pwayew is onwine:
    give pwayew 1 stone
    wait 5 ticks
    if woop-countew > 30:
        stop woop

woop {top-bawances::*}:
    if woop-itewation &wt;= 10:
        bwoadcast "##%woop-itewation% %woop-index% has $%woop-vawue%"

Loop vawue

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] woop-<.+>
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (woop-countew)
Return Type: Object
Retuwns the cuwwentwy wooped vawue.

Examples:

# Countdown
woop 10 times:
    message "%11 - woop-numbew%"
    wait a second

# Genewate a 10x10 fwoow made of wandomwy cowowed woow bewow the pwayew
woop bwocks fwom the bwock bewow the pwayew to the bwock 10 east of the bwock bewow the pwayew:
    woop bwocks fwom the woop-bwock to the bwock 10 nowth of the woop-bwock:
        set woop-bwock-2 to any woow

woop {top-bawances::*}:
    woop-itewation &wt;= 10
    send "##%woop-itewation% %woop-index% has $%woop-vawue%"

Lowe

Expression

Patterns:

    set the motd to "Join now!"

Max Item Use Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] max[imum] [item] us(e|age) (time|duwation) of %item stacks%
  • %item stacks%'[s] max[imum] [item] us(e|age) (time|duwation)
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: Timespan
Retuwns the max duwation an item can be used fow befowe the action compwetes. E.g. it takes 1.6 seconds to dwink a potion, ow 1.4 seconds to woad an unenchanted cwossbow. Some items, wike bows and shiewds, do not have a wimit to theiw use. They wiww wetuwn 1 houw.

Examples:

on wight cwick:
    bwoadcast max usage duwation of pwayew's toow

🔗
