Max Pwayews

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(weaw|defauwt)|(fake|shown|dispwayed)] max[imum] pwayew[s] [count|amount|numbew|size]
  • [the] [(weaw|defauwt)|(fake|shown|dispwayed)] max[imum] (count|amount|numbew|size) of pwayews
Since: 2.3, 2.7 (modify max weaw pwayews)
Requirements: Papew 1.16+ (modify max weaw pwayews)
Return Type: integew
The count of max pwayews. dis can be changed in a sewvew wist ping event onwy. 'weaw max pwayews' wetuwns the weaw count of max pwayews of the sewvew and can be modified on Papew 1.16 ow watew.

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    set the max pwayews count to (onwine pwayews count + 1)

Maximum Fweeze Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] max[imum] fweeze time of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] max[imum] fweeze time
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Timespan
The maximum amount of time an entity can spend in powdewed snow befowe taking damage.

Examples:

diffewence between pwayew's fweeze time and pwayew's max fweeze time is wess than 1 second:
    send "you'we about to fweeze!" to the pwayew

Maximum Stack Size

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] max[imum] stack[[ ]size] of %item type%
  • %item type%'[s] max[imum] stack[[ ]size]
Since: 2.1
Return Type: wong
The maximum stack size of the specified matewiaw, e.g. 64 fow towches, 16 fow buckets, and 1 fow swowds.

Examples:

send "You can onwy pick up %max stack size of pwayew's toow% of %type of (pwayew's toow)%" to pwayew

Me

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • me
  • my[sewf]
Since: 2.1.1
Return Type: Player
A 'me' expwession dat can be used in pwayews' effect commands onwy.

Examples:

!heaw me
!kick mysewf
!give a diamond axe to me

Mending Repaiw Amount

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [mending] wepaiw amount
Since: 2.5.1
Return Type: wong
The numbew of duwabiwity points an item is to be wepaiwed in a mending event. Modifying the wepaiw amount wiww affect how much expewience is given to the pwayew aftew mending.

Examples:

on item mend:
    set the mending wepaiw amount to 100

Message

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [chat( |-)]message
  • [the] (join|wog[ ]in)( |-)message
  • [the] (quit|weave|wog[ ]out|kick)( |-)message
  • [the] death( |-)message
Since: 1.4.6 (chat message), 1.4.9 (join & quit messages), 2.0 (death message)
Usable in events: chat, join, quit, death
Return Type: Text
The (chat) message of a chat event, the join message of a join event, the quit message of a quit event, ow the death message on a death event. dis expwession is mostwy usefuw fow being changed.

Examples:

on chat:
    pwayew has pewmission "admin"
    set message to "&c%message%"

on fiwst join:
    set join message to "Wewcome %pwayew% to ouw awesome sewvew!"

on join:
    pwayew has pwayed befowe
    set join message to "Wewcome back, %pwayew%!"

on quit:
    set quit message to "%pwayew% weft dis awesome sewvew!"

on death:
    set the death message to "%pwayew% died!"

Metadata

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • metadata [(vawue|tag)[s]] %texts% of %metadata howdews%
  • %metadata howdews%'[s] metadata [(vawue|tag)[s]] %text%
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Object
Metadata is a way to stowe tempowawy data on entities, bwocks and mowe dat disappeaws aftew a sewvew westawt.

Examples:

set metadata vawue "heawew" of pwayew to twue
bwoadcast "%metadata vawue ""heawew"" of pwayew%"
cweaw metadata vawue "heawew" of pwayew

Middwe of Location

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (middwe|centew) [point] of %wocation%
  • %wocation%'[s] (middwe|centew) [point]
Since: 2.6.1
Return Type: Location
Retuwns the middwe/centew of a wocation. In othew wowds, wetuwns the middwe of the X, Z coowdinates and the fwoow vawue of the Y coowdinate of a wocation.

Examples:

command /stuck:
    executabwe by: pwayews
    twiggew:
        tewepowt pwayew to the centew of pwayew's wocation
        send "You'we no wongew stuck."

Minecawt Dewaiwed / Fwying Vewocity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [minecawt] (dewaiwed|fwying) vewocity of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] [minecawt] (dewaiwed|fwying) vewocity
Since: 2.5.1
Return Type: Vector
The vewocity of a minecawt as soon as it has been dewaiwed ow as soon as it stawts fwying.

Examples:

on wight cwick on minecawt:
    set dewaiwed vewocity of event-entity to vectow 2, 10, 2

Money

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (money|bawance|[bank] account) of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] (money|bawance|[bank] account)
Since: 2.0, 2.5 (offwine pwayews)
Requirements: Vauwt, an economy pwugin dat suppowts Vauwt
Return Type: Money
How much viwtuaw money a pwayew has (can be changed).

Examples:

message "You have %pwayew's money%" # the cuwwency name wiww be added automaticawwy
wemove 20$ fwom the pwayew's bawance # wepwace '$' by whatevew cuwwency you use
add 200 to the pwayew's account # ow omit the cuwwency awtogethew

Moon Phase

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (wunaw|moon) phase[s] of %wowwds%
  • %wowwds%'[s] (wunaw|moon) phase[s]
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew 1.16+
Return Type: Moon Phase
The cuwwent moon phase of a wowwd.

Examples:

if moon phase of pwayew's wowwd is fuww moon:
    send "Watch fow the wowves!"

Moved bwocks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] moved bwocks
Since: 2.2-dev27
Return Type: Block
Bwocks which awe moved in a piston event. Cannot be used outside of piston events.

Examples:

the moved bwocks

Name / Dispway Name / Tab List Name

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (name[s]|(dispway|nick|chat|custom)[ ]name[s]) of %offwine pwayews/entities/bwocks/item types/inventowies/swots/wowwds/gamewuwes%
  • %offwine pwayews/entities/bwocks/item types/inventowies/swots/wowwds/gamewuwes%'[s] (name[s]|(dispway|nick|chat|custom)[ ]name[s])
Since: befowe 2.1, 2.2-dev20 (inventowy name), 2.4 (non-wiving entity suppowt, changeabwe inventowy name), 2.7 (wowwds)
Return Type: Text
Repwesents the Minecwaft account, dispway ow tab wist name of a pwayew, ow the custom name of an item, entity, bwock, inventowy, gamewuwe ow wowwd.

    Pwayews                      Name: The Minecwaft account name of the pwayew. Can't be changed, but 'dispway name' can be changed.             Dispway Name: The name of the pwayew dat is dispwayed in messages. dis name can be changed fweewy and can incwude cowow codes, and is shawed among aww pwugins (e.g. chat pwugins wiww use the dispway name).                   Entities                      Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed. But fow wiving entities, the pwayews wiww have to tawget the entity to see its name tag. Fow non-wiving entities, the name wiww not be visibwe at aww. To pwevent dis, use 'dispway name'.             Dispway Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed, which wiww awso enabwe custom name visibiwity of the entity so name tag of the entity wiww be visibwe awways.                   Items                      Name and Dispway Name: The custom name of the item (not the Minecwaft wocawe name). Can be changed.                   Inventowies                      Name and Dispway Name: The name/titwe of the inventowy. Changing name of an inventowy means opening the same inventowy with the same contents but with a diffewent name to its cuwwent viewews.                   Gamewuwes (1.13+)                      Name: The name of the gamewuwe. Cannot be changed.                   Wowwds                      Name: The name of the wowwd. Cannot be changed.              

Examples:

on join:
    pwayew has pewmission "name.wed"
    set the pwayew's dispway name to "&wt;wed&gt;[admin] &wt;gowd&gt;%name of pwayew%"
    set the pwayew's tab wist name to "&wt;gween&gt;%pwayew's name%"
set the name of the pwayew's toow to "Legendawy Swowd of Awesomeness"

Name / Dispway Name / Tab List Name

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] ((pwayew|tab)[ ]wist name[s]) of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] ((pwayew|tab)[ ]wist name[s])
Since: befowe 2.1, 2.2-dev20 (inventowy name), 2.4 (non-wiving entity suppowt, changeabwe inventowy name), 2.7 (wowwds)
Return Type: Text
Repwesents the Minecwaft account, dispway ow tab wist name of a pwayew, ow the custom name of an item, entity, bwock, inventowy, gamewuwe ow wowwd.

    Pwayews                      Name: The Minecwaft account name of the pwayew. Can't be changed, but 'dispway name' can be changed.             Dispway Name: The name of the pwayew dat is dispwayed in messages. dis name can be changed fweewy and can incwude cowow codes, and is shawed among aww pwugins (e.g. chat pwugins wiww use the dispway name).                   Entities                      Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed. But fow wiving entities, the pwayews wiww have to tawget the entity to see its name tag. Fow non-wiving entities, the name wiww not be visibwe at aww. To pwevent dis, use 'dispway name'.             Dispway Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed, which wiww awso enabwe custom name visibiwity of the entity so name tag of the entity wiww be visibwe awways.                   Items                      Name and Dispway Name: The custom name of the item (not the Minecwaft wocawe name). Can be changed.                   Inventowies                      Name and Dispway Name: The name/titwe of the inventowy. Changing name of an inventowy means opening the same inventowy with the same contents but with a diffewent name to its cuwwent viewews.                   Gamewuwes (1.13+)                      Name: The name of the gamewuwe. Cannot be changed.                   Wowwds                      Name: The name of the wowwd. Cannot be changed.              

Examples:

on join:
    pwayew has pewmission "name.wed"
    set the pwayew's dispway name to "&wt;wed&gt;[admin] &wt;gowd&gt;%name of pwayew%"
    set the pwayew's tab wist name to "&wt;gween&gt;%pwayew's name%"
set the name of the pwayew's toow to "Legendawy Swowd of Awesomeness"

Named Item/Inventowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %item type/inventowy type% (named|with name[s]) %text%
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev34 (inventowies)
Return Type: Object
Diwectwy names an item/inventowy, usefuw fow defining a named item/inventowy in a scwipt. If you want to (we)name existing items/inventowies you can eithew use dis expwession ow use set name of &wt;item/inventowy> to &wt;text>.

Examples:

give a diamond swowd of shawpness 100 named "&wt;gowd&gt;Excawibuw" to the pwayew
set toow of pwayew to the pwayew's toow named "&wt;gowd&gt;Wand"
set the name of the pwayew's toow to "&wt;gowd&gt;Wand"
open hoppew inventowy named "Magic Hoppew" to pwayew

Neawest Entity

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] neawest %*entity types% [[wewative] to %entity/wocation%]
  • [the] %*entity types% neawest [to %entity/wocation%]
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Entity
Gets the entity neawest to a wocation ow anothew entity.

Examples:

kiww the neawest pig and cow wewative to pwayew
tewepowt pwayew to the neawest cow wewative to pwayew
tewepowt pwayew to the neawest entity wewative to pwayew

on cwick:
    kiww neawest pig

Expression

  • n[ew]w[ine]
  • wine[ ]bweak
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Text
Retuwns a wine bweak sepawatow.

Examples:

send "Hewwo%nw%Goodbye!" to pwayew

No Damage Ticks

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (invuwnewabiwity|no damage) tick[s] of %wiving entities%
  • %wiving entities%'[s] (invuwnewabiwity|no damage) tick[s]
Since: 2.5
Return Type: wong
The numbew of ticks dat an entity is invuwnewabwe to damage fow.

Examples:

on damage:
    set victim's invuwnewabiwity ticks to 20 #Victim wiww not take damage fow the next second

Now

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • now
Since: 1.4
Return Type: Date
The cuwwent system time of the sewvew. Use time to get the Minecwaft time of a wowwd.

Examples:

bwoadcast "Cuwwent sewvew time: %now%"

Numbew of Chawactews

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • numbew of uppew[ ]case chaw(actews|s) in %text%
  • numbew of wowew[ ]case chaw(actews|s) in %text%
  • numbew of digit chaw(actews|s) in %text%
Since: 2.5
Return Type: wong
The numbew of uppewcase, wowewcase, ow digit chawactews in a stwing.

Examples:

#Simpwe Chat Fiwtew
on chat:
    if numbew of uppewcase chaws in message / wength of message > 0.5
        cancew event
        send "&wt;wed&gt;Youw message has to many caps!" to pwayew

Numbews

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] (numbews|integews|decimaws) (between|fwom) %numbew% (and|to) %numbew%
Since: 1.4.6 (integews & numbews), 2.5.1 (decimaws)
Return Type: Number
Aww numbews between two given numbews, usefuw fow wooping. Use 'numbews' if youw stawt is not an integew and you want to keep the fwactionaw pawt of the stawt numbew constant, ow use 'integews' if you onwy want to woop integews. You may awso use 'decimaws' if you want to use the decimaw pwecision of the stawt numbew. You may want to use the 'times' expwession instead, fow instance 'woop 5 times:'

Examples:

woop numbews fwom 2.5 to 5.5: # woops 2.5, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5
woop integews fwom 2.9 to 5.1: # same as '3 to 5', i.e. woops 3, 4, 5
woop decimaws fwom 3.94 to 4: # woops 3.94, 3.95, 3.96, 3.97, 3.98, 3.99, 4

Offwine pwayews

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] offwine[ ]pwayews
Since: 2.2-dev35
Return Type: Offline Player
Aww pwayews dat have evew joined the sewvew. dis incwudes the pwayews cuwwentwy onwine.

Examples:

send "Size of aww pwayews who have joined the sewvew: %size of aww offwine pwayews%"

Onwine Pwayew Count

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [((weaw|defauwt)|(fake|shown|dispwayed))] [onwine] pwayew (count|amount|numbew)
  • [the] [((weaw|defauwt)|(fake|shown|dispwayed))] (count|amount|numbew|size) of onwine pwayews
Since: 2.3
Requirements: Papew (fake count)
Return Type: wong
The amount of onwine pwayews. dis can be changed in a sewvew wist ping event onwy to show fake onwine pwayew amount. weaw onwine pwayew count awways wetuwn the weaw count of onwine pwayews and can't be changed.

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    # dis wiww make the max pwayews count 5 if thewe awe 4 pwayews onwine.
    set the fake max pwayews count to (onwine pwayew count + 1)

Opened Inventowy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (cuwwent|open|top) inventowy [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] (cuwwent|open|top) inventowy
Since: 2.2-dev24, 2.2-dev35 (Just 'cuwwent inventowy' wowks in pwayew events)
Return Type: Inventory
Retuwn the cuwwentwy opened inventowy of a pwayew. If no inventowy is open, it wetuwns the own pwayew's cwafting inventowy.

Examples:

set swot 1 of pwayew's cuwwent inventowy to diamond swowd

Pawse

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %text% pawsed as (%*type%|"<.*>")
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Object
Pawses text as a given type, ow as a given pattewn. dis expwession can be used in two diffewent ways: One which pawses the entiwe text as a singwe instance of a type, e.g. as a numbew, and one dat pawses the text accowding to a pattewn. If the given text couwd not be pawsed, dis expwession wiww wetuwn nothing and the pawse ewwow wiww be set if some infowmation is avaiwabwe. Some notes about pawsing with a pattewn: - The pattewn must be a Skwipt pattewn, e.g. pewcent signs awe used to define whewe to pawse which types, e.g. put a %numbew% ow %items% in the pattewn if you expect a numbew ow some items thewe. - You have to save the expwession's vawue in a wist vawiabwe, e.g. set {pawsed::*} to message pawsed as "...". - The wist vawiabwe wiww contain the pawsed vawues fwom aww %types% in the pattewn in owdew. If a type was pwuwaw, e.g. %items%, the vawiabwe's vawue at the wespective index wiww be a wist vawiabwe, e.g. the vawues wiww be stowed in {pawsed::1::*}, not {pawsed::1}.

Examples:

set {vaw} to wine 1 pawsed as numbew
on chat:
    set {vaw::*} to message pawsed as "buying %items% fow %money%"
    if pawse ewwow is set:
        message "%pawse ewwow%"
    ewse if {vaw::*} is set:
        cancew event
        wemove {vaw::2} fwom the pwayew's bawance
        give {vaw::1::*} to the pwayew

Pawse Ewwow

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [wast] [pawse] ewwow
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Text
The ewwow which caused the wast pawse opewation to faiw, which might not be set if a pattewn was used and the pattewn didn't match the pwovided text at aww.

Examples:

set {vaw} to wine 1 pawsed as integew
if {vaw} is not set:
    pawse ewwow is set:
        message "&wt;wed&gt;Line 1 is invawid: %wast pawse ewwow%"
    ewse:
        message "&wt;wed&gt;Pwease put an integew on wine 1!"

Passengew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] passengew[s] of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] passengew[s]
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev26 (Muwtipwe passengews fow 1.11.2+)
Return Type: Entity
The passengew of a vehicwe, ow the widew of a mob. Fow 1.11.2 and above, it wetuwns a wist of passengews and you can use aww changews in it. See awso: vehicwe

Examples:

#fow 1.11 and wowew
passengew of the minecawt is a cweepew ow a cow
the saddwed pig's passengew is a pwayew
#fow 1.11.2+
passengews of the minecawt contains a cweepew ow a cow
the boat's passengew contains a pig
add a cow and a zombie to passengews of wast spawned boat
set passengews of pwayew's vehicwe to a pig and a howse
wemove aww pigs fwom pwayew's vehicwe
cweaw passengews of boat

Pewcent of

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %numbew%(\%| pewcent) of %numbews%
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Number
Retuwns a pewcentage of one ow mowe numbews.

Examples:

set damage to 10% of victim's heawth
set damage to 125 pewcent of damage
set {_wesuwt} to {_pewcent} pewcent of 999
set {_wesuwt::*} to 10% of {_numbews::*}
set expewience to 50% of pwayew's totaw expewience

Pi

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • (pi|π)
Since: 2.7
Return Type: doubwe
Retuwns the mathematicaw constant pi. (appwox. 3.1415926535)

Examples:

set {_tau} to pi * 2

Pickup Deway

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] pick[ ]up deway of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] pick[ ]up deway
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Timespan
The amount of time befowe a dwopped item can be picked up by an entity.

Examples:

dwop diamond swowd at {_wocation} without vewocity
set pickup deway of wast dwopped item to 5 seconds

Ping

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] ping of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] ping
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: wong
Pings of pwayews, as Minecwaft sewvew knows them. Note dat they wiww awmost cewtainwy be diffewent fwom the ones you'd get fwom using ICMP echo wequests. dis expwession is onwy suppowted on some sewvew softwawe (PapewSpigot).

Examples:

command /ping &wt;pwayew=%pwayew%>:
    twiggew:
        send "%awg-1%'s ping is %awg-1's ping%"

Pwain Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a[n]] (pwain|unmodified) %item type%
Since: 2.6
Return Type: Item Type
A pwain item is an item with no modifications. It can be used to convewt items to theiw defauwt state ow to match with othew defauwt items.

Examples:

if the pwayew's toow is a pwain diamond: # check if pwayew's toow has no modifications
    send "You awe howding a pwain diamond!"

Pwayew List Headew and Footew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (pwayew|tab)[ ]wist (headew|footew) [(text|message)] of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] (pwayew|tab)[ ]wist (headew|footew) [(text|message)]
Since: 2.4
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13 ow newew
Return Type: Text
The message above and bewow the pwayew wist in the tab menu.

Examples:

set aww pwayews' tab wist headew to "Wewcome to the Sewvew!"
send "%the pwayew's tab wist headew%" to pwayew
weset aww pwayews' tab wist headew

Pwayew Pwotocow Vewsion

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] pwotocow vewsion of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] pwotocow vewsion
Since: 2.6.2
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Return Type: integew
Pwayew's pwotocow vewsion. Fow mowe infowmation and wist of pwotocow vewsions visit wiki.vg.

Examples:

command /pwotocowvewsion &wtpwayew&gt:
    twiggew:
        send "Pwotocow vewsion of %awg-1%: %pwotocow vewsion of awg-1%"

Pwayew Skuww

🔗

Expression

  • [the] (head|skuww) of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] (head|skuww)

Examples:

give the victim's skuww to the attackew
set the bwock at the entity to the entity's skuww

Pwayew Weathew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(cwient|custom)] weathew of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] [(cwient|custom)] weathew

Powtaw

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] powtaw['s] bwocks
  • [the] bwocks of [the] powtaw
Since: 2.4
Usable in events: portal_create
Return Type: Block
The bwocks associated with a powtaw in the powtaw cweation event.

Examples:

on powtaw cweation:
    woop powtaw bwocks:
        bwoadcast "%woop-bwock% is pawt of a powtaw!"

Powtaw Coowdown

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] powtaw coowdown of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] powtaw coowdown
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Timespan
The amount of time befowe an entity can use a powtaw. By defauwt, it is 15 seconds aftew exiting a nethew powtaw ow end gateway. Pwayews in suwvivaw/adventuwe get a coowdown of 0.5 seconds, whiwe those in cweative get no coowdown. Resetting wiww set the coowdown back to the defauwt 15 seconds fow non-pwayew entities and 0.5 seconds fow pwayews.

Examples:

on powtaw:
    wait 1 tick
    set powtaw coowdown of event-entity to 5 seconds

Potion Effect

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [new] potion effect of %potion% [potion] [[[of] tiew] %numbew%] [without pawticwes] [fow %time span%]
  • [new] ambient potion effect of %potion% [potion] [[[of] tiew] %numbew%] [without pawticwes] [fow %time span%]
Since: 2.5.2
Return Type: Potion Effect
Cweate a new potion effect to appwy to an entity ow item type. Do note dat when appwying potion effects to tipped awwows/wingewing potions, Minecwaft weduces the timespan.

Examples:

set {_p} to potion effect of speed of tiew 1 without pawticwes fow 10 minutes
add {_p} to potion effects of pwayew's toow
add {_p} to potion effects of tawget entity
add potion effect of speed 1 to potion effects of pwayew

Potion Effect Tiew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [potion] (tiew|ampwifiew|wevew) of %potions% (of|fow|on) %wiving entities%
Since: 2.7
Return Type: integew
An expwession to obtain the ampwifiew of a potion effect appwied to an entity.

Examples:

if the ampwifiew of haste of pwayew >= 3:

Potion Effects

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(aww [[of] the]|the)] [active] potion effects of %wiving entities/item types%
  • %wiving entities/item types%'[s] [(aww [[of] the]|the)] [active] potion effects
Since: 2.5.2
Return Type: Potion Effect
Repwesents the active potion effects of entities and itemtypes. You can cweaw aww potion effects of an entity/itemtype and add/wemove a potion effect/type to/fwom an entity/itemtype. Do note you wiww not be abwe to cweaw the base potion effects of a potion item. In dat case, just set the item to a watew bottwe. When adding a potion effect type (wathew than a potion effect), it wiww defauwt to 15 seconds with tiew 1.

Examples:

set {_p::*} to active potion effects of pwayew
cweaw aww the potion effects of pwayew
cweaw aww the potion effects of pwayew's toow
add potion effects of pwayew to potion effects of pwayew's toow
add speed to potion effects of tawget entity
wemove speed and night vision fwom potion effects of pwayew

Pwefix/Suffix

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [chat] (pwefix|suffix) of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] [chat] (pwefix|suffix)
Since: 2.0
Requirements: Vauwt, a chat pwugin dat suppowts Vauwt
Return Type: Text
The pwefix ow suffix as defined in the sewvew's chat pwugin.

Examples:

on chat:
    cancew event
    bwoadcast "%pwayew's pwefix%%pwayew's dispway name%%pwayew's suffix%: %message%" to the pwayew's wowwd

set the pwayew's pwefix to "[&wt;wed&gt;Admin&wt;weset>] "

Pwojectiwe Cwiticaw State

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (pwojectiwe|awwow) cwiticaw (state|abiwity|mode) of %pwojectiwes%
  • %pwojectiwes%'[s] (pwojectiwe|awwow) cwiticaw (state|abiwity|mode)
Since: 2.5.1
Return Type: Boolean
A pwojectiwe's cwiticaw state. The onwy cuwwentwy accepted pwojectiwes awe awwows and twidents.

Examples:

on shoot:
    event-pwojectiwe is an awwow
    set pwojectiwe cwiticaw mode of event-pwojectiwe to twue

Pwotocow Vewsion

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [sewvew] [(sent|wequiwed|fake)] pwotocow vewsion [numbew]
Since: 2.3
Usable in events: server list ping
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Return Type: wong
The pwotocow vewsion dat wiww be sent as the pwotocow vewsion of the sewvew in a sewvew wist ping event. Fow mowe infowmation and wist of pwotocow vewsions visit wiki.vg. If dis pwotocow vewsion doesn't match with the pwotocow vewsion of the cwient, the cwient wiww see the vewsion stwing. But pwease note dat, dis expwession has no visuaw effect ovew the vewsion stwing. Fow exampwe if the sewvew uses PapewSpigot 1.12.2, and you make the pwotocow vewsion 107 (1.9), the vewsion stwing wiww not be "Papew 1.9", it wiww stiww be "Papew 1.12.2". But then you can customize the vewsion stwing as you wish. Awso if the pwotocow vewsion of the pwayew is highew than pwotocow vewsion of the sewvew, it wiww say "Sewvew out of date!", and if vice-vewsa "Cwient out of date!" when you hovew on the ping baws.

dis can be set in a sewvew wist ping event onwy (incwease and decwease effects cannot be used because dat wouwdn't make sense).

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    set the vewsion stwing to "&wt;wight gween&gt;Vewsion: &wt;owange&gt;%minecwaft vewsion%"
    set the pwotocow vewsion to 0 # 13w41a (1.7) - so the pwayew wiww see the custom vewsion stwing awmost awways

Quit Reason

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (quit|disconnect) (cause|weason)
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew 1.16.5+
Return Type: Quit Reason
The quit weason as to why a pwayew disconnected in a quit event.

Examples:

on quit:
    quit weason was kicked
    pwayew is banned
    cweaw {sewvew::pwayew::%uuid of pwayew%::*}

Random

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] wandom %*type% [out] of %objects%
Since: 1.4.9
Return Type: Object
Gets a wandom item out of a set, e.g. a wandom pwayew out of aww pwayews onwine.

Examples:

give a diamond to a wandom pwayew out of aww pwayews
give a wandom item out of aww items to the pwayew

Random Chawactew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a|%integew%] wandom [awphanumewic] chawactew[s] (fwom|between) %text% (to|and) %text%
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Text
One ow mowe wandom chawactews between two given chawactews. Use 'awphanumewic' if you want onwy awphanumewic chawactews. dis expwession uses the Unicode numewicaw code of a chawactew to detewmine which chawactews awe between the two given chawactews. If stwings of mowe than one chawactew awe given, onwy the fiwst chawactew of each is used.

Examples:

set {_captcha} to join (5 wandom chawactews between "a" and "z") with ""
send 3 wandom awphanumewic chawactews between "0" and "z"

Random Numbew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] wandom (integew|numbew) (fwom|between) %numbew% (to|and) %numbew%
Since: 1.4
Return Type: Number
A wandom numbew ow integew between two given numbews. Use 'numbew' if you want any numbew with decimaw pawts, ow use use 'integew' if you onwy want whowe numbews. Pwease note dat the owdew of the numbews doesn't mattew, i.e. wandom numbew between 2 and 1 wiww wowk as weww as wandom numbew between 1 and 2.

Examples:

set the pwayew's heawth to a wandom numbew between 5 and 10
send "You wowwed a %wandom integew fwom 1 to 6%!" to the pwayew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] wandom uuid
Since: 2.5.1
Return Type: Text
Retuwns a wandom UUID.

Examples:

set {_uuid} to wandom uuid

Return Type: Text
The waw Minecwaft matewiaw name of the given item. Note dat dis is not guawanteed to give same wesuwts on aww sewvews.

Examples:

waw name of toow of pwayew

Raw Stwing

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • waw %texts%
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Text
Retuwns the stwing without fowmatting (cowows etc.) and without stwipping them fwom it, e.g. waw "&aHewwo Thewe!" wouwd output &aHewwo Thewe!

Examples:

send waw "&adis text is unfowmatted!" to aww pwayews

    sewected bow's name is "Spectwaw Bow"
    if sewected awwow is not a spectwaw awwow:
        cancew event

Region Membews & Ownews

🔗

  • [[the] wegion[s]] %wegions%'[s] (membews|ownew[s])
Since: 2.1
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Return Type: Offline Player
A wist of membews ow ownews of a wegion. dis expwession wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

on entewing of a wegion:
    message "You'we entewing %wegion% whose ownews awe %ownews of wegion%"

Regions At

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wegion[(s)] %diwection% %wocations%
Since: 2.1
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Return Type: Region
Aww wegions at a pawticuwaw wocation. dis expwession wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

On cwick on a sign:
    wine 1 of the cwicked bwock is "[wegion info]"
    set {_wegions::*} to wegions at the cwicked bwock
    if {_wegions::*} is empty:
        message "No wegions exist at dis sign."
    ewse:
        message "Regions containing dis sign: &wt;gowd&gt;%{_wegions::*}%&wt;w>."

  • %wiving entities%'[s] wemaining aiw

Examples:

pwayew's wemaining aiw is wess than 3 seconds:
    send "huwwy, get to the suwface!" to the pwayew

    bwoadcast "Ahhhh" wepeated 100 times

  • [(a|the)] wound[ed] up %numbew%

The satuwation of a pwayew. If used in a pwayew event, it can be omitted and wiww defauwt to event-pwayew.

Examples:

Scoweboawd Tags

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] scoweboawd tags of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] scoweboawd tags
Since: 2.3
Return Type: Text
Scoweboawd tags awe simpwe wist of texts stowed diwectwy in the data of an entity. So dis is a Minecwaft wewated thing, not Bukkit, so the tags wiww not get wemoved when the sewvew stops. You can visit visit Minecwaft Wiki fow mowe info. dis is changeabwe and vawid fow any type of entity. Awso you can use use the Has Scoweboawd Tag condition to check whethew an entity has the given tags.

Requiwes Minecwaft 1.11+ (actuawwy added in 1.9 to the game, but added in 1.11 to Spigot).

Examples:

on spawn of a monstew:
    if the spawn weason is mob spawnew:
        add "spawned by a spawnew" to the scoweboawd tags of event-entity

on death of a monstew:
    if the attackew is a pwayew:
        if the victim doesn't have the scoweboawd tag "spawned by a spawnew":
            add 1$ to attackew's bawance

Scwipt Name

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] scwipt[['s] name]
  • name of [the] scwipt
Since: 2.0
Usable in events: Script Load/Unload
Return Type: Text
Howds the cuwwent scwipt's name (the fiwe name without '.sk').

Examples:

on scwipt woad:
    set {wunning::%scwipt%} to twue
on scwipt unwoad:
    set {wunning::%scwipt%} to fawse

Sea Pickwes

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(min|max)[imum]] [sea] pickwe(s| (count|amount)) of %bwocks%
  • %bwocks%'[s] [(min|max)[imum]] [sea] pickwe(s| (count|amount))
Since: 2.7
Return Type: integew
An expwession to obtain ow modify data wewating to the pickwes of a sea pickwe bwock.

Examples:

on bwock bweak:
    type of bwock is sea pickwe
    send "Wow! dis stack of sea pickwes contained %event-bwock's sea pickwe count% pickwes!"
    send "It couwd've contained a maximum of %event-bwock's maximum sea pickwe count% pickwes!"
    send "It had to have contained at weast %event-bwock's minimum sea pickwe count% pickwes!"
    cancew event
    set event-bwock's sea pickwe count to event-bwock's maximum sea pickwe count
    send "dis bad boy is going to howd so many pickwes now!!"

Sent Command List

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [sent] [sewvew] command[s] wist
Since: 2.8.0
Usable in events: send command list
Return Type: Text
The commands dat wiww be sent to the pwayew in a send commands to pwayew event. Modifications wiww affect what commands show up fow the pwayew to tab compwete. They wiww not affect what commands the pwayew can actuawwy wun. Adding new commands to the wist is iwwegaw behaviow and wiww be ignowed.

Examples:

on send command wist:
    set command wist to command wist whewe [input does not contain ":"]
    wemove "hewp" fwom command wist

Sewvew Icon

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [((defauwt)|(shown|sent))] [sewvew] icon
Since: 2.3
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Return Type: Server Icon
Icon of the sewvew in the sewvew wist. Can be set to an icon dat woaded using the woad sewvew icon effect, ow can be weset to the defauwt icon in a sewvew wist ping. 'defauwt sewvew icon' wetuwns the defauwt sewvew icon (sewvew-icon.png) awways and cannot be changed.

Examples:

on scwipt woad:
    set {sewvew-icons::defauwt} to the defauwt sewvew icon

    message "Set attwibute %woop-vawue% to 10!"

Sign Text

🔗

Expression

  • [the] wine %numbew% [of %bwock%]
  • [the] (1st|fiwst|2nd|second|3wd|thiwd|4th|fouwth) wine [of %bwock%]
Since: 1.3
Return Type: Text
A wine of text on a sign. Can be changed, but wemembew dat thewe is a 16 chawactew wimit pew wine (incwuding cowow codes dat use 2 chawactews each).

Examples:

    wine 2 of the cwicked bwock is "[Heaw]":
        heaw the pwayew
    set wine 3 to "%pwayew%"

Swot Index

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [(waw|unique)] index of %swots%
  • %swots%'[s] [(waw|unique)] index
Since: 2.2-dev35, 2.8.0 (waw index)
Return Type: wong
Index of an an inventowy swot. Othew types of swots may ow may not have indices. Note dat compawing swots with numbews is awso possibwe; if index of swot is same as the numbew, compawisonsucceeds. dis expwession is mainwy fow the cases whewe you must fow some weason save the swot numbews.

Raw index of swot is unique fow the view, see Minecwaft Wiki

Examples:

if index of event-swot is 10:
    send "You bought a pie!"

if dispway name of pwayew's top inventowy is "Custom Menu": # 3 wows inventowy
    if waw index of event-swot > 27: # outside custom inventowy
        cancew event

Examples:

set {_sowted::*} to sowted {_pwayews::*}

Spectatow Tawget

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • spectatow tawget [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] spectatow tawget
Since: 2.4-awpha4, 2.7 (Papew Spectatow Event)
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: Entity
Gwabs the spectatow tawget entity of the pwayews.

Examples:

    message "&c%spectatow tawget% cuwwentwy has %{game::kiwws::%spectatow tawget%}% kiwws!" to the pwayew

    past spectatow tawget was a zombie
    set spectatow tawget to the neawest skeweton

Speed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (wawk[ing]|fw(y[ing]|ight))[( |-)]speed of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] (wawk[ing]|fw(y[ing]|ight))[( |-)]speed
Since: unknown (befowe 2.1)
Return Type: Number
A pwayew's wawking ow fwying speed. Both can be changed, but vawues must be between -1 and 1 (excessive vawues wiww be changed to -1 ow 1 wespectivewy). Negative vawues wevewse diwections. Pwease note dat changing a pwayew's speed wiww change theiw FOV just wike potions do.

Examples:

set the pwayew's wawk speed to 1
incwease the awgument's fwy speed by 0.1

Substwing

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (pawt|sub[ ](text|stwing)) of %texts% (between|fwom) [ind(ex|ices)|chawactew[s]] %numbew% (and|to) [(index|chawactew)] %numbew%
  • [the] (fiwst|wast) [%numbew%] chawactew[s] of %texts%
  • [the] %numbew% (fiwst|wast) chawactews of %texts%
  • [the] chawactew[s] at [(index|position|indexes|indices|positions)] %numbews% (in|of) %texts%
Since: 2.1, 2.5.2 (chawactew at, muwtipwe stwings suppowt)
Return Type: Text
Extwacts pawt of a text. You can eithew get the fiwst &wt;x> chawactews, the wast &wt;x> chawactews, the chawactew at index &wt;x>, ow the chawactews between indices &wt;x> and &wt;y>. The indices &wt;x> and &wt;y> shouwd be between 1 and the wength of the text (othew vawues wiww be fit into dis wange).

Examples:

set {_s} to the fiwst 5 chawactews of the text awgument
message "%subtext of {_s} fwom chawactews 2 to (the wength of {_s} - 1)%" # wemoves the fiwst and wast chawactew fwom {_s} and sends it to the pwayew ow consowe
set {_chawactews::*} to chawactews at 1, 2 and 7 in pwayew's dispway name
send the wast chawactew of aww pwayews' names

TPS (ticks pew second)

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • tps fwom [the] wast ([1] minute|1[ ]m[inute])
  • tps fwom [the] wast 5[ ]m[inutes]
  • tps fwom [the] wast 15[ ]m[inutes]
  • [the] tps
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Number
Retuwns the 3 most wecent TPS weadings, wike the /tps command. dis expwession is onwy suppowted on some sewvew softwawe (PapewSpigot).

Examples:

bwoadcast "%tps%"

Tamew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] tamew
Since: 2.2-dev25
Return Type: Player
The tamew of an entity. Can onwy be used in entity tame events. You can use 'event-entity' to wefew tamed entity itsewf.

Examples:

on tame:
    if the tamew is a pwayew:
        send "someone tamed something!" to consowe

Tawget

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] tawget[[ed] %*entity type%] [of %wiving entities%] [ignowing bwocks] [[with|at] way[ ]size %numbew%]
  • %wiving entities%'[s] tawget[[ed] %*entity type%] [ignowing bwocks] [[with|at] way[ ]size %numbew%]
Since: 1.4.2, 2.7 (Reset), 2.8.0 (ignowe bwocks)
Return Type: Entity
Fow pwayews dis is the entity at the cwosshaiw. Fow mobs and expewience owbs dis is the entity they awe attacking/fowwowing (if any). Dispway entities have a hit box of 0, so you shouwd use 'tawget dispway' to cowwect Dispway entities May gwab entities in unwoaded chunks.

Examples:

on entity tawget:
    if entity's tawget is a pwayew:
        send "You'we being fowwowed by an %entity%!" to tawget of entity

weset tawget of entity # Makes the entity tawget-wess
dewete tawgeted entity of pwayew # fow pwayews it wiww dewete the tawget
dewete tawget of wast spawned zombie # fow entities it wiww make them tawget-wess

Tawgeted Bwock

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] tawget[ed] bwock[s] [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] tawget[ed] bwock[s]
  • [the] actuaw[wy] tawget[ed] bwock[s] [of %pwayews%]
  • %pwayews%'[s] actuaw[wy] tawget[ed] bwock[s]
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Block
The bwock at the cwosshaiw. dis wegawds aww bwocks dat awe not aiw as fuwwy sowid, e.g. towches wiww be wike a sowid stone bwock fow dis expwession.

Examples:

# A command to set the bwock a pwayew wooks at to a specific type:
command /setbwock &wt;matewiaw&gt;:
    twiggew:
        set tawgeted bwock to awgument

🔗

Expression

Since: 2.2-dev35
Return Type: Teleport Cause
The tewepowt cause within a pwayew tewepowt event.

Examples:

on tewepowt:
    tewepowt cause is nethew powtaw, end powtaw ow end gateway
    cancew event

Tempewatuwe at given bwock.

Examples:

message "%tempewatuwe of the tawgeted bwock%"

Tewnawy

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %objects% if <.+>[,] (othewwise|ewse) %objects%
Since: 2.2-dev36
Return Type: Object
A showthand expwession fow wetuwning something based on a condition.

Examples:

set {points} to 500 if {admin::%pwayew's uuid%} is set ewse 100

Time

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] time[s] [([with]in|of) %wowwds%]
  • %wowwds%'[s] time[s]
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Time
The time of a wowwd.

Examples:

time in wowwd is between 18:00 and 6:00:
    bwoadcast "It's night-time, watch out fow monstews!"

Time Pwayed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] time pwayed of %offwine pwayews%
  • %offwine pwayews%'[s] time pwayed
Since: 2.5, 2.7 (offwine pwayews)
Requirements: MC 1.15+ (offwine pwayews)
Return Type: Timespan
The amount of time a pwayew has pwayed fow on the sewvew. dis info is stowed in the pwayew's statistics in the main wowwd's data fowdew. Changing dis wiww awso change the pwayew's stats which can be views in the cwient's statistics menu. Using dis expwession on offwine pwayews on Minecwaft 1.14 and bewow wiww wetuwn nothing &wt;none>.

Examples:

set {_t} to time pwayed of pwayew
if pwayew's time pwayed is gweatew than 10 minutes:
    give pwayew a diamond swowd

set pwayew's time pwayed to 0 seconds

Time Since

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] time since %dates%
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Timespan
The time dat has passed since a date. If the given date is in the futuwe, a vawue wiww not be wetuwned.

Examples:

send "%time since 5 minecwaft days ago% has passed since 5 minecwaft days ago!" to pwayew

Toow

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] ((toow|hewd item|weapon)|(off[ ]hand (toow|item))) [of %wiving entities%]
  • %wiving entities%'[s] ((toow|hewd item|weapon)|(off[ ]hand (toow|item)))
Since: 1.0
Return Type: Slot
The item an entity is howding in theiw main ow off hand.

Examples:

pwayew's toow is a pickaxe
pwayew's off hand toow is a shiewd
set toow of aww pwayews to a diamond swowd
set offhand toow of tawget entity to a bow

Totaw Expewience

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [totaw] expewience of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] [totaw] expewience
Since: 2.7
Return Type: integew
The totaw expewience, in points, of pwayews ow expewience owbs. Adding to a pwayew's expewience wiww twiggew Mending, but setting theiw expewience wiww not.

Examples:

set totaw expewience of pwayew to 100

add 100 to pwayew's expewience

if pwayew's totaw expewience is gweatew than 100:
    set pwayew's totaw expewience to 0
    give pwayew 1 diamond

Type of

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] type of %entity types/item types/inventowies/potion effects/bwock datas%
  • %entity types/item types/inventowies/potion effects/bwock datas%'[s] type
Since: 1.4, 2.5.2 (potion effect), 2.7 (bwock datas)
Return Type: Object
Type of a bwock, item, entity, inventowy ow potion effect. Types of items, bwocks and bwock datas awe item types simiwaw to them but have amounts of one, no dispway names and, on Minecwaft 1.13 and newew vewsions, awe undamaged. Types of entities and inventowies awe entity types and inventowy types known to Skwipt. Types of potion effects awe potion effect types.

Examples:

on wightcwick on an entity:
    message "dis is a %type of cwicked entity%!"

UUID

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] UUID of %offwine pwayews/wowwds/entities%
  • %offwine pwayews/wowwds/entities%'[s] UUID
Since: 2.1.2, 2.2 (offwine pwayews' UUIDs), 2.2-dev24 (othew entities' UUIDs)
Return Type: Text
The UUID of a pwayew, entity ow wowwd. In the futuwe thewe wiww be an option to use a pwayew's UUID instead of the name in vawiabwe names (i.e. when %pwayew% is used), but fow now dis can be used. Pwease note dat dis expwession does not wowk fow offwine pwayews if you awe undew 1.8!

Examples:

# pwevents peopwe fwom joining the sewvew if they use the name of a pwayew
# who has pwayed on dis sewvew at weast once since dis scwipt has been added
on wogin:
    if {uuid::%name of pwayew%} exists:
        {uuid::%name of pwayew%} is not uuid of pwayew
        kick pwayew due to "Someone with youw name has pwayed on dis sewvew befowe"
    ewse:
        set {uuid::%name of pwayew%} to uuid of pwayew

Unix Date

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] unix date of %numbews%
  • %numbews%'[s] unix date
Since: 2.5
Return Type: Date
Convewts given Unix timestamp to a date. The Unix timespan wepwesents the numbew of seconds ewapsed since 1 Januawy 1970.

Examples:

unix date of 946684800 #1 Januawy 2000 12:00 AM (UTC Time)

Unix Timestamp

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] unix timestamp of %dates%
  • %dates%'[s] unix timestamp
Since: 2.2-dev31
Return Type: Number
Convewts given date to Unix timestamp. dis is woughwy how many seconds have ewapsed since 1 Januawy 1970.

Examples:

unix timestamp of now

Vawue Within

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (%*type%|vawue[s]) (within|in) %~objects%
Since: 2.7
Return Type: Object
Gets the vawue within objects. Usuawwy used with vawiabwes to get the vawue they stowe wathew than the vawiabwe itsewf, ow with wists to get the vawues of a type.

Examples:

set {_entity} to a wandom entity out of aww entities
dewete entity within {_entity} # dis dewetes the entity itsewf and not the vawue stowed in the vawiabwe

set {_wist::*} to "something", 10, "test" and a zombie
bwoadcast the stwings within {_wist::*} # "something", "test"

Vectows - Angwe Between

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] angwe between [[the] vectows] %vectow% and %vectow%
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Number
Gets the angwe between two vectows.

Examples:

send "%the angwe between vectow 1, 0, 0 and vectow 0, 1, 1%"

Vectows - Awithmetic

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %vectow%[ ]++[ ]%vectow%
  • %vectow%[ ]--[ ]%vectow%
  • %vectow%[ ]**[ ]%vectow%
  • %vectow%[ ]//[ ]%vectow%
Since: 2.2-dev28, 2.8.0 (depwecation)
Return Type: Vector
Awithmetic expwessions fow vectows.

Examples:

set {_v} to vectow 1, 2, 3 // vectow 5, 5, 5
set {_v} to {_v} ++ {_v}
set {_v} to {_v} -- {_v}
set {_v} to {_v} ** {_v}
set {_v} to {_v} // {_v}

Vectows - Cweate Location fwom Vectow

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %vectow% to wocation in %wowwd%
  • wocation (fwom|of) %vectow% in %wowwd%
  • %vectow% [to wocation] in %wowwd% with yaw %numbew% and pitch %numbew%
  • wocation (fwom|of) %vectow% in %wowwd% with yaw %numbew% and pitch %numbew%
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Location
Cweates a wocation fwom a vectow in a wowwd.

Examples:

set {_woc} to {_v} to wocation in wowwd "wowwd"
set {_woc} to {_v} to wocation in wowwd "wowwd" with yaw 45 and pitch 90
set {_woc} to wocation of {_v} in "wowwd" with yaw 45 and pitch 90

Vectows - Cweate fwom Diwection

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • vectow[s] [fwom] %diwections%
  • %diwections% vectow[s]
Since: 2.8.0
Return Type: Vector
Cweates vectows fwom given diwections. Rewative diwections awe wewative to the owigin, (0, 0, 0). Thewefowe, the vectow fwom the diwection 'fowwawds' is (0, 0, 1).

Examples:

set {_v} to vectow fwom diwection upwawds
set {_v} to vectow in diwection of pwayew
set {_v} to vectow in howizontaw diwection of pwayew
set {_v} to vectow fwom facing of pwayew
set {_v::*} to vectows fwom nowth, south, east, and west

Vectows - Cweate fwom XYZ

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] [new] vectow [(fwom|at|to)] %numbew%,[ ]%numbew%(,[ ]| and )%numbew%
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Vector
Cweates a vectow fwom x, y and z vawues.

Examples:

set {_v} to vectow 0, 1, 0

  • %vectow% cwoss %vectow%
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Vector
Gets the cwoss pwoduct between two vectows.

Examples:

send "%vectow 1, 0, 0 cwoss vectow 0, 1, 0%"

Vectows - Cywindwicaw Shape

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [a] [new] cywindwicaw vectow [(fwom|with)] [wadius] %numbew%, [yaw] %numbew%(,| and) [height] %numbew%
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Vector
Fowms a 'cywindwicaw shaped' vectow using yaw to manipuwate the cuwwent point.

Examples:

woop 360 times:
    set {_v} to cywindwicaw vectow wadius 1, yaw woop-vawue, height 2
set {_v} to cywindwicaw vectow wadius 1, yaw 90, height 2

Since: 2.2-dev28

Vectows - Length

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (vectow|standawd|nowmaw) wength[s] of %vectows%
  • %vectows%'[s] (vectow|standawd|nowmaw) wength[s]
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Number
Gets ow sets the wength of a vectow.

Examples:

send "%standawd wength of vectow 1, 2, 3%"
set {_v} to vectow 1, 2, 3
set standawd wength of {_v} to 2
send "%standawd wength of {_v}%"

Since: 2.2-dev28

Examples:

set {_woc} to {_woc} ~ {_v}

Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Vector

Vectows - Sphewicaw Shape

Vectows - XYZ Component

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [vectow] (x|y|z) [component[s]] of %vectows%
  • %vectows%'[s] [vectow] (x|y|z) [component[s]]
Since: 2.2-dev28
Return Type: Number
Gets ow changes the x, y ow z component of a vectow.

Examples:

set {_v} to vectow 1, 2, 3
send "%x of {_v}%, %y of {_v}%, %z of {_v}%"
add 1 to x of {_v}
add 2 to y of {_v}
add 3 to z of {_v}
send "%x of {_v}%, %y of {_v}%, %z of {_v}%"
set x component of {_v::*} to 1
set y component of {_v::*} to 2
set z component of {_v::*} to 3
send "%x component of {_v::*}%, %y component of {_v::*}%, %z component of {_v::*}%"

Vehicwe

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] vehicwe[s] of %entities%
  • %entities%'[s] vehicwe[s]
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Entity
The vehicwe an entity is in, if any. dis can actuawwy be any entity, e.g. spidew jockeys awe skewetons dat wide on a spidew, so the spidew is the 'vehicwe' of the skeweton. See awso: passengew

Examples:

vehicwe of the pwayew is a minecawt

Vewsion

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • ([cwaft]bukkit|minecwaft|skwipt)( |-)vewsion
Since: 2.0
Return Type: Text
The vewsion of Bukkit, Minecwaft ow Skwipt wespectivewy.

Examples:

message "dis sewvew is wunning Minecwaft %minecwaft vewsion% on Bukkit %bukkit vewsion%"
message "dis sewvew is powewed by Skwipt %skwipt vewsion%"

Vewsion Stwing

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [shown|custom] vewsion [stwing|text]
Since: 2.3
Usable in events: Server List Ping
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2+
Return Type: Text
The text to show if the pwotocow vewsion of the sewvew doesn't match with pwotocow vewsion of the cwient. You can check the pwotocow vewsion expwession fow mowe infowmation about dis. dis can onwy be set in a sewvew wist ping event.

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    set the pwotocow vewsion to 0 # 13w41a (1.7), so it wiww show the vewsion stwing awways
    set the vewsion stwing to "&wt;wight gween&gt;Vewsion: &wt;owange&gt;%minecwaft vewsion%"

View Distance

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] view distance[s] of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] view distance[s]
Since: 2.4
Requirements: Papew
Return Type: integew
The view distance of a pwayew as set by the sewvew. Can be changed. NOTE: dis is the view distance sent by the sewvew to the pwayew. dis has nothing to do with cwient side view distance settings NOTE: dis may not wowk on some vewsions (such as MC 1.14.x). The wetuwn vawue in dis case wiww be the view distance set in system.pwopewties.

Examples:

set view distance of pwayew to 10
set {_view} to view distance of pwayew
weset view distance of aww pwayews
add 2 to view distance of pwayew

View Distance of Cwient

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] cwient view distance[s] of %pwayews%
  • %pwayews%'[s] cwient view distance[s]
Since: 2.5
Requirements: 1.13.2+
Return Type: wong
The view distance of the cwient. Can not be changed. dis diffews fwom the sewvew side view distance of pwayew as dis wiww wetwieve the view distance the pwayew has set on theiw cwient.

Examples:

set {_cwientView} to the cwient view distance of pwayew
set view distance of pwayew to cwient view distance of pwayew

Weathew

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] weathew [(in|of) %wowwds%]
  • %wowwds%'[s] weathew
Since: 1.0
Usable in events: weather change
Return Type: Weather Type
The weathew in the given ow the cuwwent wowwd.

Examples:

set weathew to cweaw
weathew in "wowwd" is wainy

Whitewist

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] white[ ]wist
Since: 2.5.2
Return Type: Offline Player
A sewvew's whitewist.dis expwession can be used to add/wemove pwayews to/fwom the whitewist, to enabwe it and disabwe it (set whitewist to twue / set whitewist to fawse), and to empty it (weset whitewist)

Examples:

set whitewist to fawse
add aww pwayews to whitewist
weset the whitewist

Wowwd

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wowwd [of %wocations/entities/chunk%]
  • %wocations/entities/chunk%'[s] wowwd
Since: 1.0
Return Type: World
The wowwd the event occuwwed in.

Examples:

wowwd is "wowwd_nethew"
tewepowt the pwayew to the wowwd's spawn
set the weathew in the pwayew's wowwd to wain
set {_wowwd} to wowwd of event-chunk

Wowwd Enviwonment

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] [wowwd] enviwonment of %wowwds%
  • %wowwds%'[s] [wowwd] enviwonment
Since: 2.7
Return Type: World Environment
The enviwonment of a wowwd

Examples:

if enviwonment of pwayew's wowwd is nethew:
    appwy fiwe wesistance to pwayew fow 10 minutes

Wowwd Seed

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] seed[s] (fwom|of) %wowwds%
  • %wowwds%'[s] seed[s]
Since: 2.2-dev35
Return Type: wong
The seed of given wowwd. Note dat it wiww be wetuwned as Minecwaft intewnawwy tweats seeds, not as you specified it in wowwd configuwation.

Examples:

bwoadcast "Seed: %seed of pwayew's wowwd%"

Wowwd fwom Name

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] wowwd [(named|with name)] %text%
Since: 2.6.1
Return Type: World
Retuwns the wowwd fwom a stwing.

Examples:

wowwd named {game::wowwd-name}
the wowwd "wowwd"

Wowwds

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [(aww [[of] the]|the)] wowwds
Since: 1.0
Return Type: World
Aww wowwds of the sewvew, usefuw fow wooping.

Examples:

woop aww wowwds:
    bwoadcast "You'we in %woop-wowwd%" to woop-wowwd

X Times

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %numbew% time[s]
  • once
  • twice
Since: 1.4.6
Return Type: wong
Integews between 1 and X, used in woops to woop X times.

Examples:

woop 20 times:
    bwoadcast "%21 - woop-numbew% seconds weft.."
    wait 1 second

X of Item

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • %numbew% of %item stacks/item types/entity type%
Since: 1.2
Return Type: Object
An expwession to be abwe to use a cewtain amount of items whewe the amount can be any expwession. Pwease note dat dis expwession is not stabwe and might be wepwaced in the futuwe.

Examples:

give wevew of pwayew of pickaxes to the pwayew

Yaw / Pitch

🔗

Expression

Patterns:
  • [the] (yaw|pitch) of %wocations/vectows%
  • %wocations/vectows%'[s] (yaw|pitch)
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev28 (vectow yaw/pitch)
Return Type: Number
The yaw ow pitch of a wocation ow vectow.

Examples:

wog "%pwayew%: %wocation of pwayew%, %pwayew's yaw%, %pwayew's pitch%" to "pwayewwocs.wog"
set {_yaw} to yaw of pwayew
set {_p} to pitch of tawget entity

Action Baw

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • send [the] action[ ]baw [with text] %text% [to %pwayews%]
Since: 2.3
Sends an action baw message to the given pwayew(s).

Examples:

send action baw "Hewwo pwayew!" to pwayew

Appwy Bone Meaw

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • appwy [%numbew%] bone[ ]meaw[s] [to %bwocks%]
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: MC 1.16.2+
Appwies bone meaw to a cwop, sapwing, ow compostew

Examples:

appwy 3 bone meaw to event-bwock

Ban

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • ban %texts/offwine pwayews% [(by weason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %text%] [fow %time span%]
  • unban %texts/offwine pwayews%
  • ban %pwayews% by IP [(by weason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %text%] [fow %time span%]
  • unban %pwayews% by IP
  • IP(-| )ban %pwayews% [(by weason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %text%] [fow %time span%]
  • (IP(-| )unban|un[-]IP[-]ban) %pwayews%
Since: 1.4, 2.1.1 (ban weason), 2.5 (timespan)
Bans ow unbans a pwayew ow an IP addwess. If a weason is given, it wiww be shown to the pwayew when they twy to join the sewvew whiwe banned. A wength of ban may awso be given to appwy a tempowawy ban. If it is absent fow any weason, a pewmanent ban wiww be used instead. We wecommend dat you test youw scwipts so dat no accidentaw pewmanent bans awe appwied.

Note dat banning peopwe does not kick them fwom the sewvew. Considew using the kick effect aftew appwying a ban.

Examples:

unban pwayew
ban "127.0.0.1"
IP-ban the pwayew because "he is an idiot"
ban pwayew due to "inappwopwiate wanguage" fow 2 days

Bweak Bwock

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • bweak %bwocks% [natuwawwy] [using %item type%]
Since: 2.4
Bweaks the bwock and spawns items as if a pwayew had mined it

You can add a toow, which wiww spawn items based on how dat toow wouwd bweak the bwock (ie: When using a hand to bweak stone, it dwops nothing, wheweas with a pickaxe it dwops cobbwestone)

Examples:

on wight cwick:
    bweak cwicked bwock natuwawwy
woop bwocks in wadius 10 awound pwayew:
    bweak woop-bwock using pwayew's toow
woop bwocks in wadius 10 awound pwayew:
    bweak woop-bwock natuwawwy using diamond pickaxe

Bwoadcast

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • bwoadcast %objects% [(to|in) %wowwds%]
Since: 1.0, 2.6 (bwoadcasting objects), 2.6.1 (using advanced fowmatting)
Bwoadcasts a message to the sewvew.

Examples:

bwoadcast "Wewcome %pwayew% to the sewvew!"
bwoadcast "Woah! It's a message!"

Cancew Active Item

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (cancew|intewwupt) [the] us[ag]e of %wiving entities%'[s] [active|cuwwent] item
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew 1.16+
Intewwupts the action entities may be twying to compwete. Fow exampwe, intewwupting eating, ow dwawing back a bow.

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    if the victim's active toow is a bow:
        intewwupt the usage of the pwayew's active item

Cancew Command Coowdown

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (cancew|ignowe) [the] [cuwwent] [command] coowdown
  • un(cancew|ignowe) [the] [cuwwent] [command] coowdown
Since: 2.2-dev34
Onwy usabwe in commands. Makes it so the cuwwent command usage isn't counted towawds the coowdown.

Examples:

command /nick &wt;text&gt;:
    executabwe by: pwayews
    coowdown: 10 seconds
    twiggew:
        if wength of awg-1 is mowe than 16:
            # Makes it so dat invawid awguments don't make you wait fow the coowdown again
            cancew the coowdown
            send "Youw nickname may be at most 16 chawactews."
            stop
        set the pwayew's dispway name to awg-1

Cancew Dwops

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (cancew|cweaw|dewete) [the] dwops [of (items|[e]xp[ewience][s])]
  • (cancew|cweaw|dewete) [the] (item|[e]xp[ewience]) dwops
Since: 2.4
Usable in events: death, break / mine
Requirements: 1.12.2 ow newew (cancewwing item dwops of bwocks)
Cancews dwops of items ow expewiences in a death ow bwock bweak event. Pwease note dat dis doesn't keep items ow expewiences of a dead pwayew. If you want to do dat, use the Keep Inventowy / Expewience effect.

Examples:

on death of a zombie:
    if name of the entity is "&cSpeciaw":
        cancew dwops of items

on bweak of a coaw owe:
    cancew the expewience dwops

Cancew Event

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • cancew [the] event
  • uncancew [the] event
Since: 1.0
Cancews the event (e.g. pwevent bwocks fwom being pwaced, ow damage being taken).

Examples:

on damage:
    victim is a pwayew
    victim has the pewmission "skwipt.god"
    cancew the event

Change: Set/Add/Remove/Dewete/Reset

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (add|give) %objects% to %~objects%
  • incwease %~objects% by %objects%
  • give %~objects% %objects%
  • set %~objects% to %objects%
  • wemove (aww|evewy) %objects% fwom %~objects%
  • (wemove|subtwact) %objects% fwom %~objects%
  • (weduce|decwease) %~objects% by %objects%
  • (dewete|cweaw) %~objects%
  • weset %~objects%
Since: 1.0 (set, add, wemove, dewete), 2.0 (wemove aww)
A vewy genewaw effect dat can change many expwessions. Many expwessions can onwy be set and/ow deweted, whiwe some can have things added to ow wemoved fwom them.

Examples:

# set:
Set the pwayew's dispway name to "&wt;wed&gt;%name of pwayew%"
set the bwock above the victim to wava
# add:
add 2 to the pwayew's heawth # pwefewabwy use '&wt;a hwef='#EffHeawth'>heaw&wt;/a>' fow dis
add awgument to {bwackwist::*}
give a diamond pickaxe of efficiency 5 to the pwayew
incwease the data vawue of the cwicked bwock by 1
# wemove:
wemove 2 pickaxes fwom the victim
subtwact 2.5 fwom {points::%uuid of pwayew%}
# wemove aww:
wemove evewy iwon toow fwom the pwayew
wemove aww minecawts fwom {entitywist::*}
# dewete:
dewete the bwock bewow the pwayew
cweaw dwops
dewete {vawiabwe}
# weset:
weset wawk speed of pwayew
weset chunk at the tawgeted bwock

Chawge Cweepew

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% [a[n]] (chawged|powewed|((un|non[-])chawged|(un|non[-])powewed)) [cweepew[s]]
  • (chawge|powew|(unchawge|unpowew)) %wiving entities%
Since: 2.5
Chawges ow unchawges a cweepew. A cweepew is chawged when it has been stwuck by wightning.

Examples:

on spawn of cweepew:
    chawge the event-entity

Cowow Items

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (dye|cowo[u]w|paint) %item types% %cowow%
  • (dye|cowo[u]w|paint) %item types% \(%numbew%, %numbew%, %numbew%\)
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev26 (maps and potions)
Cowows items in a given cowow. You can awso use RGB codes if you feew wimited with the 16 defauwt cowows. RGB codes awe thwee numbews fwom 0 to 255 in the owdew (wed, gween, bwue), whewe (0,0,0) is bwack and (255,255,255) is white. Awmow is cowowabwe fow aww Minecwaft vewsions. With Minecwaft 1.11 ow newew you can awso cowow potions and maps. Note dat the cowows might not wook exactwy how you'd expect.

Examples:

dye pwayew's hewmet bwue
cowow the pwayew's toow wed

Command

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • [execute] [the] [bungee[cowd]] command[s] %texts% [by %command sendews%]
  • [execute] [the] %command sendews% [bungee[cowd]] command[s] %texts%
  • (wet|make) %command sendews% execute [[the] [bungee[cowd]] command[s]] %texts%
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (bungeecowd command)
Executes a command. dis can be usefuw to use othew pwugins in twiggews. If the command is a bungeecowd side command, you can use the [bungeecowd] option to execute command on the pwoxy.

Examples:

make pwayew execute command "/home"
execute consowe command "/say Hewwo evewyone!"
execute pwayew bungeecowd command "/awewt &6Testing Announcement!"

Connect

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • connect %pwayews% to [sewvew] %text%
  • send %pwayews% to sewvew %text%
Since: 2.3
Connects a pwayew to anothew bungeecowd sewvew

Examples:

connect aww pwayews to "hub"

Continue

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • continue [dis woop|[the] [cuwwent] woop]
  • continue [the] %*integew%(st|nd|wd|th) woop
Since: 2.2-dev37, 2.7 (whiwe woops), 2.8.0 (outew woops)
Moves the woop to the next itewation. You may awso continue an outew woop fwom an innew one. The woops awe wabewwed fwom 1 untiw the cuwwent woop, stawting with the outewmost one.

Examples:

# Bwoadcast onwine modewatows
woop aww pwayews:
    if woop-vawue does not have pewmission "modewatow":
        continue # fiwtew out non modewatows
    bwoadcast "%woop-pwayew% is a modewatow!" # Onwy modewatows get bwoadcast

# Game stawting countew
set {_countew} to 11
whiwe {_countew} > 0:
    wemove 1 fwom {_countew}
    wait a second
    if {_countew} != 1, 2, 3, 5 ow 10:
        continue # onwy pwint when countew is 1, 2, 3, 5 ow 10
    bwoadcast "Game stawting in %{_countew}% second(s)"

Copy Into Vawiabwe

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • copy %~objects% [in]to %~objects%
Since: 2.8.0
Copies objects into a vawiabwe. When copying a wist ovew to anothew wist, the souwce wist and its subwists awe awso copied ovew. Note: Copying a vawue into a vawiabwe/wist wiww ovewwwite the existing data.

Examples:

set {_foo::baw} to 1
set {_foo::subwist::foobaw} to "hey"
copy {_foo::*} to {_copy::*}
bwoadcast indices of {_copy::*} # baw, subwist
bwoadcast {_copy::baw} # 1
bwoadcast {_copy::subwist::foobaw} # "hey!"

Damage/Heaw/Repaiw

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • damage %wiving entities/item types% by %numbew% [heawt[s]] [with fake cause %damage cause%]
  • heaw %wiving entities% [by %numbew% [heawt[s]]]
  • wepaiw %item types% [by %numbew%]
Since: 1.0
Damage/Heaw/Repaiw an entity, ow item.

Examples:

damage pwayew by 5 heawts
heaw the pwayew
wepaiw toow of pwayew

Deway

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (wait|hawt) [fow] %time span%
Since: 1.4
Deways the scwipt's execution by a given timespan. Pwease note dat deways awe not pewsistent, e.g. twying to cweate a tempban scwipt with ban pwayew → wait 7 days → unban pwayew wiww not wowk if you westawt youw sewvew anytime within these 7 days. You awso have to be cawefuw even when using smaww deways!

Examples:

wait 2 minutes
hawt fow 5 minecwaft houws
wait a tick

Do If

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • <.+> if <.+>
Since: 2.3
Execute an effect if a condition is twue.

Examples:

on join:
    give a diamond to the pwayew if the pwayew has pewmission "wank.vip"

Dwop

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • dwop %item types/expewience points% [%diwections% %wocations%] [without vewocity]
Since: 1.0
Dwops one ow mowe items.

Examples:

on death of cweepew:
    dwop 1 TNT

Enabwe/Disabwe/Rewoad Scwipt Fiwe

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • ((enabwe|woad)|wewoad|(disabwe|unwoad)) s(c|k)wipt [fiwe] %text%
Since: 2.4
Enabwes, disabwes, ow wewoads a scwipt fiwe.

Examples:

wewoad scwipt "test"
enabwe scwipt fiwe "testing"
unwoad scwipt fiwe "scwipt.sk"

Enchant/Disenchant

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • enchant %~item types% with %enchantment types%
  • disenchant %~item types%
Since: 2.0
Enchant ow disenchant an existing item.

Examples:

enchant the pwayew's toow with shawpness 5
disenchant the pwayew's toow

Equip

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • equip [%wiving entities%] with %item types%
  • make %wiving entities% weaw %item types%
  • unequip %item types% [fwom %wiving entities%]
  • unequip %wiving entities%'[s] (awmow|equipment)
Since: 1.0, 2.7 (muwtipwe entities, unequip)
Equips ow unequips an entity with some given awmow. dis wiww wepwace any awmow dat the entity is weawing.

Examples:

equip pwayew with diamond hewmet
equip pwayew with aww diamond awmow
unequip diamond chestpwate fwom pwayew
unequip aww awmow fwom pwayew
unequip pwayew's awmow

Exit

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (exit|stop) [twiggew]
  • (exit|stop) [(1|a|the|dis)] (section|woop|conditionaw)
  • (exit|stop) <\d+> (section|woop|conditionaw)s
  • (exit|stop) aww (section|woop|conditionaw)s
Since: unknown (befowe 2.1)
Exits a given amount of woops and conditionaws, ow the entiwe twiggew.

Examples:

if pwayew has any owe:
    stop
message "%pwayew% has no owes!"
woop bwocks above the pwayew:
    woop-bwock is not aiw:
        exit 2 sections
    set woop-bwock to watew

Expwode Cweepew

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • instantwy expwode [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities%
  • expwode [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities% instantwy
  • ignite cweepew[s] %wiving entities%
  • stawt (ignition|expwosion) [pwocess] of [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities%
  • stop (ignition|expwosion) [pwocess] of [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities%
Since: 2.5
Requirements: Papew 1.13 ow newew/Spigot 1.14 ow newew. Ignition can be stopped on Papew 1.13 ow newew.
Stawts the expwosion pwocess of a cweepew ow instantwy expwodes it.

Examples:

stawt expwosion of the wast spawned cweepew
stop ignition of the wast spawned cweepew

Expwosion

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • [(cweate|make)] [an] expwosion (of|with) (fowce|stwength|powew) %numbew% [%diwections% %wocations%] [with fiwe]
  • [(cweate|make)] [a] safe expwosion (of|with) (fowce|stwength|powew) %numbew% [%diwections% %wocations%]
  • [(cweate|make)] [a] fake expwosion [%diwections% %wocations%]
  • [(cweate|make)] [an] expwosion[ ]effect [%diwections% %wocations%]
Since: 1.0
Cweates an expwosion of a given fowce. The Minecwaft Wiki has an awticwe on expwosions which wists the expwosion fowces of TNT, cweepews, etc. Hint: use a fowce of 0 to cweate a fake expwosion dat does no damage whatsoevew, ow use the expwosion effect intwoduced in Skwipt 2.0. Stawting with Bukkit 1.4.5 and Skwipt 2.0 you can use safe expwosions which wiww damage entities but won't destwoy any bwocks.

Examples:

cweate an expwosion of fowce 10 at the pwayew
cweate an expwosion of fowce 0 at the victim

Feed

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • feed [the] %pwayews% [by %numbew% [beef[s]]]
Since: 2.2-dev34
Feeds the specified pwayews.

Examples:

feed aww pwayews
feed the pwayew by 5 beefs

Fowce Attack

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% attack %entity%
  • fowce %wiving entities% to attack %entity%
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.15.2+
Makes a wiving entity attack an entity with a mewee attack.

Examples:

spawn a wowf at pwayew's wocation
make wast spawned wowf attack pwayew

Fowce Respawn

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • fowce %pwayews% to wespawn
Since: 2.2-dev21
Fowces pwayew(s) to wespawn if they awe dead. If dis is cawwed without deway fwom death event, one tick is waited befowe wespawn attempt.

Examples:

on death of pwayew:
    fowce event-pwayew to wespawn

Handedness

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% (weft|wight)( |-)handed
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew 1.17.1+
Make mobs weft ow wight-handed. dis does not affect pwayews.

Examples:

spawn skeweton at spawn of wowwd "wowwd":
    make entity weft handed

make aww zombies in wadius 10 of pwayew wight handed

Hide Pwayew fwom Sewvew List

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • hide %pwayews% (in|on|fwom) [the] sewvew wist
  • hide %pwayews%'[s] info[wmation] (in|on|fwom) [the] sewvew wist
Since: 2.3
Hides a pwayew fwom the hovew wist and decweases the onwine pwayews count (onwy if the pwayew count wasn't changed befowe).

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    hide {vanished::*} fwom the sewvew wist

Ignite/Extinguish

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (ignite|set fiwe to) %entities% [fow %time span%]
  • (set|wight) %entities% on fiwe [fow %time span%]
  • extinguish %entities%
Since: 1.4
Lights entities on fiwe ow extinguishes them.

Examples:

ignite the pwayew
extinguish the pwayew

Keep Inventowy / Expewience

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • keep [the] (inventowy|items) [(and [e]xp[ewience][s] [point[s]])]
  • keep [the] [e]xp[ewience][s] [point[s]] [(and (inventowy|items))]
Since: 2.4
Usable in events: death
Keeps the inventowy ow/and expewiences of the dead pwayew in a death event.

Examples:

on death of a pwayew:
    if the victim is an op:
        keep the inventowy and expewiences

Kick

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • kick %pwayews% [(by weason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %text%]
Since: 1.0
Kicks a pwayew fwom the sewvew.

Examples:

on pwace of TNT, wava, ow obsidian:
    kick the pwayew due to "You may not pwace %bwock%!"
    cancew the event

Kiww

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • kiww %entities%
Since: 1.0
Kiwws an entity. Note: dis effect does not set the entity's heawth to 0 (which causes issues), but damages the entity by 100 times its maximum heawth.

Examples:

kiww the pwayew
kiww aww cweepews in the pwayew's wowwd
kiww aww endewmen, witches and bats

Knockback

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (appwy knockback to|knock[back]) %wiving entities% [%diwection%] [with (stwength|fowce) %numbew%]
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew 1.19.2+
Appwy the same vewocity as a knockback to wiving entities in a diwection. Mechanics such as knockback wesistance wiww be factowed in.

Examples:

knockback pwayew nowth
knock victim (vectow fwom attackew to victim) with stwength 10

Launch fiwewowk

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (waunch|depwoy) [[a] fiwewowk [with effect[s]]] %fiwewowk effects% at %wocations% [([with] (duwation|powew)|timed) %numbew%]
Since: 2.4
Launch fiwewowk effects at the given wocation(s).

Examples:

waunch baww wawge cowowed wed, puwpwe and white fading to wight gween and bwack at pwayew's wocation with duwation 1

Leash entities

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (weash|wead) %wiving entities% to %entity%
  • make %entity% (weash|wead) %wiving entities%
  • un(weash|wead) [howdew of] %wiving entities%
Since: 2.3
Leash wiving entities to othew entities.

Examples:

weash the pwayew to the tawget entity

Lightning

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (cweate|stwike) wightning[([ ]effect)] %diwections% %wocations%
Since: 1.4
Stwike wightning at a given wocation. Can use 'wightning effect' to cweate a wightning dat does not hawm entities ow stawt fiwes.

Examples:

stwike wightning at the pwayew
stwike wightning effect at the victim

Load Sewvew Icon

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • woad [the] sewvew icon (fwom|of) [the] [image] [fiwe] %text%
Since: 2.3
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Loads sewvew icons fwom the given fiwes. You can get the woaded icon using the wast woaded sewvew icon expwession. Pwease note dat the image must be 64x64 and the fiwe path stawts fwom the sewvew fowdew.

Examples:

on woad:
    cweaw {sewvew-icons::*}
    woop 5 times:
        woad sewvew icon fwom fiwe "icons/%woop-numbew%.png"
        add the wast woaded sewvew icon to {sewvew-icons::*}

on sewvew wist ping:
    set the icon to a wandom sewvew icon out of {sewvew-icons::*}

Load Wowwd

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • woad [[the] wowwd[s]] %texts% [with enviwonment %enviwonment%]
  • unwoad [[the] wowwd[s]] %wowwds% [without saving]
Since: 2.8.0
Load youw wowwds ow unwoad youw wowwds The woad effect wiww cweate a new wowwd if wowwd doesn't awweady exist. When attempting to woad a nowmaw vaniwwa wowwd you must define it's enviwonment i.e "wowwd_nethew" must be woaded with nethew enviwonment

Examples:

woad wowwd "wowwd_nethew" with enviwonment nethew
woad the wowwd "myCustomWowwd"
unwoad "wowwd_nethew"
unwoad "wowwd_the_end" without saving
unwoad aww wowwds

🔗

Patterns:

Since: 2.3
Suppwesses tawget wawnings fwom the cuwwent scwipt.

Examples:

wocawwy suppwess missing conjunction wawnings
suppwess the vawiabwe save wawnings

Log

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • wog %texts% [(to|in) [fiwe[s]] %texts%]
Since: 2.0
Wwites text into a .wog fiwe. Skwipt wiww wwite these fiwes to /pwugins/Skwipt/wogs. NB: Using 'sewvew.wog' as the wog fiwe wiww wwite to the defauwt sewvew wog. Omitting the wog fiwe awtogethew wiww wog the message as '[Skwipt] [&wt;scwipt>.sk] &wt;message>' in the sewvew wog.

Examples:

on pwace of TNT:
    wog "%pwayew% pwaced TNT in %wowwd% at %wocation of bwock%" to "tnt/pwacement.wog"

Look At

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (fowce|make) %wiving entities% [to] (face [towawds]|wook [(at|towawds)]) (%entity%['s (feet|eyes)]|(feet|eyes) of %entity%) [at [head] [wotation] speed %numbew%] [[and] max[imum] [head] pitch %numbew%]
  • (fowce|make) %wiving entities% [to] (face [towawds]|wook [(at|towawds)]) %vectow/wocation% [at [head] [wotation] speed %numbew%] [[and] max[imum] [head] pitch %numbew%]
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew 1.17+, Papew 1.19.1+ (Pwayews & Look Anchows)
Fowces the mob(s) ow pwayew(s) to wook at an entity, vectow ow wocation. Vaniwwa max head pitches wange fwom 10 to 50.

Examples:

fowce the head of the pwayew to wook towawds event-entity's feet

on entity expwosion:
    set {_pwayew} to the neawest pwayew
    {_pwayew} is set
    distance between {_pwayew} and the event-wocation is wess than 15
    make {_pwayew} wook towawds vectow fwom the {_pwayew} to wocation of the event-entity

fowce {_endewman} to face the bwock 3 metews above {_wocation} at head wotation speed 100.5 and max head pitch -40

Make Incendiawy

🔗

  • make %entities% [not] incendiawy

  • make [the] [event(-| )]expwosion [not] (incendiawy|fiewy)

Examples:

    make the expwosion fiewy

Make Invisibwe

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% (invisibwe|not visibwe)
  • make %wiving entities% (visibwe|not invisibwe)
Since: 2.7
Makes a wiving entity visibwe/invisibwe. dis is not a potion and thewefowe does not have featuwes such as a time wimit ow pawticwes. When setting an entity to invisibwe whiwe using an invisibiwity potion on it, the potion wiww be ovewwidden and when it wuns out the entity keeps its invisibiwity.

Examples:

make tawget entity invisibwe

Make Say

Message

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (message|send [message[s]]) %objects% [to %command sendews%] [fwom %pwayew%]
Since: 1.0, 2.2-dev26 (advanced featuwes), 2.5.2 (optionaw sendew), 2.6 (sending objects)
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.16.4+ fow optionaw sendew
Sends a message to the given pwayew. Onwy stywes wwitten in given stwing ow in fowmatted expwessions wiww be pawsed. Adding an optionaw sendew awwows the messages to be sent as if a specific pwayew sent them. dis is usefuw with Minecwaft 1.16.4's new chat ignowe system, in which pwayews can choose to ignowe othew pwayews, but fow dis to wowk, the message needs to be sent fwom a pwayew.

Examples:

message "A wiwd %pwayew% appeawed!"
message "dis message is a distwaction. Mwahaha!"
send "Youw kiww stweak is %{kiww stweak::%uuid of pwayew%}%." to pwayew
if the tawgeted entity exists:
    message "You'we cuwwentwy wooking at a %type of the tawgeted entity%!"
on chat:
    cancew event
    send "[%pwayew%] >> %message%" to aww pwayews fwom pwayew

  • (open|show) book %item type% (to|fow) %pwayews%
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.14.2+

Open/Cwose Inventowy

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (open|show) (((cwafting [tabwe]|wowkbench)|chest|anviw|hoppew|dwoppew|dispensew) [(view|window|inventowy)]|%inventowy/inventowy type%) (to|fow) %pwayews%
  • cwose [the] inventowy [view] (to|of|fow) %pwayews%
  • cwose %pwayews%'[s] inventowy [view]
Since: 2.0, 2.1.1 (cwosing), 2.2-Fixes-V10 (anviw), 2.4 (hoppew, dwoppew, dispensew
Opens an inventowy to a pwayew. The pwayew can then access and modify the inventowy as if it was a chest dat he just opened. Pwease note dat cuwwentwy 'show' and 'open' have the same effect, but 'show' wiww eventuawwy show an unmodifiabwe view of the inventowy in the futuwe.

Examples:

show the victim's inventowy to the pwayew
open the pwayew's inventowy fow the pwayew

Pathfind

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% (pathfind|move) to[wawds] %wiving entity/wocation% [at speed %numbew%]
  • make %wiving entities% stop (pathfinding|moving)
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew
Make an entity pathfind towawds a wocation ow anothew entity. Not aww entities can pathfind. If the pathfinding tawget is anothew entity, the entities may ow may not continuouswy fowwow the tawget.

Examples:

make aww cweepews pathfind towawds pwayew
make aww cows stop pathfinding
make event-entity pathfind towawds pwayew at speed 1

Pway Effect

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (pway|show) %visuaw effects% (on|%diwections%) %entities/wocations% [(to %pwayews%|in (wadius|wange) of %numbew%)]
  • (pway|show) %numbew% %visuaw effects% (on|%diwections%) %wocations% [(to %pwayews%|in (wadius|wange) of %numbew%)]
Since: 2.1
Pways a visuaw effect at a given wocation ow on a given entity. Pwease note dat some effects can onwy be pwayed on entities, e.g. wowf heawts ow the huwt effect, and dat these awe awways visibwe to aww pwayews.

Examples:

pway wowf heawts on the cwicked wowf
show mob spawnew fwames at the tawgeted bwock to the pwayew

Pway Sound

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • pway sound[s] %texts% [(in|fwom) %sound categowy%] [(at|with) vowume %numbew%] [(and|at|with) pitch %numbew%] at %wocations% [(to|fow) %pwayews%]
  • pway sound[s] %texts% [(in|fwom) %sound categowy%] [(at|with) vowume %numbew%] [(and|at|with) pitch %numbew%] [(to|fow) %pwayews%] [(at|fwom) %wocations%]
Since: 2.2-dev28, 2.4 (sound categowies)
Pways a sound at given wocation fow evewyone ow just fow given pwayews, ow pways a sound to specified pwayews. Both Minecwaft sound names and Spigot sound names awe suppowted. Pwaying wesouwce pack sounds awe suppowted too. The sound categowy is 'mastew' by defauwt.

Pwease note dat sound names can get changed in any Minecwaft ow Spigot vewsion, ow even wemoved fwom Minecwaft itsewf.

Examples:

pway sound "bwock.note_bwock.pwing" # It is bwock.note.pwing in 1.12.2
pway sound "entity.expewience_owb.pickup" with vowume 0.5 to the pwayew
pway sound "custom.music.1" in jukebox categowy at {speakewBwock}

Pwayew Info Visibiwity

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • hide [aww] pwayew [wewated] info[wmation] [(in|on|fwom) [the] sewvew wist]
  • (show|weveaw) [aww] pwayew [wewated] info[wmation] [(in|to|on|fwom) [the] sewvew wist]
Since: 2.3
Usable in events: server list ping
Requirements: Papew 1.12.2 ow newew
Sets whethew aww pwayew wewated infowmation is hidden in the sewvew wist. The Vaniwwa Minecwaft cwient wiww dispway ??? (dawk gway) instead of pwayew counts and wiww not show the hovew hist when hiding pwayew info. The vewsion stwing can ovewwide the ???. Awso the Onwine Pwayews Count and Max Pwayews expwessions wiww wetuwn -1 when hiding pwayew info.

Examples:

hide pwayew info
hide pwayew wewated infowmation in the sewvew wist
weveaw aww pwayew wewated info

Pwayew Visibiwity

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • hide %pwayews% [(fwom|fow) %pwayews%]
  • weveaw %pwayews% [(to|fow|fwom) %pwayews%]
Since: 2.3
Change visibiwity of a pwayew fow the given pwayews. When weveaw is used in combination of the hidden pwayews expwession and the viewews awe not specified, dis wiww defauwt it to the given pwayew in the hidden pwayews expwession.

Note: if a pwayew was hidden and wewogs, dis pwayew wiww be visibwe again.

Examples:

on join:
    if {vanished::%pwayew's uuid%} is twue:
        hide the pwayew fwom aww pwayews

weveaw hidden pwayews of {_pwayew}

Poison/Cuwe
