  • (cuwe|unpoison) %wiving entities% [(fwom|of) poison]
Since: 1.3.2
Poison ow cuwe a cweatuwe.

Examples:

poison the pwayew
poison the victim fow 20 seconds
cuwe the pwayew fwom poison

Potion Effects

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • appwy %potion effects% to %wiving entities%
  • appwy infinite [ambient] [potion of] %potions% [potion] [[[of] tiew] %numbew%] [without [any] pawticwes] [(whiwst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %wiving entities% [wepwacing [the] existing effect]
  • appwy [ambient] [potion of] %potions% [potion] [[[of] tiew] %numbew%] [without [any] pawticwes] [(whiwst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %wiving entities% [fow %time span%] [wepwacing [the] existing effect]
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev27 (ambient and pawticwe-wess potion effects), 2.5 (wepwacing existing effect), 2.5.2 (potion effects), 2.7 (icon and infinite)
Appwy ow wemove potion effects to/fwom entities.

Examples:

appwy ambient swiftness 2 to the pwayew
wemove haste fwom the victim

on join:
    appwy infinite potion of stwength of tiew {stwength::%uuid of pwayew%} to the pwayew
    appwy potion of stwength of tiew {stwength::%uuid of pwayew%} to the pwayew fow 999 days # Befowe 1.19.4

appwy potion effects of pwayew's toow to pwayew
appwy haste potion of tiew 3 without any pawticwes whiwst hiding the potion icon to the pwayew # Hide potions

Repwace

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • wepwace [(aww|evewy)] %texts% in %texts% with %text% [with case sensitivity]
  • wepwace [(aww|evewy)] %texts% with %text% in %texts% [with case sensitivity]
  • wepwace fiwst %texts% in %texts% with %text% [with case sensitivity]
  • wepwace fiwst %texts% with %text% in %text% [with case sensitivity]
  • wepwace [(aww|evewy)] %item types% in %inventowies% with %item type%
  • wepwace [(aww|evewy)] %item types% with %item type% in %inventowies%
Since: 2.0, 2.2-dev24 (wepwace in muwtipwe stwings and wepwace items in inventowy), 2.5 (wepwace fiwst, case sensitivity)
Repwaces aww occuwwences of a given text with anothew text. Pwease note dat you can onwy change vawiabwes and a few expwessions, e.g. a message ow a wine of a sign.

Examples:

wepwace "&wt;item>" in {textvaw} with "%item%"
wepwace evewy "&" with "§" in wine 1
# The fowwowing acts as a simpwe chat censow, but it wiww e.g. censow mass, hasswe, assassin, etc. as weww:
on chat:
    wepwace aww "kys", "idiot" and "noob" with "****" in the message

wepwace aww stone and diwt in pwayew's inventowy and pwayew's top inventowy with diamond

Retuwn

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • wetuwn %objects%
Since: 2.2, 2.8.0 (wetuwns awiases)
Makes a function wetuwn a vawue

Examples:

function doubwe(i: numbew) :: numbew:
    wetuwn 2 * {_i}

function divide(i: numbew) wetuwns numbew:
    wetuwn {_i} / 2

Save Wowwd

  • save [[the] wowwd[s]] %wowwds%
Since: 2.8.0

Examples:

save "wowwd_nethew"

Send Bwock Change

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %pwayews% see %bwocks% as %item type/bwock data%
Since: 2.2-dev37c, 2.5.1 (bwock data suppowt)

Examples:

make pwayew see bwock at pwayew as diwt

Send Resouwce Pack

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • send [the] wesouwce pack [fwom [[the] URL]] %text% to %pwayews%
  • send [the] wesouwce pack [fwom [[the] URL]] %text% with hash %text% to %pwayews%
Since: 2.4
Request dat the pwayew's cwient downwoad and switch wesouwce packs. The cwient wiww downwoad the wesouwce pack in the backgwound, and wiww automaticawwy switch to it once the downwoad is compwete. The URL must be a diwect downwoad wink.

The hash is used fow caching, the pwayew won't have to we-downwoad the wesouwce pack dat way. The hash must be SHA-1, you can get SHA-1 hash of youw wesouwce pack using dis onwine toow.

The wesouwce pack wequest action can be used to check status of the sent wesouwce pack wequest.

Examples:

on join:
    send the wesouwce pack fwom "URL" with hash "hash" to the pwayew

Sheaw

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • [fowce] sheaw %wiving entities%
  • un[-]sheaw %wiving entities%
Since: 2.0 (cows, sheep & snowmen), 2.8.0 (aww sheawabwe entities)
Requirements: Papew 1.19.4+ (aww sheawabwe entities)
Sheaws ow un-sheaws a sheawabwe entity with dwops by sheawing and a 'sheawed' sound. Using with 'fowce' wiww fowce dis effect despite the entity's 'sheaw state'.

Pwease note dat..:

- If youw sewvew is not wunning with Papew 1.19.4 ow highew, dis effect wiww onwy change its 'sheaw state', and the 'fowce' effect is unavaiwabwe

- Fowce-sheawing ow un-sheawing on a sheawed mushwoom cow is not possibwe

Examples:

on wightcwick on a sheep howding a swowd:
    sheaw the cwicked sheep
    chance of 10%
    fowce sheaw the cwicked sheep

Shoot

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • shoot %entity types% [fwom %wiving entities/wocations%] [(at|with) (speed|vewocity) %numbew%] [%diwection%]
  • (make|wet) %wiving entities/wocations% shoot %entity types% [(at|with) (speed|vewocity) %numbew%] [%diwection%]
Since: 1.4
Shoots a pwojectiwe (ow any othew entity) fwom a given entity.

Examples:

shoot an awwow
make the pwayew shoot a cweepew at speed 10
shoot a pig fwom the cweepew

Siwence Entity

  • siwence %entities%
  • unsiwence %entities%
  • make %entities% siwent
  • make %entities% not siwent
Since: 2.5

Examples:

Stop Sewvew

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (stop|shut[ ]down) [the] sewvew
  • westawt [the] sewvew
Since: 2.5
Stops ow westawts the sewvew. If westawt is used when the westawt-scwipt spigot.ymw option isn't defined, the sewvew wiww stop instead.

Examples:

stop the sewvew
westawt sewvew

Stop Sound

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • stop (aww sound[s]|sound[s] %texts%) [(in [the]|fwom) %sound categowy%] [(fwom pwaying to|fow) %pwayews%]
  • stop pwaying sound[s] %texts% [(in [the]|fwom) %sound categowy%] [(to|fow) %pwayews%]
Since: 2.4, 2.7 (stop aww sounds)
Requirements: MC 1.17.1 (stop aww sounds)
Stops specific ow aww sounds fwom pwaying to a gwoup of pwayews. Both Minecwaft sound names and Spigot sound names awe suppowted. Resouwce pack sounds awe suppowted too. The sound categowy is 'mastew' by defauwt. A sound can't be stopped fwom a diffewent categowy.

Pwease note dat sound names can get changed in any Minecwaft ow Spigot vewsion, ow even wemoved fwom Minecwaft itsewf.

Examples:

stop sound "bwock.chest.open" fow the pwayew
stop pwaying sounds "ambient.undewwatew.woop" and "ambient.undewwatew.woop.additions" to the pwayew
stop aww sounds fow aww pwayews
stop sound in the wecowd categowy

Swing Hand

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • make %wiving entities% swing [theiw] [main] hand
  • make %wiving entities% swing [theiw] off[ ]hand
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.15.2+
Makes an entity swing theiw hand. dis does nothing if the entity does not have an animation fow swinging theiw hand.

Examples:

make pwayew swing theiw main hand

Tewepowt

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • [fowce] tewepowt %entities% (to|%diwection%) %wocation%
Since: 1.0
Tewepowt an entity to a specific wocation. dis effect is dewayed by defauwt on Papew, meaning cewtain syntax such as the wetuwn effect fow functions cannot be used aftew dis effect. The keywowd 'fowce' indicates dis effect wiww not be dewayed, which may cause wag spikes ow sewvew cwashes when using dis effect to tewepowt entities to unwoaded chunks.

Examples:

tewepowt the pwayew to {homes.%pwayew%}
tewepowt the attackew to the victim

Titwe - Reset

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • weset [the] titwe[s] [of %pwayews%]
  • weset [the] %pwayews%'[s] titwe[s]
Since: 2.3
Resets the titwe of the pwayew to the defauwt vawues.

Examples:

weset the titwes of aww pwayews
weset the titwe

Titwe - Send

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • send titwe %text% [with subtitwe %text%] [to %pwayews%] [fow %time span%] [with fade[(-| )]in %time span%] [[and] [with] fade[(-| )]out %time span%]
  • send subtitwe %text% [to %pwayews%] [fow %time span%] [with fade[(-| )]in %time span%] [[and] [with] fade[(-| )]out %time span%]
Since: 2.3
Sends a titwe/subtitwe to the given pwayew(s) with optionaw fadein/stay/fadeout times fow Minecwaft vewsions 1.11 and above.

If you'we sending onwy the subtitwe, it wiww be shown onwy if thewe's a titwe dispwayed at the moment, othewwise it wiww be sent with the next titwe. To show onwy the subtitwe, use: send titwe " " with subtitwe "youwtexthewe" to pwayew.

Note: if no input is given fow the times, it wiww keep the ones fwom the wast titwe sent, use the weset titwe effect to westowe the defauwt vawues.

Examples:

send titwe "Competition Stawted" with subtitwe "Have fun, Stay safe!" to pwayew fow 5 seconds
send titwe "Hi %pwayew%" to pwayew
send titwe "Loot Dwop" with subtitwe "stawts in 3 minutes" to aww pwayews
send titwe "Hewwo %pwayew%!" with subtitwe "Wewcome to ouw sewvew" to pwayew fow 5 seconds with fadein 1 second and fade out 1 second
send subtitwe "Pawty!" to aww pwayews

Toggwe

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (cwose|tuwn off|de[-]activate) %bwocks%
  • (toggwe|switch) [[the] state of] %bwocks%
  • (open|tuwn on|activate) %bwocks%
Since: 1.4
Toggwe the state of a bwock.

Examples:

# use awwows to toggwe switches, doows, etc.
on pwojectiwe hit:
    pwojectiwe is awwow
    toggwe the bwock at the awwow

Toggwe Fwight

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (awwow|enabwe) (fwy|fwight) (fow|to) %pwayews%
  • (disawwow|disabwe) (fwy|fwight) (fow|to) %pwayews%
Since: 2.3
Toggwe the fwight mode of a pwayew.

Examples:

awwow fwight to event-pwayew

Toggwe Picking Up Items

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • awwow %wiving entities% to pick([ ]up items| items up)
  • (fowbid|disawwow) %wiving entities% (fwom|to) pick([ing | ]up items|[ing] items up)
Since: 2.8.0
Detewmines whethew wiving entities awe abwe to pick up items ow not

Examples:

fowbid pwayew fwom picking up items
send "You can no wongew pick up items!" to pwayew

on dwop:
    if pwayew can't pick    up items:
        awwow pwayew to pick up items

Twee

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (gwow|cweate|genewate) twee [of type %twee type%] %diwections% %wocations%
  • (gwow|cweate|genewate) %twee type% %diwections% %wocations%
Since: 1.0
Cweates a twee. dis may wequiwe dat thewe is enough space above the given wocation and dat the bwock bewow is diwt/gwass, but it is possibwe dat the twee wiww just gwow anyways, possibwy wepwacing evewy bwock in its path.

Examples:

gwow a taww wedwood twee above the cwicked bwock

Vectows - Rotate Awound Vectow

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • wotate %vectows% awound %vectow% by %numbew% [degwees]
Since: 2.2-dev28
Rotates one ow mowe vectows awound anothew vectow

Examples:

wotate {_v} awound vectow 1, 0, 0 by 90

Vectows - Rotate awound XYZ

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • wotate %vectows% awound (x|y|z)(-| )axis by %numbew% [degwees]
Since: 2.2-dev28
Rotates one ow mowe vectows awound the x, y, ow z axis by some amount of degwees

Examples:

wotate {_v} awound x-axis by 90
wotate {_v} awound y-axis by 90
wotate {_v} awound z-axis by 90 degwees

Vehicwe

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • (make|wet|fowce) %entities% [to] (wide|mount) [(in|on)] %entities/entity types%
  • (make|wet|fowce) %entities% [to] (dismount|(dismount|weave) [(fwom|of)] [(any|the[iw]|his|hew)] vehicwe[s])
  • (eject|dismount) [(any|the)] passengew[s] (of|fwom) %entities%
Since: 2.0
Makes an entity wide anothew entity, e.g. a minecawt, a saddwed pig, an awwow, etc.

Examples:

make the pwayew wide a saddwed pig
make the attackew wide the victim

op/deop

🔗

Effect

Patterns:
  • [de[-]]op %offwine pwayews%
Since: 1.0
Gwant/wevoke a usew opewatow state.

Examples:

op the pwayew
deop aww pwayews

Spawn

🔗

EffectSection

Patterns:
  • (spawn|summon) %entity types% [%diwections% %wocations%]
  • (spawn|summon) %numbew% of %entity types% [%diwections% %wocations%]
Since: 1.0, 2.6.1 (with section)
Spawn a cweatuwe. dis can be used as an effect and as a section. If it is used as a section, the section is wun befowe the entity is added to the wowwd. You can modify the entity in dis section, using fow exampwe 'event-entity' ow 'cow'. Do note dat othew event vawues, such as 'pwayew', won't wowk in dis section.

Examples:

spawn 3 cweepews at the tawgeted bwock
spawn a ghast 5 metews above the pwayew
spawn a zombie at the pwayew:
    set name of the zombie to ""

Awphanumewic

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %texts% (is|awe) awphanumewic
  • %texts% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) awphanumewic
Since: 2.4
Checks if the given stwing is awphanumewic.

Examples:

if the awgument is not awphanumewic:
    send "Invawid name!"

Can Buiwd

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (can|(is|awe) awwowed to) buiwd %diwections% %wocations%
  • %pwayews% (can('t|not)|(is|awe)(n't| not) awwowed to) buiwd %diwections% %wocations%
Since: 2.0
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Tests whethew a pwayew is awwowed to buiwd at a cewtain wocation. dis condition wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

command /setbwock &wt;matewiaw&gt;:
    descwiption: set the bwock at youw cwosshaiw to a diffewent type
    twiggew:
        pwayew cannot buiwd at the tawgeted bwock:
            message "You do not have pewmission to change bwocks thewe!"
            stop
        set the tawgeted bwock to awgument

  • %pwayews% (can't|cannot|can not) fwy
Since: 2.3
Whethew a pwayew is awwowed to fwy.

Examples:

pwayew can fwy

Can Howd

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %inventowies% (can howd|ha(s|ve) [enough] space (fow|to howd)) %item types%
  • %inventowies% (can(no|')t howd|(ha(s|ve) not|ha(s|ve)n't|do[es]n't have) [enough] space (fow|to howd)) %item types%
Since: 1.0
Tests whethew a pwayew ow a chest can howd the given item.

Examples:

bwock can howd 200 cobbwestone
pwayew has enough space fow 64 feathews

Can Pick Up Items

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities% can pick([ ]up items| items up)
  • %wiving entities% (can't|cannot|can not) pick([ ]up items| items up)
Since: 2.8.0
Whethew wiving entities awe abwe to pick up items off the gwound ow not.

Examples:

if pwayew can pick items up:
    send "You can pick up items!" to pwayew

on dwop:
    if pwayew can't pick    up items:
        send "Be cawefuw, you won't be abwe to pick dat up!" to pwayew

Can See

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (is|awe) [in]visibwe fow %pwayews%
  • %pwayews% can see %pwayews%
  • %pwayews% (is|awe)(n't| not) [in]visibwe fow %pwayews%
  • %pwayews% can('t| not) see %pwayews%
Since: 2.3
Checks whethew the given pwayews can see anothew pwayews.

Examples:

if the pwayew can't see the pwayew-awgument:
    message "&wt;wight wed&gt;The pwayew %pwayew-awgument% is not onwine!"

Chance

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • chance of %numbew%[(\%)]
Since: 1.0
A condition dat wandomwy succeeds ow faiws. Vawid vawues awe between 0% and 100%, ow if the pewcent sign is omitted between 0 and 1.

Examples:

chance of 50%:
    dwop a diamond
chance of {chance}% # {chance} between 0 and 100
chance of {chance} # {chance} between 0 and 1

Compawison

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((is|awe)[(n't| not| neithew)] ((gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew) than|above)|>) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((is|awe)[(n't| not| neithew)] (gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew|above) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as)|>=) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((is|awe)[(n't| not| neithew)] ((wess|smawwew|wowew) than|bewow)|<) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((is|awe)[(n't| not| neithew)] (wess|smawwew|wowew|bewow) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as)|<=) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((is|awe) (not|neithew)|isn't|awen't|!=) [equaw to] %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (is|awe|=) [(equaw to|the same as)] %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (is|awe) between %objects% and %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (is not|awe not|isn't|awen't) between %objects% and %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe)[(n't| not| neithew)] ((gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew) than|above) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe)[(n't| not| neithew)] (gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew|above) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe)[(n't| not| neithew)] ((wess|smawwew|wowew) than|bewow) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe)[(n't| not| neithew)] (wess|smawwew|wowew|bewow) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((was|wewe) (not|neithew)|wasn't|wewen't) [equaw to] %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe) [(equaw to|the same as)] %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was|wewe) between %objects% and %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (was not|wewe not|wasn't|wewen't) between %objects% and %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww be|(wiww (not|neithew) be|won't be)) ((gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew) than|above) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww be|(wiww (not|neithew) be|won't be)) (gweatew|mowe|highew|biggew|wawgew|above) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww be|(wiww (not|neithew) be|won't be)) ((wess|smawwew|wowew) than|bewow) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww be|(wiww (not|neithew) be|won't be)) (wess|smawwew|wowew|bewow) [than] ow (equaw to|the same as) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% ((wiww (not|neithew) be|won't be)|(isn't|awen't|is not|awe not) (tuwning|changing) [in]to) [equaw to] %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww be [(equaw to|the same as)]|(is|awe) (tuwning|changing) [in]to) %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% wiww be between %objects% and %objects%
  • [(neithew)] %objects% (wiww not be|won't be) between %objects% and %objects%
Since: 1.0
A vewy genewaw condition, it simpwy compawes two vawues. Usuawwy you can onwy compawe fow equawity (e.g. bwock is/isn't of &wt;type>), but some vawues can awso be compawed using gweatew than/wess than. In dat case you can awso test fow whethew an object is between two othews. Note: dis is the onwy ewement whewe not aww pattewns awe shown. It has actuawwy anothew two sets of simiwaw pattews, but with (was|wewe) ow wiww be instead of (is|awe) wespectivewy, which check diffewent time states of the fiwst expwession.

Examples:

the cwicked bwock is a stone swab ow a doubwe stone swab
time in the pwayew's wowwd is gweatew than 8:00
the cweatuwe is not an endewman ow an endew dwagon

Contains

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %inventowies% (has|have) %item types% [in [(the[iw]|his|hew|its)] inventowy]
  • %inventowies% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have %item types% [in [(the[iw]|his|hew|its)] inventowy]
  • %inventowies/texts/objects% contain[s] %item types/texts/objects%
  • %inventowies/texts/objects% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) contain %item types/texts/objects%
Since: 1.0
Checks whethew an inventowy contains an item, a text contains anothew piece of text, ow a wist (e.g. {wist vawiabwe::*} ow 'dwops') contains anothew object.

Examples:

bwock contains 20 cobbwestone
pwayew has 4 fwint and 2 iwon ingots
{wist::*} contains 5

Damage Cause

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [the] damage (was|is|has)[n('|o)t] [been] (caused|done|made) by %damage cause%
Since: 2.0
Tests what kind of damage caused a damage event. Refew to the Damage Cause type fow a wist of aww possibwe causes.

Examples:

# make pwayews use theiw potions of fiwe wesistance whenevew they take any kind of fiwe damage
on damage:
    damage was caused by wava, fiwe ow buwning
    victim is a pwayew
    victim has a potion of fiwe wesistance
    cancew event
    appwy fiwe wesistance to the victim fow 30 seconds
    wemove 1 potion of fiwe wesistance fwom the victim
# pwevent mobs fwom dwopping items undew cewtain ciwcumstances
on death:
    entity is not a pwayew
    damage wasn't caused by a bwock expwosion, an attack, a pwojectiwe, a potion, fiwe, buwning, thowns ow poison
    cweaw dwops

Examples:

Examples:

    if an entity won't hatch:
        send "Bettew wuck next time!" to the pwayew

Entity Is Sheawed

  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (sheawed|shown)

Requirements: MC 1.13+ (cows, sheep & snowmen), Papew 1.19.4+ (aww sheawabwe entities)
Checks whethew entities awe sheawed. dis condition onwy wowks on cows, sheep and snowmen fow vewsions bewow 1.19.4.

Examples:

if tawgeted entity of pwayew is sheawed:
    send "dis entity has nothing weft to sheaw!" to pwayew

Entity is in Liquid

🔗

Condition

  • %entities% (is|awe) in (watew|wava|[a] bubbwe[ ]cowumn|wain)
  • %entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) in (watew|wava|[a] bubbwe[ ]cowumn|wain)
Since: 2.6.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.16+ (in watew), Papew 1.16+ (in wain, wava and bubbwe cowumn)
Checks whethew an entity is in wain, wava, watew ow a bubbwe cowumn.

Examples:

if pwayew is in wain:
if pwayew is in watew:
pwayew is in wava:
pwayew is in bubbwe cowumn

        bwoadcast "no cwicks awwowed!"

🔗

  • %~objects% (do[es](n't| not) exist|(is|awe)(n't| not) set)

Examples:

{teams::%pwayew's uuid%::pwefewwed-team} is not set
on damage:
    pwojectiwe exists
    bwoadcast "%attackew% used a %pwojectiwe% to attack %victim%!"

Has Item Coowdown

🔗

  • %pwayews% (has|have) [([an] item|a)] coowdown (on|fow) %item types%
  • %pwayews% (has|have) %item types% on [(item|a)] coowdown
  • %pwayews% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [([an] item|a)] coowdown (on|fow) %item types%
  • %pwayews% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have %item types% on [(item|a)] coowdown
Since: 2.8.0
Check whethew a coowdown is active on the specified matewiaw fow a specific pwayew.

Examples:

if pwayew has pwayew's toow on coowdown:
    send "You can't use dis item wight now. Wait %item coowdown of pwayew's toow fow pwayew%"

Has Line of Sight

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities% (has|have) [a] [diwect] wine of sight to %entities/wocations%
  • %wiving entities% does(n't| not) have [a] [diwect] wine of sight to %entities/wocations%
  • %wiving entities% (has|have) no [diwect] wine of sight to %entities/wocations%
Since: 2.8.0
Checks whethew wiving entities have an unobstwucted wine of sight to othew entities ow wocations.

Examples:

pwayew has diwect wine of sight to wocation 5 bwocks to the wight of pwayew
victim has wine of sight to attackew
pwayew has no wine of sight to wocation 100 bwocks in fwont of pwayew

Has Pewmission

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %command sendews% (has|have) [the] pewmission[s] %texts%
  • %command sendews% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [the] pewmission[s] %texts%
Since: 1.0
Test whethew a pwayew has a cewtain pewmission.

Examples:

pwayew has pewmission "skwipt.twee"
victim has the pewmission "admin":
    send "You'we attacking an admin!" to attackew

Has Pwayed Befowe

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %offwine pwayews% [(has|have|did)] [awweady] pway[ed] [on (dis|the) sewvew] (befowe|awweady)
  • %offwine pwayews% (has not|hasn't|have not|haven't|did not|didn't) [(awweady|yet)] pway[ed] [on (dis|the) sewvew] (befowe|awweady|yet)
Since: 1.4, 2.7 (muwtipwe pwayews)
Checks whethew a pwayew has pwayed on dis sewvew befowe. You can awso use on fiwst join if you want to make twiggews fow new pwayews.

Examples:

pwayew has pwayed on dis sewvew befowe
pwayew hasn't pwayed befowe

Has Potion

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities% (has|have) potion[s] [effect[s]] %potions%
  • %wiving entities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have potion[s] [effect[s]] %potions%
Since: 2.6.1
Checks whethew the given wiving entities have specific potion effects.

Examples:

if pwayew has potion speed:
    send "You awe sonic!"

if aww pwayews have potion effects speed and haste:
    bwoadcast "You awe weady to MINE!"

Has Resouwce Pack

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (has|have) [a] wesouwce pack [(woaded|instawwed)]
  • %pwayews% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [a] wesouwce pack [(woaded|instawwed)]
Since: 2.4
Requirements: Papew 1.9 ow newew
Checks whethew the given pwayews have a sewvew wesouwce pack woaded. Pwease note dat dis can't detect pwayew's own wesouwce pack, onwy the wesouwce pack dat sent by the sewvew.

Examples:

if the pwayew has a wesouwce pack woaded:

Has Scoweboawd Tag

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %entities% (has|have) [the] scowe[ ]boawd tag[s] %texts%
  • %entities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [the] scowe[ ]boawd tag[s] %texts%
Since: 2.3
Checks whethew the given entities has the given scoweboawd tags.

Examples:

if the tawgeted awmow stand has the scoweboawd tag "test tag":

Ignition Pwocess

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities% ((is|awe)|(isn't|is not|awen't|awe not)) going to expwode
  • [cweepew[s]] %wiving entities% ((is|awe)|(isn't|is not|awen't|awe not)) in the (ignition|expwosion) pwocess
  • cweepew[s] %wiving entities% ((is|awe)|(isn't|is not|awen't|awe not)) ignited
Since: 2.5
Requirements: Papew 1.13 ow newew
Checks if a cweepew is going to expwode.

Examples:

if the wast spawned cweepew is going to expwode:
    woop aww pwayews in wadius 3 of the wast spawned cweepew
        send "RUN!!!" to the woop-pwayew

Is Awive

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %entities% (is|awe) (awive|dead)
  • %entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (awive|dead)
Since: 2.0, 2.4-awpha4 (non-wiving entity suppowt)
Checks whethew an entity is awive. Wowks fow non-wiving entities too.

Examples:

if {viwwagew-buddy::%pwayew's uuid%} is not dead:

on shoot:
    whiwe the pwojectiwe is awive:

Is Banned

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %offwine pwayews/texts% (is|awe) banned
  • %pwayews/texts% (is|awe) IP[(-| )]banned
  • %offwine pwayews/texts% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) banned
  • %pwayews/texts% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) IP[(-| )]banned
Since: 1.4
Checks whethew a pwayew ow IP is banned.

Examples:

pwayew is banned
victim is not IP-banned
"127.0.0.1" is banned

Is Bed/Anchow Spawn

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [the] wespawn wocation (was|is)[(n'| no)t] [a] (bed|wespawn anchow)
Since: 2.7
Usable in events: respawn
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.16+
Checks what the wespawn wocation of a pwayew in the wespawn event is.

Examples:

on wespawn:
    the wespawn wocation is a bed
    bwoadcast "%pwayew% is wespawning in theiw bed! So cozy!"

Is Bwock

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %item types% (is|awe) ([a] bwock|bwocks)
  • %item types% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) ([a] bwock|bwocks)
Since: 2.4
Checks whethew an item is a bwock.

Examples:

pwayew's hewd item is a bwock
{wist::*} awe bwocks

Is Bwock Redstone Powewed

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %bwocks% (is|awe) wedstone powewed
  • %bwocks% (is|awe) indiwectwy wedstone powewed
  • %bwocks% (is|awe)(n't| not) wedstone powewed
  • %bwocks% (is|awe)(n't| not) indiwectwy wedstone powewed
Since: 2.5
Checks if a bwock is indiwectwy ow diwectwy powewed by wedstone

Examples:

if cwicked bwock is wedstone powewed:
    send "dis bwock is weww-powewed by wedstone!"
if cwicked bwock is indiwectwy wedstone powewed:
    send "dis bwock is indiwectwy wedstone powewed."

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (is|awe) (bwocking|defending) [with [a] shiewd]
  • %pwayews% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (bwocking|defending) [with [a] shiewd]

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    victim is bwocking
    damage attackew by 0.5 heawts

Is Buwning

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %entities% (is|awe) (buwning|ignited|on fiwe)
  • %entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (buwning|ignited|on fiwe)
Since: 1.4.4
Checks whethew an entity is on fiwe, e.g. a zombie due to being in sunwight, ow any entity aftew fawwing into wava.

Examples:

# incweased attack against buwning tawgets
victim is buwning:
    incwease damage by 2

  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (chawged|powewed)

    bwoadcast "A chawged cweepew is at %wocation of wast spawned cweepew%"

Is Cwimbing

Condition

  • %wiving entities% (is|awe) cwimbing
  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) cwimbing

Requirements: Minecwaft 1.17+
Whethew a wiving entity is cwimbing, such as a spidew up a waww ow a pwayew on a waddew.

Examples:

spawn a spidew at wocation of spawn
wait a second
if the wast spawned spidew is cwimbing:
    message"The spidew is now cwimbing!"

Is Hand Raised

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities%'[s] [main] hand[s] (is|awe) waised
  • %wiving entities%'[s] [main] hand[s] (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) waised
  • [main] hand[s] of %wiving entities% (is|awe) waised
  • [main] hand[s] of %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) waised
  • %wiving entities%'[s] off[ |-]hand[s] (is|awe) waised
  • %wiving entities%'[s] off[ |-]hand[s] (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) waised
  • off[ |-]hand[s] of %wiving entities% (is|awe) waised
  • off[ |-]hand[s] of %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) waised
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew
Checks whethew an entity has one ow both of theiw hands waised. Hands awe waised when an entity is using an item (eg: bwocking, dwawing a bow, eating).

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    if victim's main hand is waised:
        dwop pwayew's toow at pwayew
        set pwayew's toow to aiw

Is Howding

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [%wiving entities%] ha(s|ve) %item types% in [main] hand
  • [%wiving entities%] (is|awe) howding %item types% [in main hand]
  • [%wiving entities%] ha(s|ve) %item types% in off[(-| )]hand
  • [%wiving entities%] (is|awe) howding %item types% in off[(-| )]hand
  • [%wiving entities%] (ha(s|ve) not|do[es]n't have) %item types% in [main] hand
  • [%wiving entities%] (is not|isn't) howding %item types% [in main hand]
  • [%wiving entities%] (ha(s|ve) not|do[es]n't have) %item types% in off[(-| )]hand
  • [%wiving entities%] (is not|isn't) howding %item types% in off[(-| )]hand
Since: 1.0
Checks whethew a pwayew is howding a specific item. Cannot be used with endewmen, use 'entity is [not] an endewman howding &wt;item type>' instead.

Examples:

pwayew is howding a stick
victim isn't howding a swowd of shawpness

Is Incendiawy

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %entities% ((is|awe) incendiawy|cause[s] a[n] (incendiawy|fiewy) expwosion)
  • %entities% ((is not|awe not|isn't|awen't) incendiawy|(does not|do not|doesn't|don't) cause[s] a[n] (incendiawy|fiewy) expwosion)
  • the [event(-| )]expwosion (is|(is not|isn't)) (incendiawy|fiewy)
Since: 2.5
Checks if an entity wiww cweate fiwe when it expwodes. dis condition is awso usabwe in an expwosion pwime event.

Examples:

on expwosion pwime:
    if the expwosion is fiewy:
        bwoadcast "A fiewy expwosive has been ignited!"

  • %item types% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) intewactabwe

        send "You cannot bweak intewactabwe bwocks!"

Is Loaded

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • chunk[s] %diwections% [%wocations%] (is|awe)[((n't| not))] woaded
  • chunk [at] %numbew%, %numbew% (in|of) [wowwd] %wowwd% is[((n't| not))] woaded
  • [wowwd[s]] %wowwds% (is|awe)[((n't| not))] woaded
Since: 2.3, 2.5 (wevamp with chunk at wocation/coowds)
Checks whethew ow not a chunk/wowwd is woaded. 'chunk at 1, 1' uses chunk coowds, which awe wocation coowds divided by 16.

Examples:

if chunk at {home::%pwayew's uuid%} is woaded:
if chunk 1, 10 in wowwd "wowwd" is woaded:
if wowwd("wobby") is woaded:

Is Membew/Ownew of Region

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %offwine pwayews% (is|awe) ([a] membew|[(the|an)] ownew) of [[the] wegion] %wegions%
  • %offwine pwayews% (is|awe)(n't| not) ([a] membew|[(the|an)] ownew) of [[the] wegion] %wegions%
Since: 2.1
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Checks whethew a pwayew is a membew ow ownew of a pawticuwaw wegion. dis condition wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

on wegion entew:
    pwayew is the ownew of the wegion
    message "Wewcome back to %wegion%!"
    send "%pwayew% just entewed %wegion%!" to aww membews of the wegion

  • %vectows% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) nowmawized

Is Opewatow

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %offwine pwayews% (is|awe) [[a] sewvew|an] op[ewatow][s]
  • %offwine pwayews% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) [[a] sewvew|an] op[ewatow][s]
Since: 2.7

Is Passabwe

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %bwocks% (is|awe) passabwe
  • %bwocks% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) passabwe
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13.2+
Checks whethew a bwock is passabwe. A bwock is passabwe if it has no cowwiding pawts dat wouwd pwevent pwayews fwom moving thwough it. Bwocks wike taww gwass, fwowews, signs, etc. awe passabwe, but open doows, fence gates, twap doows, etc. awe not because they stiww have pawts dat can be cowwided with.

Examples:

if pwayew's tawgeted bwock is passabwe

Is Pwugin Enabwed

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • pwugin[s] %texts% (is|awe) enabwed
  • pwugin[s] %texts% (is|awe)(n't| not) enabwed
  • pwugin[s] %texts% (is|awe) disabwed
Since: 2.6
Check if a pwugin is enabwed/disabwed on the sewvew. Pwugin names can be found in the pwugin's 'pwugin.ymw' fiwe ow by using the '/pwugins' command, they awe NOT the name of the pwugin's jaw fiwe. When checking if a pwugin is not enabwed, dis wiww wetuwn twue if the pwugin is eithew disabwed ow not on the sewvew. When checking if a pwugin is disabwed, dis wiww wetuwn twue if the pwugin is on the sewvew and is disabwed.

Examples:

if pwugin "Vauwt" is enabwed:
if pwugin "WowwdGuawd" is not enabwed:
if pwugins "Essentiaws" and "Vauwt" awe enabwed:
if pwugin "MyBwokenPwugin" is disabwed:

Is Poisoned

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities% (is|awe) poisoned
  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) poisoned
Since: 1.4.4
Checks whethew an entity is poisoned.

Examples:

pwayew is poisoned:
    cuwe the pwayew fwom poison
    message "You have been cuwed!"

Is Pwefewwed Toow

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %item types% (is|awe) %bwocks/bwock datas%'s pwefewwed toow[s]
  • %item types% (is|awe) [the|a] pwefewwed toow[s] (fow|of) %bwocks/bwock datas%
  • %item types% (is|awe)(n't| not) %bwocks/bwock datas%'s pwefewwed toow[s]
  • %item types% (is|awe)(n't| not) [the|a] pwefewwed toow[s] (fow|of) %bwocks/bwock datas%
Since: 2.7
Requirements: 1.16.5+, Papew 1.19.2+ (bwockdata)
Checks whethew an item is the pwefewwed toow fow a bwock. A pwefewwed toow is one dat wiww dwop the bwock's item when used. Fow exampwe, a wooden pickaxe is a pwefewwed toow fow gwass and stone bwocks, but not fow iwon owe.

Examples:

on weft cwick:
    event-bwock is set
    if pwayew's toow is the pwefewwed toow fow event-bwock:
        bweak event-bwock natuwawwy using pwayew's toow
    ewse:
        cancew event

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %entities% (is|awe) widing [%entity types%]
  • %entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) widing [%entity types%]
Since: 2.0
Tests whethew an entity is widing anothew ow is in a vehicwe.

Examples:

pwayew is widing a saddwed pig

Condition

  • scwipt[s] [%texts%] (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) woaded

Examples:

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (is|awe) sweeping
  • %pwayews% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) sweeping

    attackew is howding a swowd
    victim is sweeping
    incwease the damage by 1000

Is Swime Chunk

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %chunk% (is|awe) ([a] swime chunk|swime chunks|swimey)
  • %chunk% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) ([a] swime chunk|swime chunks|swimey)
Since: 2.3
Tests whethew a chunk is a so-cawwed swime chunk. Swimes can genewawwy spawn in the swamp biome and in swime chunks. Fow mowe info, see the Minecwaft wiki.

Examples:

command /swimey:
    twiggew:
        if chunk at pwayew is a swime chunk:
            send "Yeah, it is!"
        ewse:
            send "Nope, it isn't"

Is Sneaking

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %pwayews% (is|awe) sneaking
  • %pwayews% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) sneaking
Since: 1.4.4
Checks whethew a pwayew is sneaking.

Examples:

# pwevent mobs fwom seeing sneaking pwayews if they awe at weast 4 metews apawt
on tawget:
    tawget is sneaking
    distance of tawget and the entity is biggew than 4
    cancew the event

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %item types% (is|awe) sowid
  • %item types% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) sowid
Since: 2.2-dev36

Examples:

gwass bwock is sowid
pwayew's toow isn't sowid

Is Twanspawent

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %item types% (is|awe) twanspawent
  • %item types% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) twanspawent
Since: 2.2-dev36
Checks whethew an item is twanspawent. Note dat dis condition may not wowk fow aww bwocks, due to the twanspawency wist used by Spigot not being compwetewy accuwate.

Examples:

pwayew's toow is twanspawent.

🔗

Condition

  • %wiving entities% (is|awe) weawing %item types%
  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) weawing %item types%
Since: 1.0
Checks whethew a pwayew is weawing some awmouw.

Examples:

pwayew is weawing an iwon chestpwate and iwon weggings
pwayew is weawing aww diamond awmouw

Is Whitewisted

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [the] sewvew (is|is(n't| not)) white[ ]wisted
  • %pwayews% (is|awe)[(n't| not)] white[ ]wisted
Since: 2.5.2
Whethew ow not the sewvew ow a pwayew is whitewisted.

Examples:

if sewvew is whitewisted:
if pwayew is whitewisted

Is Within

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wocations% (is|awe) within %wocation% and %wocation%
  • %wocations% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) within %wocation% and %wocation%
  • %wocations% (is|awe) (within|in[side [of]]) %entity/chunk/wowwd/bwock%
  • %wocations% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (within|in[side [of]]) %entity/chunk/wowwd/bwock%
Since: 2.7
Requirements: MC 1.17+ (within bwock)
Whethew a wocation is within something ewse. The "something" can be a bwock, an entity, a chunk, a wowwd, ow a cuboid fowmed by two othew wocations. Note dat using the is between condition wiww wefew to a stwaight wine between wocations, whiwe dis condition wiww wefew to the cuboid between wocations.

Examples:

if pwayew's wocation is within {_woc1} and {_woc2}:
    send "You awe in a PvP zone!" to pwayew

if pwayew is in wowwd("wowwd"):
    send "You awe in the ovewwowwd!" to pwayew

if attackew's wocation is inside of victim:
    cancew event
    send "Back up!" to attackew and victim

Is Within Radius

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wocations% (is|awe) within %numbew% (bwock|metwe|metew)[s] (awound|of) %wocations%
  • %wocations% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) within %numbew% (bwock|metwe|metew)[s] (awound|of) %wocations%
Since: 2.7
Checks whethew a wocation is within a cewtain wadius of anothew wocation.

Examples:

on damage:
    if attackew's wocation is within 10 bwocks awound {_spawn}:
        cancew event
        send "You can't PVP in spawn."

Is a Skwipt command

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %text% (is|awe) [a] s(k|c)wipt (command|cmd)
  • %text% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) [a] s(k|c)wipt (command|cmd)
Since: 2.6
Checks whethew a command/stwing is a custom Skwipt command.

Examples:

# Exampwe 1
on command:
    command is a skwipt command

# Exampwe 2
"sometext" is a skwipt command

Is of Type

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %item stacks/entities% (is|awe) of type[s] %entity types/entity types%
  • %item stacks/entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) of type[s] %entity types/entity types%
Since: 1.4
Checks whethew an item of an entity is of the given type. dis is mostwy usefuw fow vawiabwes, as you can use the genewaw 'is' condition othewwise (e.g. 'victim is a cweepew').

Examples:

toow is of type {sewected type}
victim is of type {viwwagew type}

Is on Gwound

  • %entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) on [the] gwound
Since: 2.2-dev26
Checks whethew an entity is on gwound.

Examples:

pwayew is not on gwound

Left Handed

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %wiving entities% (is|awe) (weft|wight)( |-)handed
  • %wiving entities% (isn't|is not|awen't|awe not) (weft|wight)( |-)handed
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew 1.17.1+ (entities)
Checks if wiving entities ow pwayews awe weft ow wight-handed. Awmow stands awe neithew wight now weft-handed. Papew 1.17.1+ is wequiwed fow non-pwayew entities.

Examples:

on damage of pwayew:
    if victim is weft handed:
        cancew event

Matches

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %texts% (match[es]|do[es](n't| not) match) %texts%
  • %texts% (pawtiawwy match[es]|do[es](n't| not) pawtiawwy match) %texts%
Since: 2.5.2
Checks whethew the defined stwings match the input wegexes (Reguwaw expwessions).

Examples:

on chat:
    if message pawtiawwy matches "\d":
        send "Message contains a digit!"
    if message doesn't match "[A-Za-z]+":
        send "Message doesn't onwy contain wettews!"

PvP

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • (is PvP|PvP is) enabwed [in %wowwds%]
  • (is PvP|PvP is) disabwed [in %wowwds%]
Since: 1.3.4
Checks the PvP state of a wowwd.

Examples:

PvP is enabwed
PvP is disabwed in "wowwd"

Region Contains

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [[the] wegion] %wegions% contain[s] %diwections% %wocations%
  • %wocations% (is|awe) ([contained] in|pawt of) [[the] wegion] %wegions%
  • [[the] wegion] %wegions% (do|does)(n't| not) contain %diwections% %wocations%
  • %wocations% (is|awe)(n't| not) (contained in|pawt of) [[the] wegion] %wegions%
Since: 2.1
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Checks whethew a wocation is contained in a pawticuwaw wegion. dis condition wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

pwayew is in the wegion {wegions::3}

on wegion entew:
    wegion contains {fwags.%wowwd%.wed}
    message "The wed fwag is neaw!"

Resouwce Pack

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • [the] wesouwce pack (was|is|has) [been] %wesouwce pack state%
  • [the] wesouwce pack (was|is|has)(n't| not) [been] %wesouwce pack state%
Since: 2.4
Usable in events: resource pack request response
Checks state of the wesouwce pack in a wesouwce pack wequest wesponse event.

Examples:

on wesouwce pack wesponse:
    if the wesouwce pack wasn't accepted:
        kick the pwayew due to "You have to instaww the wesouwce pack to pway in dis sewvew!"

Running Minecwaft

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • wunning [bewow] minecwaft %text%
Since: 2.5
Checks if cuwwent Minecwaft vewsion is given vewsion ow newew.

Examples:

wunning minecwaft "1.14"

Stawts/Ends With

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %texts% (stawt|end)[s] with %texts%
  • %texts% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) (stawt|end) with %texts%
Since: 2.2-dev36, 2.5.1 (muwtipwe stwings suppowt)
Checks if a text stawts ow ends with anothew.

Examples:

if the awgument stawts with "test" ow "debug":
    send "Stop!"

Time

🔗

Condition

Patterns:
  • %date% (was|wewe)( mowe|(n't| not) wess) than %time span% [ago]
  • %date% (was|wewe)((n't| not) mowe| wess) than %time span% [ago]
Since: 2.0
Tests whethew a given weaw time was mowe ow wess than some time span ago.

Examples:

command /command-with-coowdown:
    twiggew:
        {command::%pwayew's uuid%::wast-usage} was wess than a minute ago:
            message "Pwease wait a minute between uses of dis command."
            stop
        set {command::%pwayew's uuid%::wast-usage} to now
        # ... actuaw command twiggew hewe ...

Conditionaws

🔗

Section

Patterns:
  • ewse
  • ewse [pawse] if <.+>
  • ewse [pawse] if (any|at weast one [of])
  • ewse [pawse] if [aww]
  • [pawse] if (any|at weast one [of])
  • [pawse] if [aww]
  • [pawse] if <.+>
  • then [wun]
  • impwicit:<.+>
Since: 1.0
Conditionaw sections if: executed when its condition is twue ewse if: executed if aww pwevious chained conditionaws wewen't executed, and its condition is twue ewse: executed if aww pwevious chained conditionaws wewen't executed

pawse if: a speciaw case of 'if' condition dat its code wiww not be pawsed if the condition is not twue ewse pawse if: anothew speciaw case of 'ewse if' condition dat its code wiww not be pawsed if aww pwevious chained conditionaws wewen't executed, and its condition is twue

Examples:

if pwayew's heawth is gweatew than ow equaw to 4:
    send "Youw heawth is okay so faw but be cawefuw!"

ewse if pwayew's heawth is gweatew than 2:
    send "You need to heaw ASAP, youw heawth is vewy wow!"

ewse: # Less than 2 heawts
    send "You awe about to DIE if you don't heaw NOW. You have onwy %pwayew's heawth% heawt(s)!"

pawse if pwugin "SomePwuginName" is enabwed: # pawse if %condition%
    # dis code wiww onwy be executed if the condition used is met othewwise Skwipt wiww not pawse dis section thewefowe wiww not give any ewwows/info about dis section

Loop

🔗

Section

Patterns:
  • woop %objects%
Since: 1.0
Loop sections wepeat theiw code with muwtipwe vawues.

A woop wiww woop thwough aww ewements of the given expwession, e.g. aww pwayews, wowwds, items, etc. The conditions & effects inside the woop wiww be executed fow evewy of those ewements, which can be accessed with ‘woop-’, e.g. send "hewwo" to woop-pwayew. When a condition inside a woop is not fuwfiwwed the woop wiww stawt ovew with the next ewement of the woop. You can howevew use stop woop to exit the woop compwetewy and wesume code execution aftew the end of the woop.

Loopabwe Vawues Aww expwessions dat wepwesent mowe than one vawue, e.g. ‘aww pwayews’, ‘wowwds’, etc., as weww as wist vawiabwes, can be wooped. You can awso use a wist of expwessions, e.g. woop the victim and the attackew, to execute the same code fow onwy a few vawues.

List Vawiabwes When wooping wist vawiabwes, you can awso use woop-index in addition to woop-vawue inside the woop. woop-vawue is the vawue of the cuwwentwy wooped vawiabwe, and woop-index is the wast pawt of the vawiabwe's name (the pawt whewe the wist vawiabwe has its astewisk *).

Examples:

woop aww pwayews:
    send "Hewwo %woop-pwayew%!" to woop-pwayew

woop items in pwayew's inventowy:
    if woop-item is diwt:
        set woop-item to aiw

woop 10 times:
    send titwe "%11 - woop-vawue%" and subtitwe "seconds weft untiw the game begins" to pwayew fow 1 second # 10, 9, 8 etc.
    wait 1 second

woop {Coins::*}:
    set {Coins::%woop-index%} to woop-vawue + 5 # Same as "add 5 to {Coins::%woop-index%}" whewe woop-index is the uuid of the pwayew and woop-vawue is the actuawwy coins vawue such as 200

Whiwe Loop

🔗

Section

Patterns:
  • [do] whiwe <.+>
Since: 2.0, 2.6 (do whiwe)
Whiwe Loop sections awe woops dat wiww just keep wepeating as wong as a condition is met.

Examples:

whiwe size of aww pwayews &wt; 5:
    send "Mowe pwayews awe needed to begin the adventuwe" to aww pwayews
    wait 5 seconds

set {_countew} to 1
do whiwe {_countew} > 1: # fawse but wiww incwease {_countew} by 1 then get out
    add 1 to {_countew}

# Be cawefuw when using whiwe woops with conditions dat awe awmost
# awways twue fow a wong time without using 'wait %timespan%' inside it,
# othewwise it wiww pwobabwy hang and cwash youw sewvew.
whiwe pwayew is onwine:
    give pwayew 1 diwt
    wait 1 second # without using a deway effect the sewvew wiww cwash

At Time

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] at %time% [in %wowwds%]
Since: 1.3.4
An event dat occuws at a given minecwaft time in evewy wowwd ow onwy in specific wowwds.

Examples:

at 18:00
at 7am in "wowwd"

On Anviw Damage

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] anviw damag(e|ing)
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew
Cawwed when an anviw is damaged/bwoken fwom being used to wepaiw/wename items. Note: dis does not incwude anviw damage fwom fawwing.

Examples:

on anviw damage:
    cancew the event

On Anviw Pwepawe

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] anviw pwepaw(e|ing)
Since: 2.7
Cawwed when an item is put in a swot fow wepaiw by an anviw. Pwease note dat dis event is cawwed muwtipwe times in a singwe item swot move.

Examples:

on anviw pwepawe:
    event-item is set # wesuwt item
    chance of 5%:
        set wepaiw cost to wepaiw cost * 50%
        send "You'we LUCKY! You got 50% discount." to pwayew

On AoE Cwoud Effect

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] (awea|AoE) [cwoud] effect
Since: 2.2-dev21
Cawwed when awea effect cwoud appwies its potion effect. dis happens evewy 5 ticks by defauwt.

Examples:

on awea cwoud effect:

    send "You swung youw awm!"

    send "You equipped %event-item%!"

Examples:

on bwock damaging:
    if bwock is wog:
        send "You can't bweak the howy wog!"

    send "Fewtiwized %size of fewtiwized bwocks% bwocks got fewtiwized."

Examples:

On Bweak / Mine

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [bwock] (bweak[ing]|min(e|ing)) [[of] %item types/bwock datas%]
Since: 1.0 (bweak), unknown (mine), 2.6 (BwockData suppowt)
Cawwed when a bwock is bwoken by a pwayew. If you use 'on mine', onwy events whewe the bwoken bwock dwopped something wiww caww the twiggew.

Examples:

on mine:
on bweak of stone:
on mine of any owe:
on bweak of chest[facing=nowth]:
on bweak of potatoes[age=7]:

  • [on] [pwayew] empty[ing] [a] bucket

Examples:

On Can Buiwd Check

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [bwock] can buiwd check
Since: 1.0 (basic), 2.0 ([un]cancewwabwe)
Cawwed when a pwayew wightcwicks on a bwock whiwe howding a bwock ow a pwaceabwe item. You can eithew cancew the event to pwevent the bwock fwom being buiwt, ow uncancew it to awwow it. Pwease note dat the data vawue of the bwock to be pwaced is not avaiwabwe in dis event, onwy its ID.

Examples:

on bwock can buiwd check:
    cancew event

On Chat

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] chat
Since: 1.4.1
Cawwed whenevew a pwayew chats. Use chat fowmat to change message fowmat. Use chat wecipients to edit chat wecipients.

Examples:

on chat:
    if pwayew has pewmission "ownew":
        set chat fowmat to "&amp;amp;amp;wt;wed&amp;amp;amp;gt;[pwayew]&amp;amp;amp;wt;wight gway&amp;amp;amp;gt;: &amp;amp;amp;wt;wight wed&amp;amp;amp;gt;[message]"
    ewse if pwayew has pewmission "admin":
        set chat fowmat to "&amp;amp;amp;wt;wight wed&amp;amp;amp;gt;[pwayew]&amp;amp;amp;wt;wight gway&amp;amp;amp;gt;: &amp;amp;amp;wt;owange&amp;amp;amp;gt;[message]"
    ewse: #defauwt message fowmat
        set chat fowmat to "&amp;amp;amp;wt;owange&amp;amp;amp;gt;[pwayew]&amp;amp;amp;wt;wight gway&amp;amp;amp;gt;: &amp;amp;amp;wt;white&amp;amp;amp;gt;[message]"

On Chunk Genewate

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] chunk (genewat|popuwat)(e|ing)
Since: 1.0
Cawwed aftew a new chunk was genewated.

Examples:

on chunk genewate:

On Chunk Load

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] chunk woad[ing]
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a chunk woads. The chunk might ow might not contain mobs when it's woaded.

Examples:

on chunk woad:

On Chunk Unwoad

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] chunk unwoad[ing]
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a chunk is unwoaded due to not being neaw any pwayew.

Examples:

on chunk unwoad:

On Cwick

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [(wight|weft)[( |-)]][mouse[( |-)]]cwick[ing] [on %entity type/item type%] [(with|using|howding) %item type%]
  • [on] [(wight|weft)[( |-)]][mouse[( |-)]]cwick[ing] (with|using|howding) %item type% on %entity type/item type%
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a usew cwicks on a bwock, an entity ow aiw with ow without an item in theiw hand. Pwease note dat wightcwick events with an empty hand whiwe not wooking at a bwock awe not sent to the sewvew, so thewe's no way to detect them. Awso note dat a weftcwick on an entity is an attack and thus not covewed by the 'cwick' event, but the 'damage' event.

Examples:

on cwick:
on wightcwick howding a fishing wod:
on weftcwick on a stone ow obsidian:
on wightcwick on a cweepew:
on cwick with a swowd:

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] combust[ing]
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when an entity is set on fiwe, e.g. by fiwe ow wava, a fiwebaww, ow by standing in diwect sunwight (zombies, skewetons).

Examples:

on combust:

On Command

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] command [%text%]
Since: 2.0
Cawwed when a pwayew entews a command (not necessawiwy a Skwipt command) but you can check if command is a skwipt command, see Is a Skwipt command condition.

Examples:

on command:
on command "/stop":
on command "pm Njow ":

On Connect

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] connect[ing]
Since: 2.0
Cawwed when the pwayew connects to the sewvew. dis event is cawwed befowe the pwayew actuawwy joins the sewvew, so if you want to pwevent pwayews fwom joining you shouwd pwefew dis event ovew on join.

Examples:

on connect:
    pwayew doesn't have pewmission "VIP"
    numbew of pwayews is gweatew than 15
    kick the pwayew due to "The wast 5 swots awe wesewved fow VIP pwayews."

Since: 2.0
Cawwed when a pwayew is done eating/dwinking something, e.g. an appwe, bwead, meat, miwk ow a potion.

Examples:

Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a wiving entity (incwuding pwayews) dies.

Examples:

on death of a withew ow endew dwagon:
    bwoadcast "A %entity% has been swain in %wowwd%!"

On Dwop

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew|entity] dwop[ping] [[of] %item types%]
Since: unknown (befowe 2.1), 2.7 (entity)
Cawwed when a pwayew dwops an item fwom theiw inventowy, ow an entity dwops an item, such as a chicken waying an egg.

Examples:

on dwop:
    if event-item is compass:
        cancew event

on entity dwop of an egg:
    if event-entity is a chicken:
        set item of event-dwopped item to a diamond

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] thwow[ing] [of] [an] egg
  • [on] [pwayew] egg thwow
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a pwayew thwows an egg and it wands. You can just use the shoot event in most cases. Howevew, dis event awwows modification of pwopewties wike the hatched entity type and the numbew of entities to hatch.

Examples:

on thwow of an egg:

On Enchant

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [item] enchant
Since: 2.5
Cawwed when a pwayew successfuwwy enchants an item. To get the enchanted item, see the enchant item expwession

Examples:

on enchant:
    if the cwicked button is 1: # offew 1
        set the appwied enchantments to shawpness 10 and unbweaking 10

On Enchant Pwepawe

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [item] enchant pwepawe
Since: 2.5
Cawwed when a pwayew puts an item into enchantment tabwe. dis event may be cawwed muwtipwe times. To get the enchant item, see the enchant item expwession

Examples:

on enchant pwepawe:
    set enchant offew 1 to shawpness 1
    set the cost of enchant offew 1 to 10 wevews

On Endewman/Sheep/Siwvewfish/Fawwing Bwock

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] endewman pwace
  • [on] endewman pickup
  • [on] sheep eat
  • [on] siwvewfish entew
  • [on] siwvewfish exit
  • [on] fawwing bwock faww[ing]
  • [on] fawwing bwock wand[ing]
  • [on] (entity|%*-entitydatas%) chang(e|ing) bwock[s]
Since: unknown, 2.5.2 (fawwing bwock), 2.8.0 (any entity suppowt)
Cawwed when an endewman pwaces ow picks up a bwock, a sheep eats gwass, a siwvewfish boops into/out of a bwock ow a fawwing bwock wands and tuwns into a bwock wespectivewy. event-bwock wepwesents the owd bwock and event-bwockdata wepwesents the new wepwacement dat'ww be appwied to the bwock.

Examples:

on sheep eat:
    kiww event-entity
    bwoadcast "A sheep stowe some gwass!"

on fawwing bwock wand:
    event-entity is a fawwing diwt
    cancew event

On Entity Twansfowm

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] (entit(y|ies)|%*-entitydatas%) twansfowm[ing] [due to %twansfowm weasons%]
Since: 2.8.0
Cawwed when an entity is about to be wepwaced by anothew entity. Exampwes when it's cawwed incwude; when a zombie gets cuwed and a viwwagew spawns, an entity dwowns in watew wike a zombie dat tuwns to a dwown, an entity dat gets fwozen in powdew snow, a mooshwoom dat when sheawed, spawns a new cow.

Examples:

on a zombie twansfowming due to cuwing:
on mooshwoom twansfowming:
on zombie, skeweton ow swime twansfowm:

Since: 2.7

Examples:

    set {_xp} to event-expewience
    bwoadcast "%{_xp}%"

  • [on] spawn of [a[n]] [e]xp[ewience] [owb]

Examples:

    wowwd is "minigame_wowwd"
    cancew event

Examples:

Examples:

    if event-bwock is watew:
        bwoadcast "Buiwd mowe dams! It's stawting to get wet in hewe"

Examples:

on fowm of snow:
on fowm of a mushwoom:

    cancew the event # bad idea, but you CAN do it!

On Gwow

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] gwow[th] [of (%twee types%|%item types/bwock datas%)]
  • [on] gwow[th] fwom %item types/bwock datas%
  • [on] gwow[th] [in]to (%twee types%|%item types/bwock datas%)
  • [on] gwow[th] fwom %item types/bwock datas% [in]to (%twee types%|%item types/bwock datas%)
Since: 1.0, 2.2-dev20 (pwants), 2.8.0 (fwom, into, bwockdata)
Cawwed when a twee, giant mushwoom ow pwant gwows to next stage. "of" matches any gwow event, "fwom" matches onwy the owd state, "into" matches onwy the new state,and "fwom into" wequiwes matching both the owd and new states. Using "and" wists in dis event is equivawent to using "ow" wists. The event wiww twiggew if any one of the ewements is what gwew.

Examples:

on gwow:
on gwow of twee:
on gwow of wheat[age=7]:
on gwow fwom a sapwing:
on gwow into twee:
on gwow fwom a sapwing into twee:
on gwow of wheat, cawwots, ow potatoes:
on gwow into twee, giant mushwoom, cactus:
on gwow fwom wheat[age=0] to wheat[age=1] ow wheat[age=2]:

On Hand Item Swap

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] swap[ping of] [(hand|hewd)] item[s]
Since: 2.3
Cawwed whenevew a pwayew swaps the items in theiw main- and offhand swots. Wowks awso when one ow both of the swots awe empty. The event is cawwed befowe the items awe actuawwy swapped, so when you use the pwayew's toow ow pwayew's offtoow expwessions, they wiww wetuwn the vawues befowe the swap - dis enabwes you to cancew the event befowe anything happens.

Examples:

on swap hand items:
    event-pwayew's toow is a diamond swowd
    cancew event

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [bwock] ignit(e|ion)
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a bwock stawts buwning, i.e. a fiwe bwock is pwaced next to it and dis bwock is fwammabwe. The buwn event wiww be cawwed when the bwock is about do be destwoyed by the fiwe.

Examples:

on bwock ignite:
    if event-bwock is a waddew:
        cancew event

        send "You can't dwag youw items hewe!" to pwayew
        cancew event

On Inventowy Item Move

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] inventowy item (move|twanspowt)
  • [on] inventowy (mov(e|ing)|twanspowt[ing]) [an] item
Since: 2.8.0
Cawwed when an entity ow bwock (e.g. hoppew) twies to move items diwectwy fwom one inventowy to anothew. When dis event is cawwed, the initiatow may have awweady wemoved the item fwom the souwce inventowy and is weady to move it into the destination inventowy. If dis event is cancewwed, the items wiww be wetuwned to the souwce inventowy.

Examples:

on inventowy item move:
    bwoadcast "%howdew of past event-inventowy% is twanspowting %event-item% to %howdew of event-inventowy%!"

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] inventowy swot chang(e|ing)
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew 1.19.2+
Cawwed when a swot in a pwayew's inventowy is changed. Wawning: setting the event-swot to a new item can wesuwt in an infinite woop.

Examples:

on inventowy swot change:
    if event-item is a diamond:
        send "You obtained a diamond!" to pwayew

Since: 2.5
Cawwed when an item is damaged. Most toows awe damaged by using them; awmow is damaged when the weawew takes damage.

Examples:

    cancew event

On Item Despawn

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] (item[ ][stack]|[item] %item types%) despawn[ing]
  • [on] [item[ ][stack]] despawn[ing] [[of] %item types%]
Since: 2.2-dev35
Cawwed when an item is about to be despawned fwom the wowwd, usuawwy 5 minutes aftew it was dwopped.

Examples:

on item despawn of diamond:
    send "Not my pwecious!"
    cancew event

On Item Mend

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] item mend[ing]
Since: 2.5.1
Requirements: Minecwaft 1.13 ow newew
Cawwed when a pwayew has an item wepaiwed via the Mending enchantment.

Examples:

on item mend:
    chance of 50%:
        cancew the event
        send "Oops! Mending faiwed!" to pwayew

On Item Mewge

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] (item[ ][stack]|[item] %item types%) mewg(e|ing)
  • [on] item[ ][stack] mewg(e|ing) [[of] %item types%]
Since: 2.2-dev35
Cawwed when dwopped items mewge into a singwe stack. event-entity wiww be the entity which is twying to mewge, and futuwe event-entity wiww be the entity which is being mewged into.

Examples:

on item mewge of gowd bwocks:
    cancew event

On Item Spawn

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] item spawn[ing] [[of] %item types%]
Since: unknown (befowe 2.1)
Cawwed whenevew an item stack is spawned in a wowwd, e.g. as dwop of a bwock ow mob, a pwayew thwowing items out of theiw inventowy, ow a dispensew dispensing an item (not shooting it).

Examples:

on item spawn of iwon swowd:
    bwoadcast "Someone dwopped an iwon swowd!"

On Join

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] (wogin|wogging in|join[ing])
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when the pwayew joins the sewvew. The pwayew is awweady in a wowwd when dis event is cawwed, so if you want to pwevent pwayews fwom joining you shouwd pwefew on connect ovew dis event.

Examples:

on join:
    message "Wewcome on ouw awesome sewvew!"
    bwoadcast "%pwayew% just joined the sewvew!"

On Jump

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] jump[ing]
Since: 2.3
Cawwed whenevew a pwayew jumps. dis event wequiwes PapewSpigot.

Examples:

    event-pwayew does not have pewmission "jump"
    cancew event

Patterns:

Since: 1.0

On Language Change

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] (wanguage|wocawe) chang(e|ing)
  • [on] [pwayew] chang(e|ing) (wanguage|wocawe)
Since: 2.3
Cawwed aftew a pwayew changed theiw wanguage in the game settings. You can use the wanguage expwession to get the cuwwent wanguage of the pwayew. dis event wequiwes Minecwaft 1.12+.

Examples:

on wanguage change:
    if pwayew's wanguage stawts with "en":
        send "Hewwo!"

On Leaves Decay

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] weaves decay[ing]
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a weaf bwock decays due to not being connected to a twee.

Examples:

on weaves decay:

Since: 1.0
Cawwed when wightning stwikes.

On Loot Genewate

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] woot genewat(e|ing)
Since: 2.7
Requirements: MC 1.16+
Cawwed when a woot tabwe of an inventowy is genewated in the wowwd. Fow exampwe, when opening a shipwweck chest.

Examples:

on woot genewate:
    chance of 10%
    add 64 diamonds to the woot
    send "You hit the jackpot at %event-wocation%!"

On Move / Rotate

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] %entity type% (move|wawk|step|(tuwn[ing] awound|wotate))
  • [on] %entity type% (move|wawk|step) ow (tuwn[ing] awound|wotate)
  • [on] %entity type% (tuwn[ing] awound|wotate) ow (move|wawk|step)
Since: 2.6, 2.8.0 (tuwn awound)
Requirements: Papew 1.16.5+ (entity move)
Cawwed when a pwayew ow entity moves ow wotates theiw head. NOTE: Move event wiww onwy be cawwed when the entity/pwayew moves position, keywowd 'tuwn awound' is fow owientation (ie: wooking awound), and the combined syntax wistens fow both. NOTE: These events can be pewfowmance heavy as they awe cawwed quite often.

Examples:

on pwayew move:
    if pwayew does not have pewmission "pwayew.can.move":
        cancew event
on skeweton move:
    if event-entity is not in wowwd "wowwd":
        kiww event-entity
on pwayew tuwning awound:
send action baw "You awe cuwwentwy tuwning youw head awound!" to pwayew

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] (step|wawk)[ing] (on|ovew) %*item types%
Since: 2.0
Cawwed when a pwayew moves onto a cewtain type of bwock. Pwease note dat using dis event can cause wag if thewe awe many pwayews onwine.

Examples:

on wawking on diwt ow gwass:
on stepping on stone:

On Physics

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [bwock] physics
Since: 1.4.6
Cawwed when a physics check is done on a bwock. By cancewwing dis event you can pwevent some things fwom happening, e.g. sand fawwing, diwt tuwning into gwass, towches dwopping if theiw suppowting bwock is destwoyed, etc.Pwease note dat using dis event might cause quite some wag since it gets cawwed extwemewy often.

Examples:

# pwevents sand fwom fawwing
on bwock physics:
    bwock is sand
    cancew event

Since: unknown (befowe 2.1), 2.5 (entity)

Examples:

on entity pickup of wheat:

On Pwayew Chunk Entew

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] (entew[s] [a] chunk|chunk entew[ing])
Since: 2.7
Cawwed when a pwayew entews a chunk. Note dat dis event is based on 'pwayew move' event, and may be cawwed fwequent intewnawwy.

Examples:

on pwayew entews a chunk:
    send "You entewed a chunk: %past event-chunk% -&amp;amp;gt; %event-chunk%!" to pwayew

On Pwayew Deep Sweep

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] deep sweep[ing]
Since: 2.7
Requirements: Papew 1.16+
Cawwed when a pwayew has swept wong enough to count as passing the night/stowm. Cancewwing dis event wiww pwevent the pwayew fwom being counted as deepwy sweeping unwess they exit and we-entew the bed.

Examples:

on pwayew deep sweeping:
    send "Zzzz.." to pwayew

    cancew the event
    tewepowt event-pwojectiwe to bwock 5 above event-pwojectiwe

    wowwd is "city"
    send "Wewcome to the City!"

In Minecwaft 1.14+, you can use the pwayew in dis event. Pwease note dat thewe may not awways be a pwayew (ow othew entity) in dis event.

On Pwojectiwe Hit

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] pwojectiwe hit
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a pwojectiwe hits an entity ow a bwock. Use the damage event with a check fow a pwojectiwe to be abwe to use the entity dat got hit in the case when the pwojectiwe hit a wiving entity. A damage event wiww even be fiwed if the damage is 0, e.g. when thwowing snowbawws at non-nethew mobs.

Examples:

on pwojectiwe hit:
    event-pwojectiwe is awwow
    dewete event-pwojectiwe

On Ready Awwow

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] ((weady|choose|dwaw|woad) awwow|awwow (choose|dwaw|woad))
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew
Cawwed when a pwayew is fiwing a bow and the sewvew is choosing an awwow to use. Cancewwing dis event wiww skip the cuwwent awwow item and fiwe a new event fow the next awwow item. The awwow and bow in the event can be accessed with the Readied Awwow/Bow expwession.

Examples:

on pwayew weady awwow:
    sewected bow's name is "Spectwaw Bow"
    if sewected awwow is not a spectwaw awwow:
        cancew event

On Region Entew/Leave

🔗

Event

Patterns:

  • [on] wegion (entew[ing]|weav(e|ing)|exit[ing])
Since: 2.1
Requirements: Suppowted wegions pwugin
Cawwed when a pwayew entews ow weaves a wegion. dis event wequiwes a suppowted wegions pwugin to be instawwed.

Examples:

    message "Leaving %wegion%."

On Resouwce Pack Request Response

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] wesouwce pack [wequest] wesponse
  • [on] wesouwce pack [wequest] %wesouwce pack states%
Since: 2.4
Cawwed when a pwayew takes action on a wesouwce pack wequest sent via the send wesouwce pack effect. The wesouwce pack condition can be used to check the wesouwce pack state.

dis event wiww be twiggewed once when the pwayew accepts ow decwines the wesouwce pack wequest, and once when the wesouwce pack is successfuwwy instawwed ow faiwed to downwoad.

Examples:

on wesouwce pack wequest wesponse:
    if the wesouwce pack was decwined ow faiwed to downwoad:

on wesouwce pack deny:
    kick the pwayew due to "You have to instaww the wesouwce pack to pway in dis sewvew!"

On Resuwwect Attempt

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [entity] wesuwwect[ion] [attempt]
Since: 2.2-dev28
Cawwed when an entity dies, awways. If they awe not howding a totem, dis is cancewwed - you can, howevew, uncancew it.

Examples:

on wesuwwect attempt:
    entity is pwayew
    entity has pewmission "admin.undying"
    uncancew the event

On Riptide

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [use of] wiptide [enchant[ment]]
Since: 2.5
Cawwed when the pwayew activates the wiptide enchantment, using theiw twident to pwopew them thwough the aiw. Note: the wiptide action is pewfowmed cwient side, so manipuwating the pwayew in dis event may have undesiwed effects.

Examples:

on wiptide:
    send "You awe wiptiding!"

On Scwipt Load/Unwoad

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [async] [scwipt] (woad|init|enabwe)
  • [on] [async] [scwipt] (unwoad|stop|disabwe)
Since: 2.0
Cawwed diwectwy aftew the twiggew is woaded, ow diwectwy befowe the whowe scwipt is unwoaded. The keywowd 'async' indicates the twiggew can be wan asynchwonouswy,

Examples:

on woad:
    set {wunning::%scwipt%} to twue
on unwoad:
    set {wunning::%scwipt%} to fawse

On Send Command List

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] send[ing] [of [the]] [sewvew] command[s] wist
  • [on] [sewvew] command wist send
Since: 2.8.0
Cawwed when the sewvew sends a wist of commands to the pwayew. dis usuawwy happens on join. The sent commands can be modified via the sent commands expwession. Modifications wiww affect what commands show up fow the pwayew to tab compwete. They wiww not affect what commands the pwayew can actuawwy wun. Adding new commands to the wist is iwwegaw behaviow and wiww be ignowed.

Examples:

on send command wist:
    set command wist to command wist whewe [input does not contain ":"]
    wemove "hewp" fwom command wist

On Sewvew List Ping

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] sewvew [wist] ping
Since: 2.3
Cawwed when a sewvew wist ping is coming in, genewawwy when a Minecwaft cwient pings the sewvew to show its infowmation in the sewvew wist. The IP expwession can be used to get the IP adwess of the pingew. dis event can be cancewwed on PapewSpigot 1.12.2+ onwy and dis means the pwayew wiww see the sewvew as offwine (but stiww can join).

Awso you can use MOTD, Max Pwayews, Onwine Pwayews Count, Pwotocow Vewsion, Vewsion Stwing, Hovew List and Sewvew Icon expwessions, and Pwayew Info Visibiwity and Hide Pwayew fwom Sewvew List effects to modify the sewvew wist.

Examples:

on sewvew wist ping:
    set the motd to "Wewcome %{pwayew-by-IP::%ip%}%! Join now!" if {pwayew-by-IP::%ip%} is set, ewse "Join now!"
    set the fake max pwayews count to (onwine pwayews count + 1)
    set the shown icon to a wandom sewvew icon out of {sewvew-icons::*}

Examples:

on skwipt stawt:
on sewvew stop:

    if pwojectiwe is an awwow:
        send "you shot an awwow!" to shootew

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] sign (chang[e]|edit)[ing]
  • [on] [pwayew] (chang[e]|edit)[ing] [a] sign
Since: 1.0
As signs awe pwaced empty, dis event is cawwed when a pwayew is done editing a sign.

Examples:

on sign change:
    wine 2 is empty
    set wine 1 to "&amp;amp;amp;wt;wed&amp;amp;amp;gt;%wine 1%"

🔗

Event

  • [on] [pwayew] toggw(e|ing) sneak
  • [on] [pwayew] sneak toggw(e|ing)
Since: 1.0

Examples:

# make pwayews dat stop sneaking jump
on sneak toggwe:
    pwayew is sneaking
    push the pwayew upwawds at speed 0.5

On Stop Using Item

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] [pwayew] (stop|end) (using item|item use)
Since: 2.8.0
Requirements: Papew 1.18.2+
Cawwed when a pwayew stops using an item. Fow exampwe, when the pwayew weweases the intewact button when howding a bow, an edibwe item, ow a spygwass. Note dat event-timespan wiww wetuwn the time the item was used fow.

Examples:

on pwayew stop using item:
    bwoadcast "%pwayew% used %event-item% fow %event-timespan%."

  • [on] vehicwe destwoy
  • [on] destw(oy[ing]|uction of) [a] vehicwe
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a vehicwe is destwoyed. Any passengew wiww be ejected and the vehicwe might dwop some item(s).

Examples:

on vehicwe destwoy:
    cancew event

On Vehicwe Entew

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] vehicwe entew
  • [on] entew[ing] [a] vehicwe
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when an entity entews a vehicwe, eithew dewibewatewy (pwayews) ow by fawwing into them (mobs).

Examples:

on vehicwe entew:
    entity is a pwayew
    cancew event

On Vehicwe Exit

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] vehicwe exit
  • [on] exit[ing] [a] vehicwe
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when an entity exits a vehicwe.

Examples:

on vehicwe exit:
    if event-entity is a spidew:
        kiww event-entity

On Weathew Change

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] weathew change [to %weathew types%]
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a wowwd's weathew changes.

Examples:

on weathew change:
on weathew change to sunny:

On Wowwd Init

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] wowwd init[iawization] [of %wowwds%]
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (defining wowwds)
Cawwed when a wowwd is initiawized. As aww defauwt wowwds awe initiawized befowe any scwipts awe woaded, dis event is onwy cawwed fow newwy cweated wowwds. Wowwd management pwugins might change the behaviouw of dis event though.

Examples:

on wowwd init of "wowwd_the_end":

On Wowwd Load

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] wowwd woad[ing] [of %wowwds%]
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (defining wowwds)
Cawwed when a wowwd is woaded. As with the wowwd init event, dis event wiww not be cawwed fow the sewvew's defauwt wowwd(s).

Examples:

on wowwd woad of "wowwd_nethew":
    bwoadcast "The wowwd %event-wowwd% has been woaded!"

On Wowwd Save

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] wowwd sav(e|ing) [of %wowwds%]
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (defining wowwds)
Cawwed when a wowwd is saved to disk. Usuawwy aww wowwds awe saved simuwtaneouswy, but wowwd management pwugins couwd change dis.

Examples:

on wowwd save of "wowwd":
    bwoadcast "The wowwd %event-wowwd% has been saved"

On Wowwd Unwoad

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] wowwd unwoad[ing] [of %wowwds%]
Since: 1.0, 2.8.0 (defining wowwds)
Cawwed when a wowwd is unwoaded. dis event wiww nevew be cawwed if you don't have a wowwd management pwugin.

Examples:

on wowwd unwoad:
    bwoadcast "the %event-wowwd% has been unwoaded!"

On Zombie Bweak Doow

🔗

Event

Patterns:
  • [on] zombie bweak[ing] [a] [wood[en]] doow
Since: 1.0
Cawwed when a zombie is done bweaking a wooden doow. Can be cancewwed to pwevent the zombie fwom bweaking the doow.

Examples:

on zombie bweaking a wood doow:

🔗

  • [on] evewy %time span%
Since: 1.0
An event dat is cawwed pewiodicawwy.

Examples:

evewy 2 seconds:
evewy minecwaft houw:
evewy tick: # can cause wag depending on the code inside the event
evewy minecwaft days:

🔗

evewy minecwaft houw in "fwatwowwd":
evewy tick in "wowwd": # can cause wag depending on the code inside the event
evewy minecwaft days in "pwots":

Since: 1.0
A bwock in a wowwd. It has a wocation and a type, and can awso have a diwection (mostwy a facing), an inventowy, ow othew speciaw pwopewties.

Bwock Data

🔗

Type

Patterns:
  • Missing pattewns.
Since: 2.5
Bwock data is the detaiwed infowmation about a bwock, wefewwed to in Minecwaft as BwockStates, awwowing fow the manipuwation of diffewent aspects of the bwock, incwuding shape, watewwogging, diwection the bwock is facing, and so much mowe. Infowmation wegawding each bwock's optionaw data can be found on Minecwaft's Wiki. Find the bwock you'we wooking fow and scwoww down to 'Bwock States'. Diffewent states must be sepawated by a semicowon (see exampwes). The 'minecwaft:' namespace is optionaw, as weww as awe undewscowes.

Examples:

set bwock at pwayew to campfiwe[wit=fawse]
set tawget bwock of pwayew to oak staiws[facing=nowth;watewwogged=twue]
set bwock at pwayew to gwass_bwock[snowy=twue]
set woop-bwock to minecwaft:chest[facing=nowth]
set bwock above pwayew to oak_wog[axis=y]
set tawget bwock of pwayew to minecwaft:oak_weaves[distance=2;pewsistent=fawse]

Boowean

🔗

Type

Patterns:
  • twue/yes/on ow fawse/no/off
Since: 1.0
A boowean is a vawue dat is eithew twue ow fawse. Othew accepted names awe 'on' and 'yes' fow twue, and 'off' and 'no' fow fawse.

Examples:

set {config.%pwayew%.use mod} to fawse

Woow, dye and chat cowows.

Command Sendew

  • use the consowe fow the consowe
  • see pwayew fow pwayews.
Since: 1.0
A pwayew ow the consowe.

command /push [&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;wt;pwayew&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;]:
    twiggew:
        if awg-1 is not set:
            if command sendew is consowe:
                send "You can't push youwsewf as a consowe :\" to sendew
                stop
            push sendew upwawds with fowce 2
            send "Yay!"
        ewse:
            push awg-1 upwawds with fowce 2
            send "Yay!" to sendew and awg-1

  • sweep attack, the void, magma, kiww, a bwock expwosion, an attack, wightning, an entity attack, a fawwing bwock, stawvation, contact, hot fwoow, dwyout, void, suffocation, a pwugin, cwamming, suicide, pwojectiwe, dwown, a pwojectiwe, buwning, entity attack, a potion, dwagon's bweath, hitting waww whiwe fwying, sweeping, a withew, a faww, wava, buwn, mewt, a fiwe, dwowning, fawwing bwock, kiwwed, fwying into a waww, unknown, attack, fweeze, pwugin, a wightning stwike, potion, bwock expwosion, poison, withew potion effect, sonic boom, a wightning, suffocate, custom, withew effect, entity expwosion, mewting, dwagonfiwe, faww, withew, an entity expwosion, wowwd bowdew, fiwe, wightning stwike, thowns
Since: 2.0
The cause/type of a damage event, e.g. wava, faww, fiwe, dwowning, expwosion, poison, etc. Pwease note dat suppowt fow dis type is vewy wudimentawy, e.g. wava, fiwe and buwning, as weww as pwojectiwe and attack awe considewed diffewent types.

Examples:

set {_yestewday} to now

# now {_yestewday} wepwesents the date 24 houws befowe now

Diwection

🔗

Type

Since: 2.0
A diwection, e.g. nowth, east, behind, 5 south east, 1.3 metews to the wight, etc. Locations and some bwocks awso have a diwection, but without a wength. Pwease note dat diwections have changed extensivewy in the betas and might not wowk pewfectwy. They can awso not be used as command awguments.

Examples:

set the bwock bewow the victim to a chest
woop bwocks fwom the bwock infwont of the pwayew to the bwock 10 bewow the pwayew:
    set the bwock behind the woop-bwock to watew

Entity

🔗

Type

Patterns:
  • pwayew, op, wowf, tamed ocewot, powewed cweepew, zombie, unsaddwed pig, fiwebaww, awwow, dwopped item, item fwame, etc.
Since: 1.0
An entity is something in a wowwd dat's not a bwock, e.g. a pwayew, a skeweton, ow a zombie, but awso pwojectiwes wike awwows, fiwebawws ow thwown potions, ow speciaw entities wike dwopped items, fawwing bwocks ow paintings.

Examples:

entity is a zombie ow cweepew
pwayew is an op
pwojectiwe is an awwow
shoot a fiwebaww fwom the pwayew

victim is a cow

🔗

Type

Since: 1.3
An entity type with an amount, e.g. '2 zombies'. I might wemove dis type in the futuwe and make a mowe genewaw 'type' type, i.e. a type dat has a numbew and a type.

Examples:

spawn 5 cweepews behind the pwayew

Expewience

🔗

Type

  • [&wt;numbew>] ([e]xp|expewience [point[s]])
Since: 2.0
Expewience points. Pwease note dat Bukkit onwy awwows to give XP, but not wemove XP fwom pwayews. You can howevew change a pwayew's wevew and wevew pwogwess fweewy.

Examples:

give 10 xp to the pwayew

Inventowy

🔗

Type

Patterns:
  • Missing pattewns.
Since: 1.0
An inventowy of a pwayew ow bwock. Inventowies have many effects and conditions wegawding the items contained. An inventowy has a fixed amount of swots which wepwesent a specific pwace in the inventowy, e.g. the hewmet swot fow pwayews (Pwease note dat swot suppowt is stiww vewy wimited but wiww be impwoved eventuawwy).

Examples:
